choices: Run back to your bag to get your mobile 'phone
Try and find one of your friends to contact
Take advantage of the situation, and look for a girl with nice looking feet
Head towards an invigilator for help
Stay where you are until the exam is over
1.content:
Great. Another exam. Another exercise in futility, where your own ignorance is proven to you, showing you just how futile all of that revision had been last night. Why do you even bother?

You begin filing slowly into the examination hall with your fellow victims, noting the stern looks on the face of the invigilators scattered around by the few windows. Despondently, you dump your bag along with the others in the untidy heap beside the entrance, remembering just in time to put your mobile 'phone inside it.

You look around blearily, wondering where your designated seat is, while everyone else seems to know exactly where they are stationed.

Typical.

As you begin to wander, your thoughts drift. It's a perfect summer day outside, and all of the other university students who've finished their exams will be enjoying it, basking in the sunlight and having fun.

You've got another few hours before you can do the same, and even when you're done you won't be comforted. Your girlfriend is visiting her parents at the moment, and you'll be all alone.

But still, all alone in the summer sun is still preferable to this stinking exam hall.

Finally, by luck rather than judgement, you find your place. A weighty looking paper is waiting for you, and you take a deep breath.

Pause.

What just happened? This isn't the exam hall. There are all these incredibly high pillars, and the ground is rumbling in time with the sound of distant thunder.

Waitaminute.

This IS the exam hall, only now it's a lot bigger. Those rumblings are the footsteps of your fellow university students, and the pillars are the legs of the tables and chairs.

You have no idea how it happened, but somehow you've been shrunk, just like in one of those strange GTS stories that you've read on the web. You're an inch high, and surrounded by people who are very stressed indeed.

What do you do now?
1.title: Take your seats...

choices: Run down the aisle as fast as you can
Catch a lift from a giant
Work your way down slowly, underneath the desks
Wait until everyone is seated before going down the aisle
Try to get the woman to provide a 'distraction'
11.content:
Okay, not everyone has taken their seats yet (the earthquakes are testament to that fact), so there will still be people entering the hall when you head for your bag.

You could wait until things have settled down a bit, but the more people in the room means more bags piled on top of your own; at your size it's going to be hard enough opening the zip, let alone shifting several large objects off the top first.

There is the problem of being trodden on, though. The aisle is host to many giants walking back and forth, much larger and faster than you. They could crush you at any moment were you to head out there.

But could they not also provide a ride? If you jumped onto the foot of one of them, you could get to where you want to go a lot quicker and safer. Unless something were to go wrong...

You could avoid the whole sticky situation by using the desks themselves as cover. Fewer people are walking between the desks at ninety degrees to the aisle, so the main problem there would be the feet of those already seated, swinging about in a bored manner. For example, the ones right behind you are the sandalled feet of some young woman, who is experimenting with sliding her feet in and out of her shoes. It would be death for you if you got in the way.

Although, if you could panic her somehow, by making her think that there's an animal of some sort crawling on the floor, you could cause a distraction that should enable you to get to your bag unmolested. Risky, though.

But you're going to have to make a decision soon, one way or another.
11.title: Which Route?

choices: Take the risk and head for your bag now
Sweat it out and wait for the girl to leave
Run away and look elsewhere
111.content:
Deep breaths. Deep. Breaths.

You can't put it off forever, though. You'll have to make the sprint sooner or later. It's just so... daunting.

Right, after this next giant passes, then you're DEFINITELY going.

The crunching footsteps pass by.

Nothing for it, then. Away you go.

You would normally stick your head down and pump your arms and legs for all they're worth, for a little extra speed. Now, however, you really need to be able to see where you're going.

Thud.

A foot landing just inches from your left throws you off balance, knocks you down. You curl into a ball, arms protecting your head for all the good it will do, and mutter a hurried prayer to any god that may be listening.

Luck (or divine whimsy?) save you from a messy end this time, but now you'll have to be more careful, no more underestimating the speed of these behemoths.

The barrage of feet is avoided with care and grace this time, but when you finally reach the safety point of the bag drop zone, you collapse.

Deep breaths.

Getting to your feet, you quickly locate your bag, its off blue form looming above you like a slightly ill hillock.

A matter of a few moments to get in, get your 'phone and -

Footsteps. Instinctively, you run for the nearest cover, diving underneath a swaying bagstrap, swathing yourself in its shadow.

Another bag is deposited. It belongs to a girl, you guess, judging by the skirt that the owner is wearing. Nothing to worry about, in moments she'll be gone and you can be on your way.

Ah, not so simple. Moments pass and she's still there. You watch her, seeing her rummage around inside her cavernous hold-all (which, at this scale, really could hold all to your eyes). It finally clicks in your head what she's doing.

Rather than take her pens and other stationary out before entering the room to save time, she's looking for them now.

You wouldn't mind so much, but she can clearly see your bag from her position, and might spot you if you moved to it. On the other hand, if you wait for her to leave, there's a chance that some other person may drop their own bag on top of yours, and make your task all the harder.
111.title: A Slight Delay

choices: She sees you
Her bag drops on top of you
The fire alarm goes off, and students rush to get their bags
1111.content:
Meh. What are the chances of her looking down, you think to yourself? Once she's found her pens, she'll just drop her bag and walk off. No reason to remain here for fear of something that won't happen.

You dig your diminuitive feet into the helpful holds that the bags have available at this scale, and proceed to move upwards at a depressingly slow rate. But hey - it's not as if you're a professional climber, so there's nothing to be ashamed of.

The shadow of the giantess still falls upon you, and here is where you'll discover whether or not your conclusion was correct.
1111.title: Climbing

choices: Stay where you are
Climb further up the mountin
Burrow quickly into the pile
11111.content:
You hear the giantess gasp and you freeze, wondering if you've been spotted. Slowly your gaze follows the female mountain up to her face and you immediately become paralyzed as you stare into a pair of eyes bigger than you are, they are locked on you.

The giantess, holding her pens, stationery and bag with one hand, reaches towards you with the other. There are three possibilities: One, she thinks you're an insect and is going to squash you. Two, she is going to pick you up but will pinch you to death in the process. Three, she is going to pick you up and succeed.

As her gigantic digits home in you quickly consider whether to stay and let her do what she will or to try and get out of the way.
11111.title: Spotted!

choices: Help the poor, gigantic girl out
Tell her that cheating is wrong!
Cause a commotion
111111.content:
You decide against dodging the peach-orange tentacles inching closer, or rather your body makes the decision on your behalf. It seems your nerve endings aren't accepting commands at the moment due to the immense sense of terror your brain had chosen to send them beforehand. You instead opt to sit tight and hope your mystery classmate isn't too rough and tumble with you.

A pair of padded phalanges close in around your sides; one tall and slender, the other thick and fat. The feelers pinch tightly, squeezing your insignificant body painfully. Your arms are pinned by their pits in a raised pose. Kicking, yet not dare screaming, you are plucked from your vertical positioning and carried skyward. You hover in a painful state before a vibrant nebula of verdigris. Your arms are sore and stiff. Your calves are burning from useless flailing. You can feel bruises expanding on either of your sides, and your insides are searching for the nearest orifice from which to seep. At this point, you really regret not evading these crushing fingers.

Your face must have given an accurate depiction of your agony, for the pressure compressing you subsides slightly. Make no mistake, your torment is still quite great, but it no longer feels life threatening. As your view begins to zoom out from the ambiguously gorgeous iris, you take advantage of your newfound leeway and lower your arms. Once you've traversed a fair distance, the features of a face start to become recognizable on the inconceivably (really, you tried!) large oval of tan in front of you. A petite, bottled nose points directly at you. Delicately cared for eyebrows climb up a small sloped forehead questioningly, while thick purplish-black lashes guide carefully-painted-pink eyelids to and from their merging points. Below, red-doused soft lips move to create many indefinite expressions, altering ever so slightly the naturally carved formations hidden under blushed cheeks.

You manage the courage to speak first, "Do you think you could help me? Please?".

Countless unified charcoal filaments, originating from the top of your captor's head and flowing just past her dainty shoulders, jolt in your general direction as their base moves backward in shocked fashion. Apparently you weren't expected to speak. You seem to have driven the point that you are real home to this giantess, but that slick smile crossing her thin lips gives you little cause for celebration.

"Sure I'll help you", your classmate whispers snidely, "If", you should have known there was going to be an if, "you get me through this exam. I have no clue what I'm doing, and I know you're here for the exam, too".

You wonder if she is only guessing since you happen to be in the exam hall before realizing that you actually have a name to tie to this monolithic figure. Maggie. You don't know her very well, but the two of you were in the same group for that ridiculous mid-term presentation Professor Bradford assigned. Maggie seems to recognize you as well, and she must be pretty desperate to be turning to you for help in this class! In any case, you don't really have much choice here, do you?
111111.title: To get along...

choices: relieved.
malicious.
bored.
1111111.content:
"Sure", you eagerly take the deal, "But I'm not sure how much help I'll be. I kinda coasted through this class".

"You know more than I do", Maggie quietly assures, "Trust me".

Maggie effortlessly tosses her aircraft carrier-sized back pack atop the pile, sending a deafening thud through the air. Motion sickness begins to overtake your stomach as Maggie journeys back to her seat with you still clenched between the triturating thumb and forefinger of her whimsically undulating left hand. Luckily for you, she is sitting near the back, so the trip is quite short.

You are set inconsiderately onto a cold gray terrace stretching from the aisle to the brown carpeted wall. Despite the carelessness of your landing, you are grateful to be rid of the clutching digits and their torturous ways. Looking around, you see only one other student is assigned to this row, and he is stationed as far away as possible. You turn your attention to the stack of stapled papers standing beside you, feeling no need to study the scantron sheet on your other side. Stepping onto the exam sheet, the first thing you notice is that it is impossible for you to decipher the large, thick markings of your floor from so close. You shout as much up to the megalithic girl as you struggle to take your eyes off of her ample bosoms concealed by bright yellow fabric. Maggie doesn't seem capable of hearing you tiny voice from the new separation of elevation between the two of you, as is evidenced by the awkward look written into her face. Your punishing chariot swoops down upon you once again, this time carrying you on an agonizing venture to her right ear.

"I can't read the questions from so close", you repeat yourself.

Without saying a word, Maggie's free hand moves behind the ear in which you face. Prodigious fingers pull a locket of pitch black hair from a tucked stash behind its top. The great appendages bring the dark strands to you, clearly insinuating for you to take hold. You do so, and not a moment to soon! Maggie's grip on you releases without warning, an action that would have surely plummeted you to your death had you not grabbed onto the provided strands. You shrug off the shivers sent down your spine at such thoughts, and hang in rappelling fashion from Maggie's hair, your puny sneakers standing on the back end of her jaw bone. She tilt you closer to the paper, and you start to examine the exam.

Why couldn't you have shrank after the exam?! For the first time in your collegiate career, you actually had all the answers! With brisk confidence, you explain to the dark cave-like ear about the specifics of vectors, advanced calculations of things like force and velocity, and even how wavelengths are generated. You can't help but add the occasional criticism or comment regarding the wordings of certain questions and the additions of certain last minute material by the stingy professor to your lecturing. Maggie doesn't seem to mind, sometimes even nodding in agreement (much to your dismay). A particular crack about Dr. Bradford's questionable sexual orientation, made for no reason in particular, actually generates a quickly muzzled cackle from the enormous girl. After a brief apology, she refocuses on her test, ignoring the cold stares from classmates and invigilators.

Maggie finishes bubbling in your last answer, and rises from her seat. She doesn't think to place you in a safer place as she walks to the front of the lecture hall to turn in her exam. You aren't about to complain as you sway with the gentle wind her motion makes, though. Anything is better than those fingers again! Nevertheless, this new experience isn't very pleasant either.

Maggie slams the bulky sheets of white wrapped around the marked paper triumphantly onto the desk in front of Dr. Bradford. She returns to the back of the room, you swinging by several threads of black all the while. You receive a small fright as she slips the wide straps of her back pack over her shoulders. The flattening material lands several feet from you, the weight from the contents of the attached bag straining it, but you still consider that a tad too close for comfort.

You soon find yourself outside in the open Summer air. After moving along a little more, Maggie finds a place where she seems comfortable addressing you. You are yet again squeezed by her massive thumb and index finger. You let go of your black supports, and grind out the ride back to Maggie's face. A face that looks...
1111111.title: ...you gotta go along

choices: You ask for Maggie to retrieve your bag from the exam hall
You ask Maggie to take you to a science teacher
You ask Maggie to take you home with her
11111111.content:
"Thanks for that, pal," Maggie says. "Now you want some help as well, huh? I suppose that I can manage that. Now speak loud and clear, and tell momma Maggie what the trouble is."

Between the thumb and finger you are whisked before the ear again, its darkened recesses somehow expectant. And now that it comes down to it, you're unsure exactly what boon you should ask for in this situation.
11111111.title: In Exchange

choices: Allow Maggie to help you
Insist that Maggie get your bag
Blackmail her with the fact that she cheated
111111111.content:
"Really?" Maggie gasps. "Okay, but that seems a little... unambitious."

"I need to get hold of my phone. There are people I need to contact, someone out there that can help me!"

"I can help you," Maggie asserts, indignation rising in her voice, vibrating you even at your great remove. "Forget that junk, just use me as a go-between. By now, your bag will already be being tidied away, and they'll never believe that it's mine."

You are brought around before those eyes again, wide open and earnest.

"If I go back for your bag, I'll be taking some risks. I'll do it, of course I will, but I think it'd be better if we just write it off as a lost cause, buddy."

Do you want to ask your tentatively-trustworthy friend to risk being caught stealing? Or do you feel ready to put more of your life in her hands than you already have?
111111111.title: Always Option One

choices: The door is locked
A renowned professor walks out
A crowd rushes up and brushes up against Maggie
111111112.content:
"Do...you think...you...could take me...to...McAllister Hall?", the crushing pressure of Maggie's fingers is becoming too much for you.

Maggie's quizzically annoyed voice is softened by its trek around her gingerly veiled reddish-pink cheek, "What's wrong with you?".

"Your grip...is...kinda...tight", you struggle to choke out the words.

A feeling of weightlessness whelms you at the outright release from your pinching imprisonment. Reality, along with gravity, takes hold of the situation, pulling you down to earth with merciless speed. Your drop soon ends with an abrupt pratfall onto a dense, damp landing. You run your hand along the shallow fissure stretching across the bouncy whitish ground. As the warm flab wets your palm a backlash of air strikes your back. You're moving, and rather swiftly at that. Thankfully your seated position spares you the embarrassment of falling over yourself in feeble efforts to maintain your balance.

Your ride comes to a stop, facing you with a familiar, yet amazingly different sight. The beautifully green campus of your respective university takes on a whole new life through your tiny eyes! The old cedar tree outside Birch Hall, a popular study site (or so you're told), climbs the cloudless soft blue sky with menacing claws of willow. Lines of lilac bushes appear as bustling metropolises of bright pink with pedal laden apartments occupied by car-sized bees. Below, countless spikes of dark green lay in wait with impaling desires. And over there...

"Hey!", your hands cover your ears as you shake violently at the earth shattering voice emanating from behind, "Over here".

You come to your feet and turn around. Prissily overlapping lips meet your gaze. Uniquely blue-green eyes sink to the bottom of their sockets for a better look at you.

"You gotta speak up about things like that", Maggie is obviously referencing your previous complaint, "Unless you wanna go squish on accident".

You shudder at the thought as Maggie's hot breath flows over you, stifling briefly your own oxygen supply. The volume of her voice is lowered significantly, but it still serves as an unpleasant experience to be addressed so near her up-curled mouth.

"But yeah", Maggie continues, "I can take you to McAllister. You wanna go see some scientists, right?".

"That's right", you shout back.

"I hope they don't dissect you or something", Maggie implants a horrible thought in your brain.

Upon your lack of a response, Maggie chimes in cheerily, "Kidding! Man, some people can't take a joke".

Your unamused stare gets a rise out of Maggie as she begins her transport of you to the campus science building. The two of you chat a bit along the way, though nothing important comes up. You eventually arrive at the famed McAllister Hall, a three story gray-bricked building housed by a triangular roof. Maggie approaches the glass double doored entrance and reaches for the cylindrical silver handle.
111111112.title: To the science department

choices: Maggie refuses to hand you over
Maggie gives you to the creepy professor
Maggie proposes an exchange
1111111122.content:
The door opposite Maggie swings open as a European looking gentleman in a white lab coat hurriedly passes through the temporarily unprotected doorway. Instinctively, you suppose, Maggie slips her right hand behind her back, giving you another unpleasant ride. This time you do tumble onto your stomach while your flesh elevator sinks as well as maneuvers around Maggie's trim, yet majestic abdomen. You feel her dewy palm drench your front side immediately upon your collision. The nervous sweat has always been one of the many reasons you despise exams, but now it has moved to the top of the list.

You decide that, since you're here, you might as well get up and have a look-see at Maggie's posterior. Wrapped in tight cutoff jean shorts, each bun of the massive buttocks stands as a sideways domed coliseum of denim from your crack-aligned viewpoint. Moving your eyes downward, past the jagged end to the cerulean material, you admire Maggie's golden tanned legs. Man, those things just keep going! A rush of dizziness rushes over you at the very late realization of just how high up you really are.

You regain clarity in your head, and figure you've had enough of the appealing and mortifying view. Instead, you choose to eavesdrop on the conversation taking place high above.

"Hey, watch it!", you recognize Maggie's irked tone, "Wait a minute. I know you".

"How nice for you", a clearly foreign voice insults.

Maggie ignores the rude comment, "Yeah, you're that famous professor from Denmark who just moved here, right?"

"Yes", the clearly annoyed man answers, "And you must be that idiotic student holding me up and wasting my time!".

"Wasting your time?!", Maggie doesn't sound too pleased, "Is this wasting your time?!".

You've caught on to how these things work, and you crouch in preparation of what's coming. Sure enough, your transport flies upward with great velocity. Able to keep your feet, you stand back up as you are proudly presented to the know-it-all snob.

"Wh-what is this?", the Nordic-skinned man asks shockingly.

You feel the need to introduce yourself, "Hello, Dr. Gadsby. I'm..."

"It talks?!", the world famous professor cuts you off.

Looking at the doctor's rough face, you are overcome with a new level in horror. At least your female companion's stunning good looks provided a mild distraction from your predicament. This hopefully knowledgeable stranger just looks as though he is going to crush you.

"Yeah he talks!", you can't tell if Maggie is legitimately offended on your behalf or if she simply wants to stick it to the obnoxious man, "Can you help him or not?".

"You must give it to me", Dr. Gadsby says with creepy excitement, "The proper research must be conducted on it as soon as possible".

Maybe it was his tone, or perhaps the fact that he can only call you it, but you don't feel very comfortable in the presence of the good doctor. In fact, the only thought in your brain is a remembrance of Maggie's crack about you being dissected. You glance up at your titanic benefactor's face, and see an alien expression showing. Concern. She must be thinking the same thing.

Professor Gadsby seems to be loosing his patience, "I don't have all day, child! Hand it over now!".
1111111122.title: Dr. Feelgood?

choices: Insist that she takes you to the science building
Express relief at just surviving, and allow her to take you home
Ask her to leave you here on your own
11111111221.content:
"No."

That simple word instantly washes away all the doubt and uncertainty you held regarding Maggie's custodianship of you. You don't have long to think on it though, as fingers close around you - far too quickly to guarantee comfort - and their owner takes off at speed, running away from Gadsby and the science building. It is muffled by the pulsing mass around you, but you can still hear his screech:

"Come back here! It must be mine, foolish girl!"

You didn't think people talked like that in real life. Maybe it sounds better in Danish.

The pressure from the woman's hand is almost too much for you to take, and your body mercifully allows you to pass out before it gets too intense. Your eyes open again, flickering, to Maggie's concerned visage in the sky. "Sorry... that I didn't... speak up about that one..." you manage, and the tears on her face are splashed aside as she gives a bark of laughter.

"Thank God," she says, "I don't know what I would have done if... Never mind. That doctor seems to be pulling out all the stops to find me, Campus security are snooping around. I hope that you don't want to go back to the science building any time soon."

The worry writ large (like, really, really large) on Maggie's face does not pass without effect on you. Can you really ask her to go through all this just to get you closer to some doctor that isn't as mad as Gadsby? Or should you put aside your own needs for the moment, and let her carry you away out of the danger zone, to lie low for a while?
11111111221.title: How About: No

choices: Get up and do some serious thinking
The new plan is to sleep and come up with another plan later
Maggie's room-mate disrupts all plans
111111112212.content:
"No", your answer brings relief to Maggie's beautiful face, "I think I'd like to live at least a little while longer, so I should probably stay away from there".

"Fair enough", Maggie vainly attempts to speak in a casual manner, "I guess that means I'm stuck with you then, huh?".

"I guess so", you respond plainly.

"Well, come on then", Maggie mockingly invites.

Your retort is filled with sarcasm, "Right behind you".

Four large trees of flesh curl around you in a sudden movement. No, Maggie didn't ask if you minded being handled in such a way. And no, those pressuring fingers, while covered in warm, flexible armor, aren't exactly massaging your body. You don't mind, though. You know where Maggie's loyalty lies, and in a predicament where that's the only thing that really matters, she's the only person you can truly say such a thing about. You'll endure.

After a short while, you are once again exposed to open air. Your lungs greedily suck in unrecycled oxygen, a welcome change from your aphotic holding place. Your eyes wander the area, providing your brain with the proper information to place your location. You're indoors, obvious from the four walls of white concrete brick and the even whiter ceiling which they are supporting. The floor consists of ever-cloning ceramic tiles. There are two cheaply made dressers paired next to two formerly bunked beds in symmetrical fashion, the rooms lone window serving as the dividing line. But it is those infamously shelf-less, uncovered closets that give you the answer you seek. You must be in one of the on-campus dormitories.

"Is this...Carter Hall?", you ask in semi-disbelief.

Maggie seems slightly annoyed at your question, "So what if it is?".

You are quick to explain yourself, "Well, it's just sort of odd that a senior would still live in the dorms, you know?".

"I'm only a third year", Maggie corrects, "And besides, I like living on-campus. You don't have a problem with that, do you?".

Maggie's face deliberately moves closer, her nose hovering inches from you, almost daring you to register a complaint. You refuse to oblige, however.

"Not at all", you play off the intimidation factor Maggie's pose presents.

"Good", Maggie states definitively.

With a tilt of her hand, Maggie sends you tumbling from her palm. You fall only a few feet before landing on a uniquely feeling surface. The lavender ground directly beneath you is of a fluffy substance, yet there is a rock-hard stiffness lingering underneath. The mammoth hill of matching purple to your back tells you that you are on a standard dorm bed. As you figure this out, Maggie's unannounced arrival onto the sleeping apparatus throws your lightweight body from its position on the soft terrain. You come down a fair distance closer to the pillow.

Maggie's extraordinarily large face stands directly in front of you, beaming, from a perched position on overlapping hands. Black hairs scatter about on either side of her, creating still life streams of sable against the amethyst land. In the distant overhead, you can see Maggie's calves carelessly kicking up and down, her sandal-clad feet catching against the rugged wall before her legs can straighten. It is truly a breath taking sight.

"Are you okay?", Maggie seems a bit concerned.

You realize that you've been laying flat lined against the smooth landscape for several minutes now, limbs outstretched. It may look as though you are in need of help, but nothing could be further from the truth. For the first time since you shrank, you are truly in a state of complete and total comfort. The intense soreness consuming your body melts away as your muscles finally allow themselves to relax.

Your response conveys your feelings well, "Never been better".

"Good", as Maggie says this, you find it amazing how words can take on whole new meanings based solely on tone.

"So", Maggie brings about a subject change, "what's the new game plan?".

You knew you forgot about something.
111111112212.title: To the dorms

choices: On your pillow with you
On the nightstand
On the floor
1111111122122.content:
"Sleep," you respond. "Not that I did much but shrink, run four miles to a mountain and then procced to climb that mountain."

"I found a shrunken person, told off a famous scientist and am now on a wanted list; I didn't do much at all today," Maggie says, getting into the game.

You yawn loudly...well to someone your size that is. Maggie beats your yawn by a mile, producing a roar that could shake the Himalayas.

"So, where would you like to sleep?" Maggie asks.
1111111122122.title: The new plan is to sleep and come up with anoth...

choices: Maggie starts tossing and turning.
You wake up.
Some insects come out at night
11111111221221.content:
Still recovering from the awe of Maggie's supersized beauty, you take a second to regroup your words so that they don't come out as an embarassing stutter: "If you don't mind, I'll choose the pillow next to you. I don't want to invade your personal space or anything, it just feels a lot safer to me."
You stretch the last four words, having subconsciously realized how odd they sounded from your voice. Safer? She's going to take that as a bullshit excuse to snuggle up, you surmise, waiting for her answer. The giantess returns with a coy smile, and her previous dam of separation deteriorates. Her head bobs in agreement, and strands of hair you never would have noticed at your regular size drift down rom her head. Regular hair loss, like any human being. Actually, you recall reading somewhere that the average human loses a hundred to two hundred strands of hairs a day, naturally.

You can't help but have your thoughts drift back to Maggie again, but you do your best to push them aside as she shifts to a more comfortable position on the bed, inadverdantly revealing her bouncing cleavage from the movement. So absorbed were you that you didn't notice the aftershocks going through the bed until they toppled you over, sending you flat on your back. Your cheeks flashed red from embarassment, and you see your new friend trying to suppress a chuckle playing on her lips. After a few seconds of sifting through whwther or not you can laugh at yourself at this point, you oblige to your vocal chords. Maggie follows suite, and then pats a place on the pillow near her neck, showing you where to go. You emit one more yell of thanks and tramp through the bumpy bedspread toward the spot, then lay down to rest.

Hours later...
11111111221221.title: A Nap

choices: The rest of the night goes fine.
Maggie rolls over in your direction!
Maggie awakens with a shout!
111111112212211.content:
Your eyes snap open to the real world. Surprisingly, you had slipped into such a deep sleep that you hadn't exactly been aware of it when sleep had finally come to you. It had been pretty hard to in such a strange enviroment, and this was the first time sleeping in a new place, and not to mention at an inch tall. You hope at least Maggie was getting a good rest in for tomorrow, because you know that if she's a third year that there must a tough one. The last exam in a row was always the toughest for some reason, and you remember it from last year. The sheets suddenly formed cresting waves all around you, and you feel yourself rolling a few inchs to the left. What the hell was that?

You dimly recollect feeling one of those aftershocks right before waking up, so it must have been what had jarred you from such a deep sleep. So this was more than a sleepless night, you think, hoping there wouldn't be another movement. To make sure, you peek your head out to look at what Maggie was doing, and your suspicions are proved correct. Your larger than life friend was tossing and turning in her sleep, mumbling some sort of gibberish through absent-minded murmurs. You're actually not as worreid as you maybe should have been, because you know that as long as you wait it out the girl would eventually return to a peaceful rest. But still, you were going to duck underneath the little rumple you were behind.
111111112212211.title: Fitful Stirs

choices: Sleepless Night
Morning
A Dream...
11111111221222.content:
"I'll take the night-stand" you answer, looking at what is pretty much a mountain to you. Your giant friend however, helps you in getting to position and sits you on the corner. An alarm clock, lamp, some stuff animals and even a pair of socks mock your stature on the plain. "Great, I'm a midget to a toy animal."

"Not even knee high," Maggie says, kicking her shoes off and lying in bed. You watch her enormous feet come next to the night stand, at the foot of the bed. "Still, you're bigger to him than you are to me."

You look at the bear and find while he isn't as big as Maggie, you'd need a ladder to get onto his leg with any sort of ease, as it was a full double your height and the foot is even bigger. There are a few ways to sleep here. Build a bed, just sleep on the giant bear, cuddle up inside its clothes for blankets. It's a long list.

Suddenly, a wind whips by your head and you're knocked over. The lazy giant had just flung her socks in this general direction and nearly crushed you under them! Standing up, you look to the bear and consider just how to go about doing this as you partially undress, stripping to just underwear and your shirt; it is just too damn hot. Now you just have to watch that the articles - too small even for dolls - don't get lost. Thinking about that, being too small for a doll, you realize most doll clothes would cover a house to you.
11111111221222.title: On the nightstand

choices: On the bed
Even smaller
Back in the exam hall.  Was it a dream..?
111111112212221.content: The night isn't going well. Noises are coming from everywhere. At one point you feared being eaten by a spider. You close you eyes tight and try to sleep; when you open them, you're...
111111112212221.title: Sleepless Night

choices: stay put, hoping that Maggie will notice your even smaller form.
move, scared she may crush you unknowingly.
forget the giant world, and give in to despair.
1111111122122212.content:
A sudden rush of air around you makes you open your eyes, despite being tired - after events of the past day everything around you feels like a potential threat. You look around to see there are no immediate dangers near. It does not seem that anything has changed, as a matter of fact - the room is still dark in the middle of the night, Maggie still looms like a mountain range on the bed, the stuffed bear's leg still towers over you like a skyscraper... wait a minute - wasn't it just about double your height just moments ago?

You stand up and try to figure out what happened. After a moment you figure it may be nice to know how much smaller have you become, but it seems that you are simply too small to compare with enormous objects surrounding you - especially in the dark. After a while, however, you notice a penny lying in the distance (to you at least - it is barely the other side of the nightstand) and decide to walk towards it to see your size and maybe figure out what to do next.

After what seems like forever, you reach the coin only to notice that you can barely see the top - but only when on your toes, which makes you what.. 1/16th of an inch tall?

A train of thoughts goes through your head and eventually you decide to...
1111111122122212.title: Even smaller

choices: footfalls in the distance - Maggie already woke up and forgot about you!
Maggie stretching up on her bed, looking in your direction.
...a spider crawling down its web towards you
11111111221222121.content:
After careful consideration, you figure out, that it should be safer to stay on the night stand, especially that you have no idea what else to do at such minuscule size. You realise that being smaller may actually protect you from being seen by some insects and other monsters, but will Maggie remember and - more importantly - notice you... you wonder while taking a look back at her, sleeping on her back. God, she was huge to you before... but now the playful comparison to a mountain range is actually very accurate - complete with two peaks visible through the cover. Her every breath moves them noticeably up and down, displacing or sucking in - you shudder - incalculable amounts of air. Strangely though, the view is rather peaceful and you enjoy a break from the chaotic events yesterday.

A sudden movement of Maggie puts an end your relaxation - simple act of rolling on her stomach creates a hurricane wind that throws you back to hit something and lose consciousness.

You awake to the sounds of...
11111111221222121.title: Hoping for the best.

choices: We have to find help before it gets even worse...
Aww, I was hoping for a little morning fun, but now you may be too small...
Wait here a moment
111111112212221212.content:
With a strong headache you awake lying next to the penny, you were comparing you size against and eventually thrown into - you recall - only to have your recollection of the previous day disrupted by the sounds - and sights, when you turn your eyes in that direction - of Maggie waking up. A simple movement being just stretching up in the bed to you seems more like a geological process at work, with a major difference of time period being measured in seconds instead of centuries - the scale remains the same, though. She rises her arms over her head and flexes her legs, pulling covers down to display a magnificent view of her mountainous bra-clad breasts. You only marvel the overall sight unable to do do anything - and even then, what could you do?

After stretching Maggie slowly opens her sleepy eyes and with a hazy smile, she lazily leans towards the night stand you are lying on. She begins scanning it, obviously looking for you - but you realise she has no idea that you have shrunk even more - so you begin to jump and wave to her. This continues for some time, she eventually rises upwards and moves her elbow forward for support to lean closer and you decide to climb on top of the coin you awoke next to and continue your morning exercise for attention.

Eventually her eyes focus on you and she stares at you for a moment with surprised at first and then concerned look. "You shrunk again..." she states the obvious. Unable to respond or otherwise communicate with her at your current insect size you simply stay put awaiting her next action. After what to you seems like an eternity of being studied by her swimming pool sized eyes, she says:
111111112212221212.title: Even smaller realization.

choices: She has a memory for names and didn't want to hurt you before she plays with you
She has liked you, very much, and for a long time...
She works for the people who performed this experiment on you
1111111122122212122.content:
You look back at her with shock and disbelief: "What kind of morning fun?" you ask nobody in particular - as it is obvious she cannot even notice the fact you are speaking, let alone make out the words. Weighing your options you look at her in a different light: face of this gigantic monument of feminine beauty fills your entire view, like a hundred IMAX screens put together - and the rest of her body stretches back as far as you can see in the background. Escape is obviously impossible - it would have taken you ten minutes to traverse her night stand and what then? Her slightly mischievous smile makes you wonder what her real intentions of bringing you here were - maybe she simply wanted to have you all for herself? She always treated you rather roughly, was she actually enjoyed the power she had over you?

Breaking the chain of thought, she adds "Maybe we can figure something out" and raises her free arm towards you. Left with no choice, you just wait as she lays her hand on the other side of the penny next to you - the resulting quake almost makes you fall back. You look around to see the side of the little finger towering above your tiny form, even while standing on the platform-like coin (which was big only to you, you realise). She looks a bit puzzled: "Right... you're too small to climb up, lets try a nail...", she mutters and rearranges her hand to allow you to climb the underneath of her nails. At least she did not try to pick you up, you notice with relief. Even though she put her fingers just next to the penny, considering your size, it was still a sizeable distance - including the walk across the coin, on which one could easily build a house.. complete with a large garden, if it was possible to grow anything on brass.

You walk slowly, hoping that she notices how puny and fragile you are now. Just before boarding her nail you look back and think what can she possibly have in store for you. Maggie waits for you to settle on her nail, which basically consists of moving deeper and sitting down just where the skin was joining the underside - "God how huge she is", you take note of the fact again.

She then slowly brings you close to her eye - so now her iris is taking up almost entire horizon - and continues to study with her penetrating gaze. Hoping that even though she will not be able to hear you, but maybe at least she will notice that you want to speak to her, you put your hands to your mouth in a shouting kind-of position and move your mouth as wide open as you can. "I can't hear you", she whispers - obviously, as you were not trying to reach her with your minuscule voice. "Wait", she adds and rearranges herself so she can put you next to her ear. The sudden movement almost causes you to fall down from her nail, but fortunately she cups it upwards in a more secure position. You notice the world rotating and falling down, which suggests she is probably sitting up in her bed - but you cannot see anything below her finger and you dare not to peek out.

After this monumental movement is complete, Maggie uses her newly freed hand to push her hair aside and brings you to her ear. It was huge during the exam, but now... "Good God, it is a true cavern now", you think, unable to comprehend the immense scale of things. You have almost given up all hope - if she wants to use you, then she will and there is nothing you can even remotely do against it. Hell, she could kill you without even noticing it - actually, you may be alive only because she remembered about the previous day's adventures. Resigned you just shout: "Please don't hurt me.". She jolts immediately - which tells you she must have heard it - and after a while, speaks "What do you.. mean? How... why would I want to... hurt you..." and pauses - obviously confused and waiting for your answer. On one hand you are relieved that her intentions are not that bad, it seems, on the other you feel incredibly stupid after accusing Maggie of scary things - a simple plead you shouted must have been shocking to her, after all - she was only trying to help you so far and the fear was clearly a result of your delusions.

You try to calm her and explain, shouting "I... I'm sorry, it's just that you are so big now.. and I was scared of what that.. morning fun was about...", you babble unsure what to say really, hoping she will not want to investigate it any further. After that she moves you back in front of her face, only not too close - so you can see most of it - and with firm and serious stare at you, she says definitely "I would never hurt you, <your name here>." followed by a long silence, contemplating you. Thoughts race through your head, most notably: "What does she mean by that?" - without an answer, "Have I told her my name? Why would she remember my name?" you think that you only remembered hers, because she was elected a leader for that mid-term project (as the only girl in the team, if you can recall correctly), while you couldn't possibly have done anything to bring enough attention, so again.. what did she mean?
1111111122122212122.title: What kind of "morning fun"...

choices: Indicate that Maggie should show you to her room-mate
Convey the need for you to be hidden from her room-mate
No time!  Run and hide!
11111111221222121221.content:
"I was only joking," Maggie slurs. "Trying to make light of this. I mean, you must be terrified, I imagine. Big ol' me, I've got to put on a brave face, bear your burden; I've got to be reliable for you..."

Unbidden, tears well at her eyes like twin waterfalls, and you desperately search for some way to comfort her, to get across your gratitude, but nothing you can express would carry across to that face, that horizon...

"You crying?" another voice cuts in, not whispering, deafening, from somewhere out of sight behind this fingernail you stand by. Of course! Maggie's room has two beds - she must have a room-mate! Question is, do you want to be shown to her? A goofy pantomime should convey to Maggie whether or not you want to hide, so you prepare your best acting muscles.
11111111221222121221.title: Take a Joke?

choices: Unnoticed, you are on the room-mate's t-shirt
Struggling to survive, you lie on Maggie's leg
In great peril, you are on the carpet between four giant feet
111111112212221212211.content:
You stand straight, arms spread wide and present yourself. Maggie's immense eye somehow absorbs the message your 1/16" pantomime is trying to convey, and your world swirls as she brings her finger down, before her immense body.

Steadying yourself on her nail, you look across the vastness of her room to its other occupant, an equally titanic woman whose form is easier to discern: given that she stands a few feet away from you, you can see almost all of her!

She's dressed in her nightclothes, an oversize t-shirt with what you assume to be an abstract band logo, and peeking just below that a pair of shorts. Her messy hair is an unkempt mass of red with darkened roots, her face wide and expressive as she yawns.

"Uh, it's nothing," Maggie replies to her question, sniffing loudly as her free hand wipes the tears away, smearing across her skin with powerful force and a scarily audible scraping sound. "It's just-"

"Don't say a word," her room-mate says, striding across the gap between them swiftly, arms widening for an embrace. You're still on Maggie's outstretched finger, yet to be revealed, and there's no time before you are enveloped between two female gods.

The room-mate's chest strikes your position gently from her perspective, merely nudging the hand to one side, but then to you it's the end of the world, your perch soon shattered!

"Let it all out," the room-mate comforts as you fall, the incredible volume of her words shattering your calm even further.

"Hey! Careful!" Maggie shouts, an even greater explosion of sound that overrides your senses entirely, leaving you oblivious as you tumble to land. "I've dropped him!"
111111112212221212211.title: Two Means Trouble

choices: She stars to sleep walk
She wakes up and forgets about you.
More choices
More choices
More choices
11111111221223.content: You tell Maggie you want to sleep on the floor. She looks at you with a weird look and says sure but on 1 condition. You ask her what it is and she replies, you have to use my panties as your bed and sleep in the pocket so you are covered up. You look at Maggie in shock while blushing you studder and agree. She smiles and lays out a clean pair of panties and puts you into the inside pocket and says good night. You say good night back and then she turns off the light when suddenly...
11111111221223.title: On the floor

choices: It's no use...
Make a dash for it!
Brace yourself
11112.content: A large shadow is darkening around you, when you look up, you notice her bag falling straight for you. You panic a bit and start to think fast. Is this the end of you, or will you try to make a dash for your life from underneath the approaching bag? Time is short, and you don't have much longer to act as it barrels for you.
11112.title: Her bag drops on top of you

choices: Succumb to Fate...
You wake up later...
You respond with a sudden surge of strength
111121.content: The bag slams down onto your tiny body and slowly starts crushing you into the floor. You slowly try to make your way for the edge of the bag, but it's not much use, you slowly go unconscious from the heavy bag. Your thoughts race as you do this, always thinking, "Is this the end?" Soon, even your thoughts are gone from going unconscious.
111121.title: It's no use...

1111211.content: You succumb to your fate moments later, bodily functions shut down, your body continues to be crushed as she moves the bag every now and then, making you nothing but a little spot on her bag and the floor. After the exam, she looks at the spot, and just thinks it was a bug, putting not much effort into why the stain was colored more red. She goes home, empties the bag, and washes the stain clean from the fabric, forgetting all about it.
1111211.title: Succumb to Fate...

choices: Run for the zip
Wait a bit
Abandon this crazy plan!
1112.content:
The moments that pass seem like hours. eventually the girl stands up again, showing off her immense height, and steps over you and away.

Now's your chance! You run over to the bag pile, scrambling through tiny gaps between the bags that you wouldn't really have noticed at your old size, until you come to your bag.

The zip is done all the way up, but luckily the zipper itself is at the top; you'll have to pull it down, not push it up.

Then a shadow falls over you. An ominous object is above you, another bag about to be placed over your own! You could run for the zip now, hoping not to be crushed, or you could wait for the bag to be lowered and try to find the zip in total darkness. What's it to be?
1112.title: Darkness Falls

choices: squeeze through
drop off and run
Climb for higher ground
11121.content:
You reach the foot of the zip quickly, and scrabble up it like it were a ladder.

It's not a hard climb, and soon you clamber atop the zipper itself. Your only problem now is pulling it down with your miniscule weight.

Correction. The mountainous bag slowly blocking out all light could be considered a problem as well. With a crunch it is placed somewhere above you. You fervantly hope that it's balanced sufficiently, so that it doesn't fall and crush you...

You desperately try to drag the zipper down, but it seems to have no give at all. The creaking noise that you can distantly hear may well be the bag pile teetering before it falls. Come on, open!

Panic is setting in now. Despite the pitch blackness, you can imagine the poorly-placed heap above you preparing to fall, and end your life underneath it.

It's no good; you just can't drag the zipper down. You could try squeezing through at the top, though. Someone of your dimensions shouldn't have too much trouble, although you'd still be torn at by the metal, and there's always the chance that the bag may fall at any moment...

You could cut your losses and run. If you're fast, you could get away before the bag falls.

If you're fast...
11121.title: It's No Good

choices: Try to contact the giantess
Leave her be
Wait to see what she does
111212.content:
You drop and run, but fear that you are too late, far too late...

The crash is behind you. That is good. The bag has landed badly, and is going to fall on top of you. That is bad.

Yet the bag does not fall. You do not die. Looking up, you see that the owner of the bag has stopped it with their foot, propping it up. It is like a goddess holding up the sky.

It is a goddess indeed that extends her leg to hold back the falling mountain, and you prostrate yourself before her in thanks. You're not sure if she can see you, but you don't care.

Her left foot still stands on the ground, enclosed in an immense sandal, like so many of the other girls here today. The leg sweeps upwards to a height beyond your imagining, and you gain no further clues as to your saviour's identity.

Perhaps you should try and get some. It shouldn't be too hard to get her attention, if you put your mind to it.

Alternatively, you could abandon such a foolish notion and get back to your original plan.
111212.title: Protection of the Goddess

choices: You contact her foot
She moves away at the last second
Her foot contacts you, kicking you hard
1112121.content:
You sprint up to the grounded foot, the one not preoccupied with preventing the sky from falling. The toes that stand atop the brown sandal platform are immense, dwarfing you in stature, held back by the straps like restrained lions.

Pausing just shy of the giantess, you crane your head back, cup your hands, and bellow for all you are worth. It's a futile hope that she may have heard you, especially when you can't really see beyond her knee.

You do notice her hands sweep out, though, heading towards the mountain that she is supporting with her raised city-foot. She lifts it easily, and her foot is freed to come crashing down beside its twin, forcing out air currents that blast you onto your back.

Throwing caution into a dumpster, you dive headlong for the toes of the foot. She will notice you, Goddammit!
1112121.title: Beneath Consideration

choices: Kelly looks down at the bug she's placed on her desk. (Her POV)
Your girlfriend that you've been struggling with down below finally notices you.
The giantess flings the annoying bug away
11121211.content:
You shove yourself at the lions once more, in a last-ditch effort to be noticed by someone for once. You can't get over how inobservant most people are. They are taking an exam which takes concentration, but for crying out loud... she will notice you, goddamit! You land feetfirst on the toes, the impact surging up your body. You hope she felt that. You lodge yourself inbetween her big toe and the one next to it, secruing your frail body in place. You're ready to hold on for anything this girl can throw at you. Suddenly, the girl, frusturated with a problem on her exam stomps her foot on the ground. To anyone else at regular size it couldn't even be heard, but you it was like a crashing roller coaster.

You're thrown in the air above the foot, but luckily you land back on it and cling before you slid off. Apparently you underestimated the sheer power of this foot. Just as you're about to ditch your crazy plan you see the girl moving above. In her temporary frustration her focus came off of the test and to something at her feet. Curious, she looked down at the source. You see the first human face since you'd been shrunken. The goddess you've been trying to contact is your girlfriend, Kelly. You wonder why you hadn't thought to contact her at first, but now you realize why those sandals were so familiar.

The immense blonde woman reaches down to the itch on her foot, fingers opening and closing as they descend on you, like a skill crane. The fingernails catch light as they fall, and by the time the fingers make contact with you you've been blinded. Her index and middle finger enclose around your waist, hoisting you upward rapidly. Like a massive elevator of caucasian proportions you reach Kelly's desk. You are set down less than gently.
11121211.title: Last Ditch Effort

choices: Kelly goes for the quick kill
Kelly needs to watch something else suffer
Kelly calls over an attendant, hoping for a time extension
111212111.content:
Kelly wrinkled her nose as she contemplated the bug on her desk. An inch tall, it was an ugly one, all right. And crawling all over her toes! The last thing she needed in the middle of the hardest exam of her life. But taking a few seconds to kill it might get the old endorphins flowing, help her to get back on track with question seven.

It was standing there so stupidly, probably confused out of its tiny mind! She smiled and reached for her pen. A good stab through the chest, perhaps, impaling it in one stroke? Or maybe start by cleaving a leg from its frame, and watch it crawl in mad circles before it expired?

It wasn't as if the wretched thing had any say in the matter...
111212111.title: Damn Bugs, Need to be Crushed!

choices: Drop off now before things get worse
Wait until he stops, to dismount in safety
Try to climb even higher
112.content:
You wonder what madness it was that drove you to this. You're here, hanging on for dear life to the shoelace of some guy you've never met before, wondering where all of this vomit is coming from. Filled with nerves, you only had a light breakfast, after all.

Still, the motion sickness isn't the worst of it. The fact that you don't know where you're going is. Or perhaps the fact that you're only just avoiding being slapped against the ground at evey footstep of the giant.

Perhaps this wasn't such a good idea. You've travelled a fair distance already, you reckon, so you must be nearer your objective than you were before. Is now the time to dismount?
112.title: Bad Idea

choices: Stay still
Run blindly
Try to get someone's attention
1121.content:
Pain shoots through you as you collide with the floor, but at least now you're stationary.

The foot carries on its way, smashing down some way distant with a rumble that reminds you how dangerous your position is. Looking up, you see a whole herd of giants rapidly moving in your direction.

Should you curl up in a ball and hope that this one spot is left untouched, or run for cover, dodging whatever comes near you?
1121.title: No Respite

choices: Emma sits with friends
Get her attention now
Hop off or hold on
11213.content:
With all the chaos ensuing around you, you needed to find a spot to avoid all these colossal foot falls. You keep your head on a swivel, trying to catch sight of oncoming feet before they squish you into paste. Giants and giantess's pass overhead on their way out the door, completely oblivious to the inch tall person below them, scrambling for his life.

"Hey! Anyone?! Im down here on the floor! Please watch your step! Please?!"

Your screams fall upon deaf ears though, as the titans continue on their way. One boys foot touches down right in front of you, causing you to collide with the heel of his sneaker and knocked on your back. You quickly try to scramble back up to your feet as you look behind you for any giant feet coming your way. But you were too late.

https://m.imgur.com/account/damienwithro...

A tanned foot clad in a brown birkenstock sandal was right in front of you. It had just stepped down and was now beginning to rise back up. This mystery giants toes were now pointed down, and the tip of the platform of the sandal was coming towards you. You try to run from it, but apparently this person didnt have good depth perception if they were walking like this, because the tip of her sandal scraped along the floor, colliding into your back and taking you with it as the sandal finally levels out.

You were laying on your back on the platform of this sandal, allowing you to look straight up the body of this giant and identify who it is.

Emma!

You recognize this giant as a girl you were friends with... with benefits. You and Emma occasionally used to hook up with eachother until you both found yourself a significant other. She was a green eyed, dirty blonde haired beauty. Clothed in a navy blue zip up hoodie with sky blue accents on the midsection. She also wore black capris leggings and a pink scrunchie on her wrist. Along with the brown birkenstocks you were currently sprawled out on.

Speaking of which, Emma was taking her next step, which meant it was about to get alot steeper. You rise to your feet and leep as far as you can along Emma's foot towards the strap of the sandle that crossed across the top of her foot. You grab hold of the buckle and hang tight as Emma continues to walk out the door, into the quad.
11213.title: Emma beginnings

choices: Abort!
Hold strong
112133.content:
Hop off now and handle things yourself.

Or hang on and stick with Emma.
112133.title: Hop off or hold on

choices: Go down the corridor
Approach a door
Wait for another human to come to you
1122.content:
It takes an age, but the man stops.

Exhausted, you let go your hold and drop to the ground. You wait for him to wander off again before daring to look up, taking the time to check your injuries and piece together your fractured nerves.

Wait. A. Minute.

You're not in the exam hall anymore. In your panic, you didn't bother looking where the man was heading. Seems that he was heading out.

You look about. Other than the departing form of your torturer and ride, there are no people. You're alone, in a vast room. Granted, it's not as big as the exam hall, but it's pretty stonking large none the less. In fact, now that you think about it, it's more of a corridor.

Where should you go? You could head off in the same general direction as the man, or you could investigate one of the mammoth doors that lines the hallway.
1122.title: Last Stop.  Everybody Off!

choices: The chair
The cables
A gigantic plant pot
11222.content:
The door may as well be the entrance to Olympus itself, it is that huge. However, it is slightly ajar, allowing someone of your diminished proportions to enter easily.

There is another desk here, only it is larger, more elaborate. To you, this suggests office. Which means that the owner of the huge feet beneath the desk must be some form of office worker, a secretary or something.

It's a woman,you can tell that much. Unless it's a man with an odd taste in footwear... Her legs are stretched out to their full, not inconsiderable, length, extending some distance out from the end of the desk. The shoes lie discraded underneath her chair, allowing her feet to breathe beneath the tights that she wears.

The room is pretty bereft of furniture - or at least, of furniture at your height. There may well be stuff on the desk, or mounted on shelves on the walls, but that is high up, way to high for you notice. So, as far as you know, the only feature of the room besides the goddess' chair and desk is another chair, hugely tall on its four sturdy legs.

What should you do here? Judging by the woman's relaxed posture, she's not expecting visitors any time soon, so you should be safe to approach her without risk of her being distracted. The only question is which method of approach to use.

The chair in the centre of the room, unoccupied at the moment, could be a method of approach. Climbing it would be easier than the giantess' own -hers is a swivel chair, with no easy access. Sure, it's be quite a task to get all the way to the top, but it'll be worth it when the woman sees you.

Alternatively, you could take advantage of the many cables trailing on the floor under the desk. Phone lines, plug cables, all lead up to the desk. That could be a potentially more direct route.
11222.title: An Office

choices: The phone line
The plug cable
Try and pull a cable loose from the socket
112222.content:
You scuttle over to the desk quickly, wanting to spend as little time in the open as possible. Maybe it's an instinct that has come to you now that you're so small?

Once you reach the safety of the immense wooden structure, you gaze up the length of the cables. They are incredibly thick, and will easily support your weight, but look so flimsy compared to the titanic form of the woman that they trail up towards.

You have a choice of cables to climb. One is the phone line, plugged into the wall behind you. The other leads to a plug socket, and probably a four way adapter at the other end. It probably doesn't make much difference which one you scale, but it's still a choice that you'll have to make.
112222.title: Two Threads of Hope

choices: Climb the 'phone
Explore the desk
Have a rest and wait until the work-day's end
1122221.content:
Hand over hand, you scale the collossal cable. It doesn't seem as difficult as you would have imagined; presumably your decrease in mass has something to do with it. After all, you've seen insects climb things with great ease. Still, you'd much rather be at your normal height.

You slowly come to get a better view of the woman as you get higher. Concentrating on her bulk prevents your mind from thinking about the gradually increasing drop below you; you've no intention of finding out whether or not you also share an insect's resilience.

Her legs, stretching away under the desk and into the distance, are incredible in and of themselves. In thickness they dwarf the biggest trees you've ever seen, and for a while they are all that you can see.

Once past them, you can look down at her lap. The skirt that she wears spreads out like a vast blue field, slight crinkles forming hills and valleys.

Upwards, and you can see, beyond the cliff-face of her stomach and chest, the underside of her chin. You have no idea at all what this giantess could look like, but you'll find out soon.

You're nearing the edge of the desk now, and can turn away from her to concentrate on pulling yourself over and onto the tabletop.

You're hardly out of breath! Wow!

The telephone stands in front of you, only slightly taller than you are. Seeing something this familiar so close at your new size hammers home how tiny you are. The handset is bigger than a street, and you could comfortably stand in the centre of one of the buttons and hold your arms out wide.

Then, you are almost deafened.

The blearing noise tears into you, and you fall on your back, desperately trying to dig your hands into your ears, to protect them from the noise. It's unbelievably loud, taking over your whole world.

It stops as suddenly as it started. You look up to see that the 'phone handset has been removed, and is now held up in the air by the goddess seated at the desk. Your ears, still ringing, pick up the rumbling as she talks, all that way up there.

If you wanted to get her attention, now could be an opportune moment. You could climb onto the telephone, and guarantee her seeing you when she replaces the handset.

Alternatively, you could move to somewhere slightly safer while the person that may mistake you for a bug is still distracted.
1122221.title: The Ringing

choices: You go to the keyboard to get her attention
You jump onto her lap to get her attention
You stay near the telephone for the next time she uses it
11222211.content:
Of course, the telephone itself is a lot harder to climb than the cable was. You can't get your arms all the way around it, it's totally smooth...

Your wild scrabbling eventually allows you to mount the plastic monstrosity, and you slump down on one of the keys to have a rest. Depressingly, your weight isn't even enough to sink it.

You look up, past the trailing wire to the handset, hefted by the well-manicured right hand of the goddess. She talks, but quietly, and you are too distant to make out anything other than a subsonic hum of noise.

She spins slightly in her seat as she talks, her eyes fixed on the ceiling. You can appreciate her face for the first time properly. She seems oriental, although of course this is the first time you've seen the face of someone this huge. Her mouth stretches wide as she smiles at a comment, revealing the massive teeth within. Her free hand twirls a lock of her long black hair around a finger, the hairs themselves thicker than ropes.

You are in awe of her, watching the simple process of her taking a breath with a mixture of wonder and terror. You truly are tiny in this world now...

The conversation ends. The handset comes down towards you, but over and above your head. You instinctively flinch, and then are bowled over by the impact of a woman putting a receiver back in place. You tumble down the 'phone and back to the desk surface.

Your gracious host is no longer paying any attention to your area. She has turned to the screen of her computer, and furiously types something in.
11222211.title: Telephone

choices: You bounce of the lap, causing a slight impact. She feels you.
The fall was a failure; you hit the leg and nearly roll off. You're dangling.
She surprises you by standing up
112222112.content:
You stand with your thoughts racing to the sound of the tapping keys. This has all been happening so fast, but you still have to act now before you lose your chance. There's no doubt that she's the one to contact now, something in your gut insists. There were two ways (safe ones) that you could do this through, and they were either getting her attention from jumping onto the keyboard and struggling not to be tripped by the keys, or leap into her lap, because you now stand right on the edge to where she now sits, turned toward the computer rather than the phone.

Yeah, you're definitely going to go with the latter. Less chance of being sent sprawling on the sea of keys. As the oriental giantess types away, you're plotting out trajectories. You know you'll reach her lap, but will you roll and slide off? That's a scary thought, but what choice do you really have? This was the lesser of two evils, so to speak. Getting a running start, you plunge over the side and into a freefall, the woman's lap giving the illusion that it's rushing up to you. This was it, now if you could just control yourself once you hit the relatively soft surface...
112222112.title: The Plunge

choices: Stay and try to convince the giantess that you're human
Run before you get into more trouble
Play dead
1122221121.content:
The woman's lap is a lot less soft that you'd imagined. Rather than gently thudding into it like a heap of pillows, it's more akin to launching yourself at a brick wall covered in tissue paper. You arrest your momentum before you can roll off and fall to the floor, but as you lie on your back you can see that the giantess has stopped typing and is looking intently down at you, an inch tall and lying on her skirt.

She screams as if she'd seen a rat, leaping to her feet and depositing you on the floor against all your best intentions. The carpet is very slightly less painful than her lap, not that that matters as you're about to be stomped to death.

The shoe that you'd been expecting to impact on you any second doesn't arrive. Opening your eyes, you can see no sign of either foot anywhere in the room. But you're sure you would have heard her running away...

A high-pitched shrieking draws your attention upwards, and you see that the giantess is stood upon her chair, screaming for help. Fantastic, just fantastic. Should you waste time trying to convince her that you're human, or get out of here before some gallant chap comes along to save the lady by crushing you?
1122221121.title: Thomas!

choices: Make some noise down by knee level
Climb higher
Scratch away at her skin
1122221122.content:
You grip tightly to the thick fabric of the skirt, not wishing to look down the intolerable distance below you. Given your reduced mass, you'd probably survive if you were to fall, but it would still hurt a lot. It would also undo all the progress you've made so far, and that would be unacceptable.

However, since you're hanging from the curve of this woman's thigh, your feet can't gain any purchase to allow you to climb back up. It's all you can do to maintain position, ignoring the burning in your shoulders and hoping that this giantess doesn't stand up and start dancing.

Instead, she chooses to cross her legs. The one you're clinging desperately to thankfully rises above the other, sinking into place with a boom and a shudder that tricks your fingers into letting go. Of course, since the thigh is now lying across the other leg, this means that instead of plummeting to the floor you merely drop onto her knee. All thoughts of trying to contact her are forgotten for the moment as you enjoy the luxury of not dangling precariously.

The asian goddess has yet to notice the inch tall man about her person, so contacting her will take a little more effort, it would seem.
1122221122.title: Clinging

choices: Climb the mountain to get a lay of the land
Dig deep into the mountain, for your bag should be at the bottom
Walk around the pile to see if it's anywhere on the outside
113.content:
Carefully - ever so carefully - you sneak your diminutive form past the monolithic form of the left foot of the girl seated behind you.

The toes, those dreadful instruments of destruction, move, but you are well away from them, and safe. Taking your time, you are able to stare up at the bare expanse of her leg, stretching into the heavens above you. It's an awe inspiring sight.

You pass several more giants and giantesses on your journey, each as godlike as the last, and each no problem to you as you carefully make your way to freedom.

Your mind is whirling with thoughts of the titans around you as you walk. To you, they truly are deities, able to kill you on a whim. To them, you are a lowly insect, worth only a moment's notice to be ground into a stain. You'd better keep out of their way.

At last you reach your objective, but the mountain before you bears no relation to the small mound that you left earlier. Your bag - and mobile 'phone - are in there somewhere, but how will you find it?
113.title: All That Effort For Nothing?

choices: Try to get her attention
Tough it out - she'll be gone soon
Hide until she's gone
1131.content:
It's quite some way to the top, but you're not to be daunted. It's just a little bit of climbing...

Half an hour later, you've changed your mind.

You're still struggling up the side of this pink monstrosity, with no end in sight. And to think, some people go mountain-climbing for FUN...

Your arms are protesting at their pain, but you can't let go now, for risk of falling to the ground so far, far below. You don't want to look down.

But you can't help yourself.

The ground, all the way down there... But something else as well. Feet.

You look back up again, to see that someone is now standing over you, about to reach over and take something from the pile. It's the girl that was sitting behind you earlier! She must have finished the exam early.

Perhaps you should try and get her attention in some way, or else wait for her to dislodge your own bag a little.
1131.title: Unexpected

choices: She is picking up the bag you're on
She is picking up the bag beneath the one you're on
She is pushing the whole stack more upright
11311.content:
Dropping down onto a ledge - or whatever it is - you look up at the goddess.

A wall of denim reaching towards the heavens must be one of her legs. You can't see much further than her waist, but as she bends down you get a better look at her. For all the terror that her massive visage inspires in you, she doesn't look like a bad person. She'd probably help you.

So you start waving your arms, jumping up and down and shouting at the top of your lungs. The monolithic woman seems to pay no attention to you, but a tiny motion of her outstretched arm causes your whole world to tilt.

Your shouts turn to screams as you fall.
11311.title: Over Here!

choices: Drop into the bag
Try to get into Rachel's hair
Settle for climbing onto the woman's back
Get off this ride at the first opportunity
Shout as loud as you can
113111.content:
You grab on as tight as you can as the muscles of the woman effortlessly bear your section of the world into the air.

The bag must be being swung over a shoulder, as you feel the world rotate well over one hundred and eighty degrees! Somehow, against the odds, you manage to prevent yourself from falling to an untimely death.

Shaking your head as things calm down a bit, you take stock of your surroundings. Judging by the mane of blonde hair that cascades ahead of you, you must be around shoulder height.

A voice shouts, asking a Rachel if she would like to go get a drink to celebrate.

The head turns.

Hair whips by in front of you, and you duck to avoid being decapitated by the massive strands, each thicker than your fingers! The face of your transport is revealed.

While undeniably a giantess, her face is slim, well-proportioned. Her eyes sparkle, and an easy grin lights up her countenance. With a light irish accent, she replies to her friend: "sure, why not?"

Looks like you're going to the bar then, whether you'd like to or not. Question is whether you'd like to slide down into the bag to sit out the journey, or instead trying to reach that hair, which is so tantalisingly close. It's risky, but you'd stand a better chance of communicating...
113111.title: Rachel

choices: Go to get something from her backpack
Go rest, the backpack can wait
Curl up with the backpack as a pillow
1131111.content:
You slide down into her bag, hoping that when she gets home she will need something from it and see you. As she goes for a drink, she throws her bag on top of the others.

After a few hours of drinks with her friends, she decides to go home, rather tipsy. She puts her backpack on the floor, jostling you from a nap you were taking. Does she:
1131111.title: Drop into the bag

choices: Quick!  Jump!
Oh, too late.  On with climbing...
Drop!
1131112.content:
Being so thick, it's not so hard for you to grab onto a few strands of hair, and they're more than capable of taking your weight. You begin climbing, scaling up the Everestian height of Rachel's head.

She turns her head face forward again as she begins to walk, and you are brought flying around in front of her for a moment, before a brushing by her fingers sweeps 'your' strands behind her ear.

There's a moment - just a single moment - but you could jump for her hand if you wanted.
1131112.title: Hair or Hand

choices: Feel something on her hand and go to inspect it?
Keep walking, unknowing of you
High five a friend
11311121.content: You jump onto her hand and cling as tightly as possible, it's swinging being rather dizzying. Does she:
11311121.title: Quick!  Jump!

choices: This isn't my back pack!
nothing except the thunderous footsteps edging away from the pile.
the fire alarm going off
11312.content: The girl goes for her bag, which happens to be the one your on! she picks up her bag just as you were about to jump and you yopple into the hole were recently the backback was. Just then you heard from above...
11312.title: In the hole

choices: You fly out and land on Laura
You fly out and land on Rose
Your safe... for now
113121.content:
