Still, the predator hasn't made its move yet; there is still time. So far you've been frozen in fear, but you don't want to give it more time to decide what to do with you. The cat's unblinking eyes follow you, however, in your flight. And yet, it still doesn't attack. You can't believe your luck, and you are already halfway there. Suddenly, your heart drops. The clicking of cat claws lingers behind you, and the mass of fur pounces, missing you by mere inches.

By now your adrenaline had rushed in, and you are just a foot away from the girl. What will you even do when you get there? Suddenly the cat starts to run toward you, the clicking noise increasing. You pass through the way that connects the kitchen and living room, nerves clashing. When all seemed lost, you hear a voice above you:

"Marks, stop running around. It's late, just go in another room," the girl calls.

When the cat doesn't oblige, she grabs a mouse toy from the counter drawer and tosses it back further into the living room. Perfect, that'll give you plenty of time. Meanwhile, the teenage girl has looked down at the cat, and noticed something a few inches in front of it. (Girl POV)

You've never been one to give up, leaving something half finished. That's precisely the reason why you're attending this exam, even though you know that you have no chance of success: you're not going to quit just because you're doomed. The trying is what matters.

And trying is just what the climb is. Each inch of progress you make tears at your body, tiring you beyond what you thought the human body was capable of withstanding. Yet bloody-minded determination prevents you from calling it quits, and it is with a small sense of triumph that you haul yourself over Leia's knee to finally stand up again.

Of course, you soon collapse to your own knees as you are so tired, but you are more than due a rest, you're sure. As you recapture your breath, you look across the expanse of thigh laid out before you to see that the woman has one hand sitting in her lap comfortably, while the other presumably works on her paper far above, on the other side of the desk that forms the ceiling to your little world.

The hand is compressed, fingers neatly angled together as it nestles comfortably in place, but its scale is again daunting, the power present in each of those train carriage-sized fingers just waiting to be unleashed.

You could approach that dainty but deific hand if you wished, as a means to grab Leia's attention, or you could rest up for a while as you prepare to move on to climbing her stomach, hidden beneath that tough-looking blue top she's wearing.

You consider this a good thing, as those things are easily the size of you; the sharply nailed big toe could probably squish a car really flat if it wanted to. You'd appreciate it if it didn't try.

You take a deep breath and approach, craning your neck as you get closer to follow the porcelain perfection of her legs up for what seems like forever. They finally disappear into a skirt, an untold distance above you.

As you are mounting the base of the sandal, a thought comes to you. Settling down between the big toe and its partner (it's worryingly comfortable, even if the smell is a little odd), you wonder if you should change your plan.

You had been planning to wait on Kath's foot until such a time as she would notice you, but you could be a little more pro-active. You could climb her leg and get her attention NOW. Risk of death by scratching, perhaps, but a lot quicker.

As the time passes, you notice she isn't jogging back to her room, but rather a small forested area where the track and cross country runners usually go for practices. You figure she is probably looking for a clearing so she can do... whatever she's planning to do with you, in private.

You are still nervous of what she has planned. You personally never said or did anything mean to her. "Hopefully she'll remember that," you think as she finally slows to a stop. Carefully, you are removed from her hair and placed on the ground in front of her. She then sits indian style right in front of you and finally speaks to you.
1251112111111.title: Callie takes you somewhere quiet

choices: She feels remorseful for her actions
She doesn't care who you are
She laughs; no harm done!
12511121111112.content:
You are shaken not only by Callie's words, but the maliciously gleeful tone she uses in expressing them as well. The creepy smirk stretching her chapped red lips to their limits doesn't provide much ease to the tension building within you either. Her sooty strands slither just past the forefront of her shoulders as she stares down at you with those beady dark pupils wrapped in dim ultramarine. A mucronate nose anchors her gigantic flushed face at a slightly declining angle; all the better to see you with.

"Callie", you try to reason, "I..."

Callie is quick to cut you off, "Nope! It's my time to talk now. YOU have to listen to ME".

"But...", you boldly defy Callie's command.

Almost in slow motion, you watch Callie's tough-skinned right hand upsurge into view from behind her gorging knees. As the ominous monster reaches the height of its ascent, its attenuated digits unify in ball form. Creating a dark overcast in your general vicinity, the mighty fist hovers in the sky acting as an anti-sun to your cowering figure. You decide an immediate evacuation from your current location is in order.

As you begin to run, the massive bolder of tanned epidermal fury starts to lower with surprising velocity. The sound of gushing wind bending to the power of your impending doom resembles an unending burst of thunder. With great force, Callie slams her coiled hand against the brunet earth mere yards from your position. The ground quakes from the impact, helping your forward momentum to drive you from your feet. You slide on your stomach, dirt sticking to your face as well as your clothing. Callie raises her hand back to its perch on her lap. The ground stops trembling. You do not.

"Are your ears broken?", Callie taunts you, "I just told you that it was my turn to speak, twerp. You aren't going to muscle in on my turn anymore".

Before you can return to a standing pose, Callie's dainty fingers tighten around your waist once again. It is now that you realize she was actually being gentle the last time she grabbed you in this way, for her grip is now tortuous to say the least. Your pelvis feels as though it is about to collapse under the enormous pressure of Callie's ripply thumb and index finger while she carries you back to her natural, yet moderately pretty face.

"Now let's get a better look at you", Callie snidely states, "You took me by surprise earlier, and I didn't..."

A vacuum threatens to suck you into a great abyss below your dangling legs. You recognize the audible repercussions of a sudden inhalation. Both fear and relief fill you at Callie's gasping sensation.

"It's you!", Callie exclaims, "Why couldn't it have been one of those jerks instead".

Well, you take it as a positive that you are in a different classification than "those jerks". Now you can only hope that Callie remembers you as the nice guy that you think you are.
12511121111112.title: Callie in command.

choices: Callie plays with you there
Callie takes you home
Callie plans to use you to scare former bullies
125111211111122.content:
"You were always so nice to me", Callie realizes.

You like where this is going.

Callie continues, "You never called me 'shorty', or any of those other uncreative nicknames".

So far so good.

"What, did you feel sorry for me or something?", Callie asks.

Ye...wait, what?

"Yeah", Callie's sneers, "I remember you. You were always towering over me; hording your tallness. You think you're better than me, don't you?".

You don't like where this is going.

"Well, you're not", Callie rants on, "Not anymore. How do you like things on the short end of the stick for once, huh?".

It finally dawns on you that Callie was a really bad choice for you to reveal yourself. Not that you had much of a choice, though. It wouldn't have mattered who she found at an inch high. She feels like the world spits on her on a daily basis, and she's finally found someone to take it out on. You can't blame her for channeling her frustrations out on you. Actually you can (and do) blame her, but you can sympathize.

Apparently tired of waiting for your response to what you thought was a rhetorical question, Callie's darkly faded blue right oculus zooms closer to you. Her unpainted lashes sway inches from your body with each movement of her lightly dosed in pink eye lid, generating a slight breeze to flow over you. This normally relaxing sensation is ruined by the combination of the crushing of your hips and the mean streak in the frightfully large orb staring at you.

"Are you too good to talk to me?", Callie angrily interrogates.

"O-of c...course not", you stammer a reply, "I-I just...".

Callie hisses at your pathetic attempt at conversation. Her wrist flicks backward with little effort, sending a catapulting force through her hand. The pulverizing grasp on your waist is promptly released. For a split second, the relief of your midsection places your mind in a blissful state. The buildup of wind at your back is snaps you back to reality, however. Gravity begins to pull you toward the waiting ground. Your voice box fails to produce the shrieks you order it to unleash, leaving your mouth foolishly gaping without purpose.

The collision with the murky surface was brief, yet indescribably painful. You land on your back, your buttocks luckily absorbing most of the impact. Your head bashes against the dirt laden earth in the aftermath, but it seems to be alright (save the massive headache). There is a throbbing in your left ankle, which came down awkwardly in your descent. All in all, your just happy to have survived the free fall.

You try to stand, but you struggle mightily in this endeavor. Insidious impressions shoot through your lower body in the effort. You do, however, manage to return to your feet. Looking up, you see Callie watching your suffering giddily. Man, she must have bottled up every mean thing ever said or done to her in anticipation of your pint-sized arrival into her life. Her puny (by normal standards, mind you) fingers stroke her pointy chin as she no doubt plans what to do with you now.
125111211111122.title: Playing the scapegoat

choices: Callie is going to feed you, so you'll be healthy for the torture
Callie wants to mock you with her 'tiny' tits
Callie wants you to measure her height with a tape measure
1251112111111222.content:
"Throwing you around a field of grass is all well and good," Callie says, "but I'm sure that I'll get bored of it after a while. Not to mention the fact that one of your tall friends will probably wander past at some point just to poke fun at me. No," she says, staring at you and smiling a tight-lipped smile, "I'll take you home."

You have no time to react before her hand is upon you again, snatching you up into its palm, where all the fingers can join in the squeezing fun. Choking in a breath is most difficult and uncomfortable, as very little space is left around you thanks to the crushing engines of destruction, fury barely contained within soft young skin. And as time goes on, heat and humidity increases, your own sweat being drowned in Callie's, so every time you open your mouth it fills with disgusting liquid.

At least the tight grip mostly absorbs the impacts from the girl running, but that is scant comfort. When you aren't writhing in torment, your mind is running over what horrific things she could yet have in store for you.

The journey is an eternity, but one that ends. Once more you are carelessly thrown through the air, relief rushing through you as you fly, but this time you land soft. Callie's bed. You would spend time looking around her room, but you daren't take your eyes off the woman herself. She stares down at you unwaveringly, her tremendous hands flexing with anticipation.

Oh God,what does she have planned?
1251112111111222.title: Callie takes you home

choices: Reminisce
Repent
Reason
12511121111112221.content:
You expect it when Callie reaches down for you once again, but you are filled with frightful bewilderment when her free hand grabs a "small" bowl from the top of her dresser. Callie dangles you over the dull yellow contents of the bowl for a bit before dropping you. It is with a strong sense of trepidation that you finally find the volume of your voice box, screaming at the top of your lungs throughout your great plunge. The grainy sea of pale gold, complete with sketchy brown swirls at its center, absorbs your momentum as you involuntarily bore to its porcelain floor. Your exhausted limbs struggle to pull you back to the surface, just barely succeeding at the daunting task before your lungs drown in this unsticky substance. Unable to hold off your curiosity, your dry tongue licks your yellow stained lips, providing your taste buds with a long lost familiarity. Applesauce.

Horror washes over you at the sight of capacious argent scooper submerging into the far side your opaque ocean, its long extending handle giving you a means to track the mighty sea monster. The oval sterling glossa rises from the depths with its bucketing edge coming fairly close to taking you with its ill fated cargo, the wave from its ascension almost pulling you under. Sure enough, Callie's clenching fingers drag the cupping end of the spoon skyward, porting it into the black inside of her salivating mouth. In a panic, you swim in desperate motions with your fatigued arms and legs, hoping to make it to the slightly inclining white high wall partitioning you from the world outside. You know it is pointless; there's no way you can climb such a level structure, particularly since it lacks the footholds to make such a feat possible. Yet you swim anyway, unable to accept your imminent fate.

"Quit that", Callie orders from on high, "You're just wasting your energy".

"Please stop", you doubt your captress can hear your breathless words, "I don't want to be eaten".

Callie does in fact hear you, "I'm not going to eat you, moron. You don't get off that easy. Now eat up. You're going to have a lot going on today, and I won't have you dying on me".

You should probably feel comforted by the fact that you have been assured safety from Callie's digestive tracts, but the promise of a long and likely painful day ahead of you allows a whole new feeling of dread to build in your stomach. Speaking of stomach, you have no complaints obeying Callie's order to fill it. You skipped out on breakfast, and obviously had to alter your plans to eat lunch after finishing your exam. It is therefore without hesitation that you lower your mouth the the top of the sauced liquid and suck in greedily. Of course, each dive of Callie's eating utensil provides you with more than enough unrest to prevent you from enjoying the feast.

After a short while, Callie stops eating the applesauce, apparently having her fill. This means that you have had your fill as well, whether you like it or not. After all, someone as big as Callie shouldn't be expected to wait on someone as tiny as yourself, right? The mouth of her spoon makes a final swoop into the light lemon body of water, scooping you up along with a mouthful's worth of the near tasteless food. You are placed in front of Callie's now moist lips, but they thankfully deny passage to your transport. They do, however, address you inconsiderately.

"Well now", a creepily cheery voice emerges from the dark cavern before you, "Let's get on with the next activity, shall we?".

"Please", you beg, "Can't we talk about this?"

Callie seems amused by the idea, "Fine. Say your piece. It probably won't do you any good, but it might make me laugh a little".

Despite her less than reassuring comment, you are determined to talk your way out of this situation. However, you are stuck between two approaches to take with your gigantic tormentor.

First, you could try to remind Callie that you are her friend. She really seems to have calmed down since your initial encounter, so she might be more logical and receptive. Though you have to admit that she appears to still be taking joy in your suffering. It may be a waste of your golden opportunity to walk (or rather talk) down this path.

Or you could beg for forgiveness. Sure, you have nothing to be sorry about, but that's rather moot at this point. Maybe if you express regret over whatever it is Callie thinks you've done to her, she'll take pity on you. Of course, an admission of guilt would likely place you into the "jerk" category you were oh-so-happy avoid earlier. If she doesn't accept your false apology, it may only serve to make things much, much worse for you.

In any case, you'd best hurry. Who knows how long you'll have Callie's ear.
12511121111112221.title: A sea of sauce

choices: "I never realised you reciprocated my feelings for you!"
"Maybe you should have tried asking me out once or twice?"
"You have to learn to stand up for yourself."
125111211111122211.content:
"I saved you," you begin, wobbling as you stand tall on the spoon and shout up at Callie's lips. "All those times, when those big jerks pushed you around, or those catty bitches put you down, I stood up for you, defended you!"

"Not all," she replies, and the closeness of her mouth blasts you down again with the force of God's own word, thunder, storm and a slight smell of apple rushing from her cavernous gullet and lungs. "You weren't always there."

"I couldn't be there all the time!" you protest. "I helped whenever I could!"

"Whenever taking pity on a little girl made you feel better about yourself," the judge giantess blasts at you, no attempt made to lower her volume for your comfort. A drip of spittle, the size of your head, shoots past you, over your shoulder, at several miles an hour. "You could have been around me all the time if you'd noticed, ever acknowledged my thanks."

The spoon rises,and you just give up on trying to stand. The elevation ends with your facing the narrowed, harshly focused eye of Callie. Your relection in its vast depths looks frightened.

"No. You always ran off," Callie continues, slightly quieter only because you're further from her speaking-hole. "Always left me alone."

Your mind races. Could that be it? Did Callie have a crush on you, and you never noticed? No wonder she's pissed at you. But this may be a way out of this dire situation. Perhaps you could fake admiting to your own unrequited longing for her in turn, although the consequencesof being caught out toying with her emotions would be huge. And probably fatal.

The only other option would be to apologise some more, and perhaps confront Callie on hiding her feelings, accusing her of being too timid to act on them. That risks angering a giantess, but if she realises just how much she's over-reacting, you may yet save yourself.
125111211111122211.title: Reminisce

choices: "Now's your chance, Callie - I'm yours!  Do what you will!"
"Try to catch me, short stuff!"
"Oh, cry me a river!"
1251112111111222112.content:
Callie's eyes narrow. Perhaps you've gone too far.

"Oh yeah? Because you'd have taken the blindest bit of notice of a girl like me asking you out huh, tough guy? You and your friends would just have used that as more fuel for your insults!"

Seems like there's no way of winning her over with this line of questioning - you can almost feel the heat of her anger burning at your face. Then you fall as she drops the spoon you are standing on, and you plummet downward.

Thankfully, her bed provides a soft landing. The giantess looming over you, cruel smile about her lips, doesn't promise that your comfort will continue, however. Maybe one last ditch attempt to persuade her not to kill you? Or maybe that'll just be a waste of your last moments, and you should instead attempt to flee?
1251112111111222112.title: Faint Heart

choices: Callie drops you onto her floor and squishes you completely beneath her feet.
Callie apologizes for how unfairly cruel she was and gives you a big hug.
Callie puts you aside for later; she has to think
12511121111112221121.content:
You raise your arms in surrender and close your eyes to await your fate. "I tried reasoning with her. She can kill me at any time she wants, there's no point in fighting it any more..." You curse yourself one last time for not realizing her feelings for you before-hand. But...you notice she hasn't said or done anything yet.

You slowly lift one eyelid and glance up at the giantess before you. The look on her face makes it seem like she's in an internal struggle with herself. What's going on?

Finally, Callie raises her hand and plucks you off her bed by the back of your shirt with her index finger and thumb and holds you in front of her pretty face. You dread awaiting what she could possibly have in mind for your demise.

What happens?
12511121111112221121.title: "Now's your chance, Callie - I'm yours!"

choices: "Callie, I'm really tired.  I need to sleep."
"Callie, I need to get back to normal first."
"Love is a big word, Callie..."
125111211111122211212.content:
"What I want? All I've ever wanted..." Tears are forming at Callie's eyes, each droplet bigger than your head. "I wanted you. I should never have gotten angry. I'm sorry..."

Dangling before her, your inch-tall form suspended by a shirt hanging between her thumb and forefinger, you smile, relieved. Life it is, then.

Callie moves, the other fingers of her hand wrapping around you, until your head emerges from within her mighty flesh claw like a man buried up to his neck in sand. Warmth and power surrounds you, and then the pressure increases, the strongest hug you've ever received.

"Everything's okay now, though," Callie says, grinning and wiping her eyes with her free hand, "now we'll never be apart, and you're free to love me."

Uh oh. The anger in her eyes has been replaced with crazy, and you're literally in the palm of her hand. Even if she restrains herself, there's little chance of you surviving her loving ministrations, Maybe she'd be open to a suggestion..?
125111211111122211212.title: Over It

choices: Shout louder
Struggle against her strength
Bite her
1251112111111222112121.content:
"Tired?" Callie laughs, another slight squeeze of her fist pressing your innards together more. "It's still early! We should celebrate finally coming together, acknowledging our union after so long denying our true feelings!"

Dear God.

"How about a kiss to start?"

Rather than the usual meeting of lips, with a mutual massage of tongues, it is more like Callie is trying to suck your head off as she envelops your exposed face is her wet, hungry mouth. She massages and sucks, kneading you with her hand at the same moment, an excess of sensation that threatens to crush your skull and burst your heart.

And Callie moans. How long has she been dreaming of this moment? How long does she want it to last? Most importantly, how long can you survive this process?

"Stop..." you mumble, but your heart isn't in it. Your only hope is to drop out of her hand once she relaxes, hopefully too distracted to find you...
1251112111111222112121.title: Don't Be Weak

choices: Try to escape Callie's room while she's changing
Await the giantess's next fancy
Go and peek at her changing
12511121111112221121211.content:
Good choice. You're too small and puny for Callie to feel any struggles inside her hand, but with your head being slathered by the sensitive organ of her tongue, your yells with be instantly picked up.

Saliva clings to your head like a thick coating of slime as the girl reluctantly withdraws you from her tender 'kiss'. Unable to bring your hands up to wipe your eyes clear, your view of her face is distorted.

"Something the matter?" she asks, her mouth still close enough that the voice almost deafens you. "Are we moving too fast? Or maybe... too slow?"

You fight to make your words form on your lips, but then you're released from Callie's grip, spinning away to bounce onto her soft bed. You waste no time in wiping the drool off on her sheet, while she prattles on above, an uncaring god.

"I'll have to change into something more comfortable. No peeking, now!"

This might be a chance to get away: you should make the most of it!

Shouldn't you? You have just literally looked this gift giantess in the mouth, and while this initial encounter has been slightly painful, perhaps time will make it better?
12511121111112221121211.title: Struggle Within Her Mouth

choices: Shout up to her: "You throw like a girl!"
Run under the bed to confuse her pursuit
Hide under the pony doll
12511121111112221122.content:
You dash across the uneven surface of the bed, leaping atop the duvet while Callie roars behind and above you. "Short stuff? You little shit! Fee fi fo fum, I'll crush you with my thumb!"

That's right, you think to yourself, waste time ranting, give me a little more space to get clear! Of course, it's hard to be totally confident when you're an inch tall and an enraged woman has you trapped in her room. You can't stay on her bed, and thus when there's still a dozen inches of distance before you reach the footboard you dive to one side, rolling and hoping for a soft landing.

In your wake, Callie's immense fist pounds down, clearly a killing strike. You spin as you fall, looking upward at the frustration marring her face. In her rage, she raises both fists above her head and smashes them down on the bed again. Looks like she gets angry real easy; you can use that to your advantage!

You hit soft, rolling down a fluffy blue monument, maybe some form of stuffed animal? You don't pause to inspect it, taking off sprinting as soon as you touch down on carpet fibre, twin explosions behind you telling all you need to know: Callie has jumped to her feet.

The door is closed, but there should be room for you to scramble underneath, if you can make it across the clear ground between you and freedom. It's only a few feet, no more than a handful of steps to a short girl like Callie.

To you, a whole lot more. If only your body hadn't already taken such a pounding..!

As you sprint, there is an impact in front of you, as an object bigger than a house lands, tossed to block your way by the goddess behind you. Its blue colouring identifies it as the cushion that saved your life just now, revealed to be stuffed pony, more a Trojan horse to you now. Spinning around, you look up from Callie's bare feet - crushing down carpet strands upon which you skip - to her snarling face. She could have caught you by now if she were thinking clearly, and you can't give her a chance to come to her senses. If you do, there's no way you'll make it to the door.
12511121111112221122.title: "Try to catch me, short stuff!"

choices: Beg for your life
Stand up to Callie, and deny her cruelty
Blame someone else
125111211111122212.content:
Trembling, you assume a kneeling position in the gooey applesauce mess, balancing as best you can in the spoon hanging before Callie's lips. "I'm sorry," you begin, "sorry for everything that's been done to you, by me and the others. We shouldn't have been so mean. You've done nothing to be bullied for, it's just our short-sightedness that couldn't see your worth."

The mouth has been smiling, rough lips upcurled at their extremes, but they quickly lower as your speech goes on. "Shortsighted?" The word blasts a charge of apple-scented air at you, sending you rolling around the spoon. "That some sort of joke? Just can't stop, can you?"

"No, no! It was unintentional!" you protest. "I'm sorry!"

The mouth opens, but no sound emerges from that pitch-black opening. Instead, the spoon continues on its way, entering the threshold and halting long enough for a slimy, writhing entity to smack you from your perch. As you smack into some rock-hard teeth, the metallic shuttle exits, the jaw closes, and sight is denied you.

Humidity assaults you, its companion the writhing tongue of Callie, some Lovecraftian monster playing with its food. It mashes you from side to side within the mouth, rolling you over and over, pounding you against ceiling and floor, smothering you and leaving you alone for tense moments.

When Callie spits you back into her palm, you're almost catatonic. "I liked hearing you beg," she offers. "More of that, please, or maybe I'll take more of you..."
125111211111122212.title: Repent

12511122.content:
You open your eyes. You were wrong, you could survive the fall. It doesn't half hurt, though.

You turn over onto your back, looking up to see Katherine still sat over you, the foot stopped tapping.

Then she uncrosses her legs.

Heading straight towards you, filling your limited view, is the underside of Katherine's sandal. You can make out every indentation, every piece of gum trodden on. Then it blacks out your vision, and its tremendous weight flattens your body, liquidising your insides.

Having switched over her legs, Kath proceeds to tap her other foot, glancing at her watch to see exactly how late John is. What was once your body slowly becomes less and less recognisable. By the time John actually arrives, you will officially be nothing but a stain.
12511122.title: Leap of Faith

choices: A seat in the University Library
A low wall at the side of the street
The stands at a sporting event
125112.content:
When Kath walks past the coffee shop, you realise that that wasn't her final destination. Looks like you're in for a whole new round of knee smashing, with no indication of when it will end.

Your body is thoroughly battered and bruised by the time the journey ends, and Kath finally sits down again. So relieved are you that you let go of her skirt, coming to rest alongside her atop whatever surface it is that she's sitting on.

Blearily, you gaze around, wondering where you have been brought...
125112.title: Change

choices: ...the foot of the person walking behind Kath
...the deep pool of liquid beneath a crack in the floorboards
...a discarded tissue
12512.content:
You can't hear much as you fall, but it seems to happen in slow motion. You imagine yourself screaming 'NOOOOOOO' as you fall, yet still you can't hear even yourself.

The strange sight of a huge and looming Katherine gets further and further away as you spiral to the ground. Turning in mid-air, your view is replaced by the onrush of the ground, wooden boards crudely fitted together.

This is it. You're going to die. And it seems like you're going to be able to savour the moment.

You've made your peace, and accepted your inevitable fate, when you find yourself saved by...
12512.title: As Luck Would Have It...

choices: You grab one of the toes
You grab the base of the sandal
You grab thin air
1252.content:
Yeah, you're safer down here. With the toes. The toes that could - as you've so vividly imagined - crush cars on their ownsome...

You sit down and hug your knees.

At least the toes don't move much, as a rule. Many people would be drumming their feet or suchlike during an exam, but not our Kath. Still and resolute to the end.

That is, until she decides to cross her legs.

Your world flips as the foot begins to rise, and you desperately reach out, trying to grab anything to use as a handhold.
1252.title: Over, Under, In and Out

choices: Too late, she turns in her exam
She feels you
She wiggles her toes again and you slip out
12521.content:
Acting fast, you grab ahold of the side of her big toe as her sandal rises in the air. You hold on for dear life as she tilts her foot back and crosses her legs. Her toes rise slightly during this brief moment, and you end up hugging onto the bottom of her big toe, slightly above her sandal. The brief moment ends, and you realize you have become sandwiched beneath her big toe, slightly pressed into the sole of her sandal. You try to move, but realize her soft toe is pressing on your entire body, preventing you from moving.

Kath wiggles her feet in the air a bit while her legs are crossed. You feel every movement, pushing you around in your toe prison. Luckily her foot isn’t touching the ground, and the pressure sandwiching you between her toe and her sandal isn’t painful. However, you knew you had to get out of there before she turned in her exam, or you’d be flattened when she took a step.
12521.title: You grab one of the toes

125211.content:
As you try to figure outa way to get Kath to notice you or to get out from beneath her toe, you hear her put her pencil down and hear the sliding of paper. Suddenly, you feel her foot move as she uncrosses her legs. You feel a sharp thud as her sandal makes contact with the floor. The pressure of her toe on you is now much more intense, but it will only get worse if she stands up. You know you only have a few seconds before she walks to turn in your test, so you desperately try to get her attention.

You try screaming as loud as you can, but with your face completely encased by her toe, there’s no way she can hear you. You try to wiggle and push her toe off you, but as it presses on you you can’t even move your arms. You realize there’s no hope of escaping, and you’ll likely die beneath her toe.

Kath starts to stand up to turn in her test, and you feel a sharp increase in pressure from her toe. You can’t raise your chest for air now, as her toe presses it flat. Soon, she starts walking. As she takes a step, she presses her toes on the ground to support her step. It ends briefly for you, you suddenly feel her toe caving in your chest before you lose consciousness. Kath inadvertently crushes you flat. She feels a splat beneath her toe, but your remains aren’t even recognizable, just a liquid splat.
125211.title: Too late, she turns in her exam

choices: Pinch yourself to check that this isn't a dream
Approach the girl sitting behind you
Approach the invigilator about to walk past
Look around the hall for someone else
Calm down and think about things more rationally
13.content:
Well, you did read all of those GTS stories for a reason...

Rubbing your hands together at this stroke of outrageous luck (a miracle, you think!), you look around for a deserving recipient of your admiration.

There's a woman seated behind you. You can't see much of her, but what you can see is what you want to see; she's wearing sandals.

One problem - she's taking her feet in and out of the sandals, wiggling her toes around and generally behaving in a manner likely to result in your death if you got too close. But would dying in such a way be so bad?

You pull yourself away from the almost hypnotic sight to see that an invigilator is approaching your desk. It's a she and while it may be wearing horrid 'sensible' shoes, her legs are bare. The walking, however, presents a problem. Danger of death.

Of course, there are bound to be others even more delightful to look upon, but looking around this crowded hall could be the most dangerous option of the lot. But faint heart never, as they say...

Your mind is whirling. The earthquakes aren't really helping. How do you even know that any of this is real? You've had many a dream of this sort, and this could just be another. You hope that it isn't...
13.title: A Macrophile's Dream

choices: Run away
Continue talking to the mystery person
Grab him and demand answers
131.content: You pinch yourself, you feel it. This is not a dream at all, you are approaching this giant girl toying with her sandals right now, this is all really happening!! You both stand, on the toe of Sara's shoe, waiting for the other to make a move. You size him up; he's about your height, but a bit more flabby around the belly. You can take him. But still, you'll wait for him to make the first move.

Sara ends up making the first move. The scraping that you failed to hear through your intense concentration was the chair being dragged back; now she steps forwards, ready to sit.

You both try to get balance as the ground shifts - he recovers first, and jumps at you again as the foot comes down.

The shock of the step pitches him back even as he reaches you, and you are shaken as well. You both tumble over in a confused heap, rolling to a halt at Sara's ankle.

"Won't you stop and listen to me?" he spits through gritted teeth.

You don't get a chance to reply - Sara sits down, and hucks her chair forwards a little. The movements of her foot during this process throw you both to the other end, and put you on top of your opponent.

"Talk!" you snarl behind gritted teeth. "What's going on? What have you done to me?"

"Kuhh, I did nothing." the man replies, struggling to be free. "But I can help you."

"How?" you ask, aware that, at any moment, Sara could move and change the balance of power all over again.

"Like this." he smiles.

In your desperation to keep his body down, you neglected to pay attention to his left arm. Now you see that he's pulled a small box from his pocket, and is pressing a button on it...

You knock the device from his hand, and it spirals away, off down the slope behind you, bouncing away into the distance...

Wait - Sara's shoe wasn't that big before! Looking around, you see that a wall rising up in front of you is merely where another layer of the shoe has been sewn on. It's almost as if...

"We're now less than a millimetre high." the stranger says, still smiling up at you. "Still want to refuse to do as I say?"

You give him no answer for now. The device that he used has fallen away, down away from the toe end of the shoe, under the crossing walkways that you know to be Sara's laces. You could get it, find a way to use it to turn yourself back to normal. Or shrink yourself even smaller.

You enter the machine, following the man through the shiny white corridors as the outer door closes behind you. It looks rather like a cross between the starship Enterprise and the TARDIS. Eventually you end up in something that looks rather like a cross between a living room and a control room. Your host taps a few controls and then invites you to sit on the settee.

"Okay," You comment as you both sit down, "What happened to me and why are you and all this on my scale?"

"I think your most vital questions will be answered with this statement." He says. "Naomi spent an extremely long time building both this molecular transport machine and a shrink ray." You look partially bewildered. "I am her brother." You're stunned. You remember Naomi mentioning an older brother but you didn't picture him like this.

"She wanted to test her shrink ray before using it on you, so I was the unwilling guinea pig." He continued. "Since it worked she showed great patience in letting me get used to it and explaining the controls of this machine. Of course they were all too large for me but once I had clearly understood how it all worked she then shrank it so I could come over to pick you up."

"Wait a minute." You say. "Wait a minute. How could she shrink me unless this has an inbuilt shrink ray?"

"Good guess." He answers. "But her shrink ray uses quantum energy fields to shrink things. First she locates the geographical location of her target, then she sets the field intensity and then that field is projected to and generated at the target so only the target is affected and nothing inbetween. Once the shrinking is complete the energy field disperses into the background radiation so nothing here has retained that energy field." You're still confused.

"What about this?" You ask, indicating what you're both in.

"Simple relativity." He answers. "E=mc². The machine disperses itself into an amount of energy that is stored on Naomi's computer, the matrix is then replicated at a pre-programmed geopgraphic location. It's a lot like going into a deep sleep, you're only unconscious for a second and then everything's back to normal."

In between these disturbances, you try to make sense of what's going on. Best you can figure it, it seems that the giantess - your host - is going out to celebrate the end of her exams. You've reached the edge of the seat, which seems to be one of the booth seats, fixed to the wall. Gazing out across the vast reaches of the room, you see the distant shapes of giants moving around, but realise that you were right - this is the Sheep.

There's enough room for another god or goddess to sit down next to her. You don't want to be hanging around here for too long, lest someone sits down and ends you.

But how do you get out of here? The giantess is moving, rolling with laughter or something, and doesn't look like a safe prospect. You were right to get off of her when you did.

You turn back to the rest of the room. It's a considerable distance to the floor, but you've climbed UP that far in the past, so climbing DOWN should be a doozy, right?

You almost fall, caught in the breeze as a giant passes by. Windmilling your arms, you manage to resist gravity's call, but it was a close call. Sitting down, you realise that this could be another way out of here. You could jump onto a passing person and let them carry you away again.

The breezes that they stir up tug at you, threatening to pull you off the wood, but you hang tight and don't give in.

It takes a while to reach the bottom, and when you do, you're exhausted.

You look around the darkened cavern, trembling as the floor rumbles with the footsteps of distant gods, and quailing as you watch not so distant gods walk past, almost close enough to touch.

You have a horrifying sense of deja vu...

Anyway, you don't know where the exit is. What are you doing, anyway? You need to get the help of a normal-sized person or you're doomed. One that isn't drunk, or about to become so.

A bit of a problem, in a student bar on the last night of exams.

Standing here isn't going to solve any problems. You need to be a bit more pro-active. Jumping onto moving feet (each one larger than a block of houses) doesn't seem like a good idea, so you need to find somewhere less full of traffic.

Sticking to the wall would be a good idea; you'd be less likely to get stepped on. That does mean that you're limited to going in one direction, though - that is, away from the seats.

On the other hand, you could chance running out into the middle of the storm of giant feet and head towards where most of the crowd is coming from. It's risky, but at the end it should be a lot more quiet.

The bar. Of course, where else would students go to, eh? You see it some way off, surrounded by giants and giantesses.

Where to now? You could approach one of the bar stools and climb it, to get the help of a barfly. Or you could take advantage of your tiny stature to get behind the bar, away from the crowds.

13221221112.content:
The one place in this room where there won't be a crowd of giants - behind the bar. Of course, getting there will be the trial.

It's more through luck than judgement that you survive your run, with feet crashing down all around you with enough force to end you instantly. Adrenaline is your friend, boosting you past the fear that threatens to overwhelm you.

Then, the bar itself is a shelter. Sparing no time to catch your breath - knowing that if you stop to think you'll realise the madness of this situation - you make for the collossal opening that takes you to shelter, far from the madding crowd.

The bar maid (just the one at this busy hour? Still, shouldn't complain...) stands still, doubtless pulling a pint or listening to a customer's order. Tight denim sheathes her legs, and peeking out from beneath are her toes, enclosed in massive, black mules. You could stow away there, and try to get some help in getting out of this situation from her at your leisure.

"She can't help you," says a voice from behind you as you take one step. You round on the speaker, and are astonished to see a man of the same size as you, dressed in what may once have been a sharp suit. Shades hide his eyes, but nothing can hide the slimy grin that splatters his jaw. "After all, you're just an insect to her."

As he says these further words, he begins to grow larger. No, it is you who are once again shrinking! It appears that you've been halved in size, now a pathetic half-inch in height!

You are silent and gaping as the man talks at you again. "Come with me, and I can help you..."

But do you want to trust someone who is prepared to shrink you even more? Perhaps he's just trying to keep you away from the woman because she is your one source of salvation!

On the other hand, he is the one that has demonstrated true control of this power, and you'd do anything for him to get back to normal...

"You can run," he shouts after you, "but I know how to find you when you change your mind!"

He's all talk. But the bar maid is all goddess. Before she was huge enough, but now she rises to excessive new heights. And all people in the world are this scale to you now...

Fortune must again be smiling upon you as she makes no movement during your approach. Must be enjoying a conversation, or something. The sole of her shoe is taller than you, but with a determined leap you get aboard, coming to rest in front of the big toe of this woman's left foot.

You have no time for rest, though. The smell isn't nearly as bad as you would have thought; maybe being smaller changes perceptions in more ways than one? There's no denying the fact that the warm flesh surrounding you is comforting given the terrors you've experienced recently. You could be forgiven for falling asleep.

You awaken some time later, still between two toes and still, as far as you can tell, unnoticed by the owner of the feet. The world still swirls and thumps around you, however, as some serious walking is done. It is with a chill in your heart that you notice, through your motion sickness, that you are no longer inside the bar! The woman appears to be walking along a street in the dark, accompanied (as you can see from the corner of your eye) by another woman, who seems to be wearing trainers in place of sandals.

Don't panic, you tell yourself, there's a way out of this. But is there somewhere that you can throw up from this distressing motion sickness?

Presumably no one will ever notice the small amount of puke that you hurl over the side of the shoe, but can you expect this woman to ever notice your half-inch tall self? You could stay with her - throughout her shattering walk home - only to be ignored when you get there. Or you could jump ship now, and try your luck elsewhere. You take the opportunity to look around the room, and eventually recognise it, helped perhaps by your getting a glimpse of the women's faces as they stoop to remove their footwear.

You're in Laura and Louise's room.

A pair of freshmen, they share a room. You know them mainly through the fact that both are crazy party animals, more interested in going out on the town every night than getting a degree. You're not even sure what courses they're taking.

Between them, they have everything you could desire in a woman, and many nights you've entertained yourself with thoughts of the two of them, together, although of course neither is a lesbian. But then, that's the advantage of a dream.

Now, of course, you have an unprecedented opportunity. Neither has, in the past, reacted to your advances. They are both flirtatious, but one night stands are their specialty. Not with you, sadly.

You think that, since you know them, it might be a good idea to reveal yourself to one of them. But which?

It was Louise's foot that you rode in on. She is more of a 'traditional' beauty, long haired and tanned, and always prepared to wear clothes than display her ample body. You should have remembered that she took up a job at the Sheep to fund her excessive nightlife.

On the other hand, Laura is almost the complete opposite. Taller, but with shorter, multi-coloured hair, she dresses more conservatively. However, she is the one that has actually talked to you the most, and is always ready with a smile on her face; Louise is certainly more morose, or at least, not as quick to humour.

Either one could be an aid in your quest to restore yourself to your proper height, but either could also crush you like a bug should she so choose.

Alternatively, since Laura won't yet be sure that she's crushed you - given the darkness and distance - you could grab onto her foot as you did with Louise's earlier, and allow her to carry you away. You stand still, breathing as calmly as you can manage, as Laura looms over you, a lopsided smile tilting her immense face. You prepare yourself for the crushing sensation of being picked up.

Instead, you feel the crushing sensation of being crushed. Laura has no intention of picking you up, only of grinding out the tiny bug that annoyed her room-mate. Her thumb descends, pressing you inexorably to the carpet. You cannot argue with its forceful pressure and weight, instead collapsing internally as she squeezes harder.

Vision blurs, and Laura's faint chuckling crowds your skull. Pain has overloaded you, and yet you still live. Perhaps she's not going to finish you, merely leaving you here, broken, to slowly die.

She lifts her thumb, but no relief follows. Your splattered body, clinging to consciousness, is dragged up with her, hanging before her face. before her mouth. That sound you hear is her tongue slithering across lips.

No. She wouldn't... That's SICK.

The thumb is inserted between her jaws, into the dark, clinging atmosphere of her mouth. She sucks, her tongue lightly prying your body free to swim in her saliva, drifting at her behest for as long as she wills, before she swallows,carrying you away to oblivion within her vast interior...

Of course, you were originally shrunk to an inch high too! Blinking, she looks across to you, her words barely audible over Laura's stammered excuse about dropping a pencil.

"What's going on? Who are you?"

"Questions can be answered later," Laura pronounces from above, "and I'll be thankful if you don't start yakking in my ear. You should be safe down there for a couple of hours."

The girl looks up at the source of the voice, and seeing the giant woman whose hand she sits in, she lets out all her panic. Even as Laura neatly places the two of you on her lap as she sits, her jeans and the desk itself hiding you from casual view, the recently shrunk girl screams. A little adrenaline carried her through the initial shock, but now it's full-on panic mode. She starts to run away from you, away from Laura, looking to jump or climb to the floor.

That's a real bad idea, but she's a big girl; proportionally, she's like twelve feet tall to you, and could do you some serious damage if you attempted to restrain her. But you can't just let her run off unsupervised into a lethal giant world...
13221221112111221112121112112122.title: Still the Smallest

choices: Tell her that you're as much a victim as she is
Tell her that she should be more worried about the giant woman above her
Tell her to let it all out
132212211121112211121211121121221.content:
You dash after the girl, racing across the rough denim terrain of Laura's lap as fast as you can. She can go faster. Her legs are almost twice as long as yours, and panic is lending her adrenaline. So you shout.

"Stop! It's dangerous, there's no way down! I can explain everything, just stop and listen!"

She does stop, and you slow to a jog to catch up, reaching her just as she rounds on you, teeth clenched and brow lowered. "Was it you that did this, huh? Come on, explain what you've done, and then undo it!"

The bespectacled giantess lunges for you, grabbing the collar of your shirt and effortlessly lifting you as if you were a child. Her eyes are wild as she examines your tiny face, then her nose wrinkles and she sneers. "You stink," she says, dropping you at her feet.

Well, you haven't had a chance to wash off last night's funtimes yet, not to mention the puking you did while on Louise's sandal. And as you land against thigh, those bones that snapped when Louise held you come right to the fore of your mind, prompting a moan of agony.

"Oh, did that hurt?" your aggressor says, laying a kick to your ribs for good measure. In a normal situation this wouldn't be so bad, but when she's twice your size it's like being attacked by a bear.

"Guess you picked the wrong girl to abduct, asshole!" she continues, crouching so that she can lay her large hands upon you again. Well, at least she's close enough to hear whatever words you have to say to convince her:
132212211121112211121211121121221.title: Think of Others

1322122111211122111212111212.content:
No, you like things fine just where you are! In time Louise's tongue withdraws, along with her hand, and the ground beneath you settles down, allowing you to gyrate ever more wildly with Laura's nipple.

Shadow passes over you, the light of the bedside lamp blocked as Louise shifts herself further up the bed, her tongue lashing at the upper landscape of Laura. Coated in sweat and panting, you take a moment to look up from your business. Laura is reciprocating, off in the distance up there, her own muscular tongue probing the heavens as it seeks to meet her room-mate's. They are tantalisingly out of reach, each powerful, damp tower of a tentacle waving back and forth.

So the women get closer.

You're crushed against Laura's breast as Louise's impacts you from above, the two women pressing ever closer, without care for the half-inch man between them. You flail and scream, but you are as much beneath notice as you are tit. Racing heartbeats are accompanied by the roar of expanding lungs, and as each woman moves - even fractionally - you are dragged apart, each limb popping free with agonising slowness. Your remains are further smeared as the two titans pull apart once, only to dive back into an embrace moments later, but by that point your consciousness has fled.
1322122111211122111212111212.title: Between Two Breasts

132212211121112211121211122.content:
The world becomes a blur of motion as Laura shakes her finger back and forth, but you're not letting go. You're onto a good thing here. Things settle down as the woman blearily raises you to eye level again.

"Fine," she says. "Fuck you."

The next move you don't see coming. No longer is there air to your back, but something solid. A wall? A bedpost? Regardless, the deadly power of the finger massages you against it, rubbing back and forth until your body caves, your limbs detaching and falling away, a good deal of your mass becoming ground into the whorled texture of the digit-tip.

Your smeared and mutilated carcass is barely a foot-note to a wasted life as the drunken giantess returns to sleep.
132212211121112211121211122.title: Too Clingy

choices: Laura decides to put you in her mouth.
Your goddess lays down "The Ten Commandments."
1322122111211122111212112.content:
"It's just a spider," Laura lies. This is too good any oppurtunity to share with even her friend Lousie. A little man is hanging from her finger! Endless possibilities lay ahead. She slips him quickly into her shirt before Louise turns around.

"Eww, did you at least kill it?" Louise asks, disgust clouding her voice.

"Yeah, I just smooshed it," Laura answers, pretending to wipe a spider's guts on the bedpost.

"OK, good. Now can we get some sleep? It's exams in the morning again," Laura says, dropping to her bed.

"Yeah, sure." Laura answers, not really paying attention. She slips into her bed, under her blanket, and then reaches into her shirt. You've been hanging by your hands from her bra, just seconds from dropping down into her shirt further. Your captress plucks you out from there and watches you with a clear intent. By the wry smile that lies on her lips and the glint of malpractice you'd spotted before in her eyes made you gulp.
1322122111211122111212112.title: "It's just a spider," she lies

132212211121112211121212.content:
You go with it, letting go your grip on Laura's foot as her finger sideswipes you. You've fallen further than this when Louise threw you, so you've nothing to fear from the multi-coloured vista below. You even manage to bounce a little on the carpet strands.

Lying on your back, you gaze back up at the giantess as she lowers her foot to the ground once more, settling a minor tremor through the floor. She's so imposing, not just from scale but from posture, fully in the predator mould, prepared to do whatever it takes to get her prey.

Today, that would be you.

"I'll do it right this time," Laura snarls, raising her heel. On your back, you don't have time to move before she slams it down directly upon you, thundering a mass several thousand times your own through you, pulping you instantly and drawing out a small groan from Louise.
132212211121112211121212.title: Yeah, That Made a Difference

13221221112111221112122.content:
Oh yeah, hide on the foot of a woman who is, at this very moment, scouring said foot for the slightest sign of you? Good luck with that.

You scrunch up as small as you can, staying as still as possible, but still Laura somehow manages to spot you. She must have the eyes of a hawk, or something.

"Yup, got that sucker," she tells her room-mate, rubbing at the remains of the crushed insect with her nail, prying it off her foot.

You - aforementioned 'remains' - are mangled beyond recognition in the process, the tremendous muscles of the giantess pulping you beneath their implacable progress, before your utterly destroyed corpse bits are thrown to the floor, and Laura returns to bed to get some sleep.

Louise lies awake, fearing that there may be more insects about.
13221221112111221112122.title: Finished

choices: Wait it out at the doorway
Go exploring
Try to crawl back inside
132212211121112211122.content:
You have come to rest on a thin ledge of white material, lying against a wall of the same colour. Above you, Laura's voice thunders, and your resting place shudders in time with her words.

"I see it, Lou."

A hand, similar in dimension to Louise's but sporting short, neatly trimmed nails, swoops into vision, ducking below you to tug at the end of the white wall, below you. Looking down, you see that the wall terminates at the top of an immense flesh-coloured pillar which leads down to a foot -

It's Laura's leg. You've landed on a crease in her shorts, which means -

Your thoughts are interrupted as Laura's hand pulls her shorts taut, removing the ledge upon which you rest and letting you drop into an abyss.

Once again you land hard, this time on a soft, warm surface. As you lie on your back and rotate your head slightly, you make out fingers at the periphery of your vision, clawing toward the sky...

You're resting in the palm of Laura's hand, and in the sky her ignorant face looks down at the 'insect' she's holding.

"Have you got it?" Louise yells from somewhere out of sight.

"Yes. I'll just take it outside, okay?" Laura replies, each small movement of her mouth during the speech horrific to you, as her gaping maw reveals monstrous teeth capable of rending your tiny form in twain with a single bite.

The hand cups, rolling you to a pit in her palm as her head moves out of sight, the giantess walking away. The immense creaking of the door as it opens into the student hall corridor is like a thousand roadworks.

Then comes the descent, and you are surprised as you remain sitting in the hand despite the incredible velocities. Then Laura's face returns, and you think that she may be about to offer you a respite as she takes a deep breath.

Hot wind buffets you, blasting you off the palm and to the floor, which isn't that far away. You turn to see the mountain of Laura wave at you before it stands to its full height and closes the doorway of the gods, denying you access to their room and leaving you alone in the dark.

The floorboards continue to vibrate as Laura returns to her bed, and you struggle to come to terms with what to do next.

You could make your bed here, and sleep the night away, hopefully to find a more accepting pair of women come the morning (when they're not so drunk). Or, you could leave them to it, and explore the other residents of this place, one of whom may be able to help you.
132212211121112211122.title: Palmed

choices: Laura
Louise
Just get inside the room and wait for later
1322122111211122111221.content:
It is a fitful night of sleep that you 'enjoy', curled up like a dog (a half-inch tall dog, at that) outside his master's door. It's cold as well, and your dreams are haunted by distorted titans trying to catch and eat you.

The clacking noise of the monolithic door above you being unlocked awakens you, and you quickly get to your feet as it swings away from you, revealing Laura ready to leave.

Her feet - each with a different colour of nail polish - are clad in white sandals, her legs mainly bare below small white shorts. She's wearing a t-shirt of some description, but you can't make out much more as you strain to look up so high. She's swinging sunglasses onto her forehead though as she turns back to talk to her room-mate. As she does so she moves her feet a little, and you dive for cover as one swings carelessly near your own standing place, impacting with a tremor.

"You sure you're not coming?" Laura shouts, even louder than her foot-stomp, even with the distance.

"I'm sure," comes Louise's mumbled reply. "I think I need to sleep this hangover off..."

Well, one is staying in the room and one is setting off to campus. Again you have to choose between the pair, but which shall you go for?
1322122111211122111221.title: A Bright New Morning

choices: Laura stops off at a cafe
Laura heads straight to class
Laura meets someone on the way
13221221112111221112211.content:
After your great experience with Louise's feet last night, you've come to think of yourself as something of an expert at this sandal-riding lark, so you waste no time in clambering aboard Laura's while she keeps it relatively still. As an added bonus, with the sleep you've only recently woken from, you should hopefully manage to keep yourself awake throughout the journey this time!

You edge yourself cautiously around the mammoth toes, freezing occasonally as one of them flexes with car-crushing power, until you reach the natural gap between the biggest toe and its neighbour, further defined by the sandal strap running down. Sliding yourself in there and breathing in the heady musk of a healthy young foot, you settle down for the ride.

Laura's attempt to persuade Louise to join her ended, she moves on, closing the door behind her. Once more you and your stomach are violently jolted with each step, but the rolling pain isn't so new to you now, and you hold your nerve. Still, it remains impossible to see exactly where you're going, so you'll have to wait until your carrier stops before you can get a lay of the land.
13221221112111221112211.title: Different Foot, Same Ride

choices: Try your hand at womaneering again
Go look for Cassie
Stay just where you are
132212211121112211122111.content:
The tormentous journey ceases eventually, and as Laura briefly pauses to survey her surroundings, you do the same. Chairs. Tables. Giants coming and going. Recognising the logo on the apron one of the serving-people is wearing, you realise that your ride has stopped off at a local cafe, near the Sheep but far enough away for you to not concern yourself with that fact at your scale.

More steps, each shaking you to the core down among her toes, take Laura across to a seat, and as her monstrous ass crashes down onto it, you wonder whether you should stick with her - scaling her body as she sits to make contact - or else spring for freedom and try to find another familiar face amongst the giants at the cafe. For one thing, if your friend Cassie is working today, you could get her help! And it would certainly beat climbing up another sitting woman, as your experience back in the exam hall is still fresh in your mind.
132212211121112211122111.title: Boy, Does She Need the Coffee

choices: Persist in getting Laura's attention
Head off for pastures new
132212211121112211122112.content:
The journey is longer than you remember - but then, you were asleep - and heads up and down more flights of stairs. Laura does tend to bound across roads in front of moving cars rather than wait for the lights to tell her its safe, and those are certainly interesting moments as you cling to her toes for dear life, the world dashing past you at an even more incredible rate, if one can imagine it.

But the journey does at last end, and no sooner have you caught your breath and settled back to lean against the mighty foot behind you than it is withdrawn, causing you to collapse onto the smelly sole of its sandal.

Coughing and spluttering, you look upwards to see the feet cheekily tucking themselves out of view underneath Laura's ass, as she settles down in a seat in a lecture theatre. You've been abandoned, cut off from human contact, so it would seem.

Or not. Other giants and giantesses are taking seats nearby, and many of them leave their feet on the floor, awesome structures that flex and crush with idle impatience. With exam season in progress, classes like this one are nothing but time-fillers, requirements that the university demands be filled even if the lecturers have nothing else left to teach their students. Attention will not be being paid to the matter at hand; this could be your opportunity to get noticed!

And it needn't be Laura that you try to attract, if you don't want to.
132212211121112211122112.title: Going Through the Motions

choices: Walk into the bathroom
Climb the bedsheets
Hide until she goes away
13221221112111221112212.content:
Screw Laura. She's the one that dumped you out here. Louise, on the other hand, deserves another chance. You dash through the door just in the nick of time, Laura closing it with near explosive force, sending you skidding along the floor into the room.

You dust yourself down, and look around the cavernous chamber. Louise is still in bed, probably buried under her covers, and so you can see very little of her. May as well make yourself at home while you wait for her to -

BLAM! She jumps from her bed and lands so heavily that once more you are dashed down. As she stampedes away, you are kept in place, partly by the tremors carrying through the floor, and partly out of fear for being stomped. When both have subsided, you glance upwards to see Louise in her bathroom, lifting the lid on the toilet. Seconds later, you hear a torrent like a polluted waterfall, which can only be her throwing up into the bowl.

Looking away from the sight, you ponder the wisdom of approaching the giantess while she's in such a state, and instead look to her bed. Hmm, it seems that, when she jumped out so hurridly, Louise dislodged her bedsheets, leaving them forming a bridge from the floor to the surface of the bed. You could climb up there while Louise pukes her guts out, and meet with her in bed once she's done...
13221221112111221112212.title: Hangover

choices: Tickle Louise's feet
Dash around the front end
Try and climb her as unnoticably as possible
132212211121112211122121.content:
You trek across the rainbow-hued rug, eyes fixed upon the back of the kneeling giantess before you. Her bare feet are the first part of her landscape that you near, soles skyward as she hangs her head over the toilet bowl.

Was it only the night before that these monsters carried you to this place? Now they look so helpless. Granted, each is several times bigger than a house from your persepctive, but by being at rest their fearful potential for mayhem is far at the back of your mind.

Looking up, past the toes and sole to the heel and ankle, you ponder your next course of action. Would it be a good idea to scrabble at Louise's feet now, in this moment of weakness? Or should you pull back from these potential stompers of your puny body and move around to her front, beneath her face, where she may well spot you in more friendly circumstances?
132212211121112211122121.title: Path of Attack

choices: Louise, through an alcoholic haze, recognises your form
Louise tosses the bug into the toilet and flushes it away
Louise is distracted as she throws up again
1322122111211122111221212.content:
Louise must have gone on some drinking binge after she closed up the bar - surely she couldn't have gotten herself this drunk while at work? That'll be something to ask her about, once you strike up a conversation.

For now, you're busy walking past her calf and thigh, the latter resting upon the former as she kneels, compressing both together beneath the colossal mass and weight that the giantess possesses, so that their considerable, daunting size is emphasised all the more, slumped mountains of flesh that can't help but put you in fear for your life.

Yes, it truly is humbling to have a sight that would normally be highly erotic - Louise in her skimpy nightwear - instead become a possible portent of destruction, representing a creature that could unthinkingly smash all you are from existence with a single, casual movement of one gargantuan limb or digit.

Another echoed torrent from the toilet edifice before you adds another reason for the sexiness to be downgraded in much the same manner as your own stature - it's hard to be turned on by someone throwing up, no matter how attractive they might be.

Past her knee - solid as a rock, larger than a house - and you prepare yourself for the business of confronting a goddess made flesh. You startled her the first attempt, so now you need to handle this with kid gloves.

Thump. Something impacts in front of you, and you jump in shock. Upon closer examination, the pooled substance would appear to be a grainy splodge of liquid, of an off-mustard hue. Casting your gaze upwards, neck arched back as far as you dare, you notice Louise absently wiping at the chin with the back of one street-smashing hand. Her eyes are only half open, as is her mouth when the low moan rips free from it, carrying down to you like an ominous portent of doom.

This is it. Now or never. Her eyes are diverted, downcast, and you may not get another chance like this. You wave your hands above your head, jumping and shouting at the same time, and find the attracted scrutiny of the giantess drawn your way, eyes zeroed in on you like spotlights, almost accusing in their focus.

"More bugs?" Louise mutters. "Listen, buddy, I don't have time for this right now. I'm not messing around now."

She had you at bugs - had you preparing to run, that is. But you cannot outdistance this vastly superior person's nonchalent grab, finger and thumb smashing either side of you with enough raw power to shatter many of the bones in your body. Your mangled body is then hoisted high into the air as Louise stands, dragging the air from your lungs with that everyday motion.

Through the pain, you blinkingly notice the toilet bowl below you, a mixed ocean of water and vomit swirling greedily, waiting for Louise to drop you in to join it.

"Guess I'm too hungover to be scared of you," Louise says, dragging you back before her face one more time, washing you in breath that is rancid and foul, issued forth from a cavernous mouth full of tremendous teeth.

This is your final hope; she's bringing you before her face one last time before disposing of you. If good luck is with you, she might finally notice that you're human! Oh, please God...
1322122111211122111221212.title: Judgement of Louise

choices: Agree to accompany the stranger
Defy him, and be shrunk more
Demand answers before choosing
13221221112111221112212121.content:
You've been here before. Louise, holding you between finger and thumb, crushing your bones and organs. The pain is lesser now, as there's little inside you that hasn't already been shattered or burst, but still it exists as the giantess inspects you intimately with her ferris-wheel eyes.

"Oh. My. God," she breathes at last, and you'd let out your own sigh of relief were it not for the velocity at which you are suddenly borne away.

You are lowered, realtively gently, onto a flat, wooden surface. Your limbs give out and you sprawl, leading to the moon above you to take on a concerned expression, face creasing new valleys as Louise furrows her brow.

"I'm sorry!" she booms across at you, adding ears to the list of damaged parts. "I didn't see what you were! I'm still not quite sober... Wait there - I'll be right back."

Wait here. As if there was any way in which you could escape, with your fractured, useless legs. All you can do is watch as Louise takes her skyscraper form away, turning her considerable back to you and opening wide a drawer at the bottom of the colossal cupboard opposite. You must be lying on her desk, you conclude.

Arousal stirs slightly in you - reminding you that you're alive - as you observe her rooting around for something, her posterior moving in interesting ways before your very eyes. Sure, to you her arse is large enough to roll over entire suburbs, but it's still perfectly formed, and not covered by much in the way of clothing. If you were to die, this would be a last sight you'd be willing to accept...

Then your view is blocked out as someone steps before you. Someone of the same size as you, wearing dark glasses...

"I hope you've had enough time to think over my offer," he says. "Looks like you aren't enjoying your current stature much. Would you like to cease this foolish resistance and come with me, now?"

Why is he still trying to tempt you? In your condition, there's nothing you can do to resist him if he decided to take you away, so there must be some deeper explanation. If he needs you to acquiesce, that leaves you a measure of power, no matter how small that may be.

That, and a normal-sized protector. You raise your voice to call out to Louise, to bring her to your aid.

"Scream all you want," he sneers. "Your voice won't carry far enough at this size. But if you think that a half-inch is the smallest you can get, you'd be surprised. Not that I'd ever threaten you, of course. It's just that I really think it would be in your best interests to come with me."

So, what's it to be?
13221221112111221112212121.title: Return of the Nemesis

choices: Try to tag along with Louise
Leave her to it and try to regain your sanity
132212211121112211122121212.content:
The man takes your refusal with good grace. "So be it. When next I visit you, perhaps you'll have finally seen sense. Two defiant stands followed by a final acquiescence does have a literary quality to it, however..."

He's gone then, all of a sudden and with no trace of his passing remaining. With him goes your pain, and you stand up to find your body in, more or less, full working order.

And the world around you is far, far larger.

In shrinking your body down even further, your broken parts must have been tightly knitted together as they were compacted. But still, what are you even breathing now?

The moment you become aware of the motion of your lungs you choke for a few seconds as you try to reassert your subconscious control of them, and then everything is fine. Better not ask questions like that; if you're alive, you shouldn't question the physics of the situation too deeply.

The vastness of Louise returns to the desk, crossing the country of her dorm-room carpet in seconds, and looming larger now than she ever has before, in any of the three previous scales at which you've regarded her. She lays one hand flat, palm-down, on the surface not too far from your position, and while her fingers were mighty redwoods in their previous incarnation, now the simple distance up to the fingernail of her pinky is closer to that height. A millimetre must be bigger than you, you reckon. Her eyes, moons themselves where once her head filled that role, scan back and forth around your position, refusing to focus on your diminished self. Crap, unless she's specifically looking for someone your size, she's just gonna glance over you!

Then there is no more thought, as Louise speaks, her voice carrying down from the heavens with such volume as to drown out all else. "Hello?" she says, haltingly. "Where did you - No, of course it wasn't there, Lou. It couldn't have been, could it? You're seeing things. Clearly working too hard. Crap! I'm going to miss my day job!"

At that last statement she rises to her full height, hurridly withdrawing her hand and whipping you from your feet with the air currents. A second job? you muse as you push yourself upright again. Damn, she's busy.

No kidding. You watch the goddess as she hurridly shrugs clothes on and gets ready to leave. It's the sheer scale of her endeavours that makes it enthralling. Before, there was a mild curiosity involved in watching a human being the size of a skyscraper go about their daily business, but now that you can quite confidently think of yourself as a speck there's a certain requirement to observe.

She dominates the room. Too big to draw any real-world size comparisons now, the simple fact is that she can't be ignored, avoided or escaped. The breasts that she all-too-quickly conceals beneath a black t-shirt could serve as hilltop settlements for entire communities of people your size, and each thread of the denim in the jeans that she is pulling up over her shapely legs is probably thicker than your torso. Quick movements, great distances, and a strength that staggers you - the girl is so far above you now that you almost begin to doubt your own existence.

Louise is yakking on her cellphone as she drags on sneakers. "Yeah, I know I'm running late, but you can delay filming for a little bit right? I'm on my way now! Oh, and you wouldn't believe what I saw this morning! It was like a little half-inch tall guy on my desk! I know! Guess I'm getting into character already! Ha-ha! 'Kay, see you shortly!"

You have no idea what she's talking about, but the fact that she's going to leave shortly is plain. If you wanted to go with her, you'd better make some attempt, like getting up to the handbag that she's left on the desk, almost a mile away from your current position.

Or, if you're really regretting refusing that mysterious guy's offer this time, maybe you should leave the goddess-that-can't-see-you-at-your-new-size alone and just wait here, thinking of some other plan.
132212211121112211122121212.title: Goddess Made Flesh

choices: At her day job, Louise receives a call
At her day job, Louise's bag is knocked over, spilling its contents
On her way to her day job, Louise's bag is stolen
1322122111211122111221212121.content:
The hustle and bustle of Louise finishing her preparations thunders through your consciousness as you sprint towards her handbag, rising like a mountain before you. Exactly how you're going to get inside it you don't know, but you can ponder that problem once you've reached it. If only Louise would stop making so much noise...

Whump. Your route is blocked as something appears before you, concussive force throwing you from your feet again. The brief sensation of Louise's hand flying over you passes, and you sit up to see her cellphone placed casually before you.

The sheer face of its plastic pink side rises before you, and you consider yourself lucky not to have been splattered beneath it. More fortunate still, it provides ample opportunity to tag along with Louise!

The surface is smooth, but at your miniscule size otherwise unnoticable nicks become perfect handholds, and it's a matter of a few moments before you are ducking for shelter in the overhung plateau that marks a break in the casing, where two sides meet.
