Again, nothing much at regular scale, but a welcome rest for a traveller such as yourself.

Not a moment too soon, either! The structure takes to the air, presumably lifted by Louise, and you throw yourself flat against the wall, pressing with all your might to avoid being tipped away when she slides it into her handbag.

Then all is darkness as the 'phone comes to rest within the depths of the bag. Best not to go exploring, for fear of something terrible befalling you. And let's face it, the cellphone is probably your best chance of contacting Louise again, so you stick with it for now.

You wonder how long you'll have to tolerate the endless shifting of Louise's motions, utterly unknowable within the stygian blackness of this pit...
1322122111211122111221212121.title: Cellphone Salvation

choices: You panic and flee
You reason that Louise may notice you while looking downwards
You run toward her, figuring she'll step past you
13221221112111221112212121212.content:
An eternity in the dark, pressed up against the cold, cold plastic of Lousie's cellphone casing. The bag around you sways gently with the movements of its owner, movements more on a par with tectonic shifting than any walking you'd be familiar with.

Descent breaks the monotony, and empty thoughts crowd your head as your stomach rises fitfully. The whole area shakes as the bag thumps angrily to the ground. It may have been a gentle lowering to the giants outside, but in your scale it's a monumental catastrophe.

It's no surprise that you have fallen loose from your hiding place, scattered to the floor amongst scraps of dust and fluff. Monolithic items whose familiarity you just can't place at the moment rise above you, defining the landscape with their jutting angles and weighty presence.

Those may be voices you hear outside, but it's hard to make out exactly what's being said. Louise may just have said 'let's do it,' but it could just as easily have been 'that's stupid.' That second sentiment matches your current situation most aptly.

Time passes again, more peacefully this time around, and you find yourself hesitantly approaching the cascading light that enters from your right, through the upended opening of the bag. Cooped up for so long in shadow, it would be nice to experience its lack once more.

Naturally, the journey takes time, and even as the tempting beacon is bathing you in its radiance, bringing blinks to your eyelids with its intensity, you can hear a sentence that's not ambiguous in anyway, shouted as it is by some man:

"Would someone please get that bag off the set?"

You have seconds in which to worry about what you should do before a tremendous impact carries the floor, ceiling and walls away from you - while the bag may have been kicked away or whatever, you were left trailing in its wake, ejected outwards into the wider world whether you like it or not.

The bellowed word 'action' is the accompaniment to your dazed recovery, as your eyes adjust to the new lighting and you check yourself for injuries. Luckily, it's nothing too serious.

You sit up to inspect your surroundings, and find yourself sitting in a giant street. It's all outsize, way too large for a person of your stature to interact with, but as you examine it further you see that it's not as outscale as you'd have imagined. Where previously you were less than a millimetre tall, as you measure yourself against the height of a postbox you are overjoyed to see yourself able to be measured in inches again! It's a small start, but it does show that the process you underwent is reversing!

Now to find help, and protection in this shuddering world. You keep your head lowered to prevent the awesomeness of the skyscrapers overwhelming your senses, but dash full out toward the stationary foot of a business-suited man. When you've reached his toe, you jump up and down, waving your hands in the air.

He makes no move, no sound. He stands perfectly still. Suspiciously so. Climbing up onto his shoe to perhaps attract the doofus' attention, you notice that it has no shoelaces. In fact, it blends seamlessly into his ankle and trouser-leg, as if there were no flesh beneath and he was in fact -

He's not real, you realise, as you register the trembling in the fake sidewalk and hang your head. You haven't been grown at all, remaining the height you were previously. Instead, this is some toy landscape, put up here as part of Louise's day job, whatever it is that she does to get money in and pay her debts. It involves a model set and a film crew, so what's her role?

Further down the 'street', an immense, regular-sized foot pushes around from behind a skyscraper, a high-heeled and open-toed shoe hanging underneath it. Slowly it lowers on top of a model car, applying pressure to burst it open and crush it as a deliberate process.

Her second foot glides neatly in alongside, and somewhere, so far above that you're almost lying on your back to register it, a bikini-clad Louise places hands on hips and announces her intention to destroy the city.

Hot damn, it seems that she films macrophile movies in her spare time, and you're on the set of one. She fully intends to crush every little person she finds, unaware that there's a genuine shrunken man, impossibly beneath her notice, right there amongst them.

Perhaps now would be a good time to run.
13221221112111221112212121212.title: A Day Job Above the Skyscrapers

choices: Stick with the toy man as he is picked up
Think better of this, head for the safety of the abandoned shoe
Run to get off the set
132212211121112211122121212122.content:
Giants previously have moved with speed, overtaking you with their motions. They are not big, you are small, and so they stride about at regular speed, making them more dazzling and awesome.

Louise lumbers. In her role as a giantess, she steps with slowness, her feet rising majestically above the street, allowing you to luxuriate in the motions of her muscles before those muscles come thundering down, toy cars shattering as impacts ripple up her calves. Far, far above, Louise claws her fingers, snarling like Godzilla as she surveys the tiny scene.

You tear your eyes away from the titan, but your ears cannot shut out the noise of her roars and steps, the crushing of the toy props beneath her, the shuddering through your bones. Get her attention... The cars are getting crushed, the buildings are getting - yes, that explosion was her sitting on one, gushing downwards in height beneath irresistible weight. No, the only object here that may not be destroyed is this human effigy. A victim.

Scuttling up to the manniquin, you clutch tight to its foot as Louise finally walks in your direction, again that slow, shuddering pace, now with words toppling from above, promising revenge on the man, death at her hands...

She stops, feet either side, toes flexing as she sizes up her opponent, still reciting a list of his sins against her. You can see up her legs, and now realise why they were shaved so smooth. The cameras out there must be zooming in for great macro detail, no room for any rogue hairs. Although at your newer scale, there'll probably be some that you could see...

A shoe is kicked to one side, scattering toy cars briefly before a bare foot - hanging in the air long enough for the viewer to luxuriate in its freed textures - swoops downward.

Toes clutch at the statue above you, walls of flesh with craggy cliff-faces sporting toe-jam, squeezing close around... Maybe this wasn't the best idea...
132212211121112211122121212122.title: Come And Get Me

choices: Shout up to Louise, now that she's so close
Move from the man to the skin of the toes
Cling tight and pray for the best
1322122111211122111221212121221.content:
The man's - the figure's - shoe is clumsily made, and finding somewhere to grab on is not difficult. Finding the courage to cling tight as Louise's foot smashes down around you, her big and second toe surrounding your anthropomorphic shelter, is difficult. Perhaps a whimper escapes as the canyon closes, effortlessly pressing against the figurine, close enough for you to make out the maze of prints encasing each deathly digit.

There is a screech as the impressive skin smooshes onto the plastic, deforming around it in an incredible fashion. Gravity gives way as the foot hefts your platform heavenward, and you smile to yourself once again. Louise's foot - you've seen it at so many scales now! From when you were normal, to stumbling across her in the bar at an inch, riding it home at half-an-inch and now seeing its mere toes as deities in their own right.

Deities that wrest the titanic sculpture you hold onto up with ease! Louise is clearly still trying to emulate the ponderous movements of an actual giant, but still it's an incredible rush to be so lifted. And to just gaze at the textures of the toes...

Then there's a loud hum, and you look over your shoulder to see the slithering tongue of Louise massaging her lips, and once again the toes seem very small. How is she flexible enough to get her foot this close to her face?

Well, looks like you've achieved your goal in one way. There's the face of the goddess, the one that brought you here, that saw you as human, just for a moment - and now she's a ravenous demon, words slurring from her mouth as she hams up her role:

"Well, don't you look good enough to eat..."

Yes, she's talking to the toy between her toes rather than you, but you'll be along for the ride if you're not careful.
1322122111211122111221212121221.title: Oh, the Possibilities...

choices: Go along with the ride
Extricate yourself
Clean yourself off
13221221112111221112212121212211.content:
It's ineffectual defiance, you know that, but in the literal face of a woman so far beyond you your mind finds solace in absurdity. So you shout up at Louise, a miniscule speck stuck to a toy that she holds between her toes. You can barely hear the words yourself, so loud is the sound of her delighted moans of pleasure at the thought of devouring so small a man.

Further demonstrating her flexibility, her foot and mouth meet, a whale-sized tongue lashing at the statuesque miniature, running up and down its surface a number of times. At the foot end you are spared the saliva, but can still hear the creaking of the fragile plastic beneath the exertion of that powerful muscle.

Once more you attempt verbal contact, as the tongue is lowered, allowing the full majesty of Louise's maw to gape wide before you, rows of teeth lining an entrance from which gushes a stinking wind of breath. Such heat emanating from that dark, dripping cavern... Now your voice turns to a scream as you are plunged inside the woman.

Now the moaning is all around you, in pitch darkness as the tongue smashes your shelter back and forth, grinding against teeth with nightmarish force. No one could blame you for losing your grip, falling against something wet, gooey and infinitely stronger than you.

Still, it's enough to push you to your limit and beyond. Now you're not only shouting, but bashing away with arms and legs, all your strength directed against the uncaring mass of Louise's tongue. She won't even notice as she kills you...

Then the mouth opens again, light gushing in to add being blinded to the laundry list of hurts you've suffered. Sound crushes against you as well as you're ejected from the mouth with a cough, crashing against a surface in a splatter of saliva. With slowness born of internal injury, you wipe goo from your eyes and look around, finally hearing some sense from the words of the gods above you:

"I said no bugs," Louise snarls. "I'm not eating bugs. You think you can get away with sneaking them in and I won't notice?"

"We didn't! It must have gotten there by accident! Let me see."

The surface you lie upon rises into the air and, scared, you roll to your back, looking up at Louise and a similarly gigantic man looking right back down. Feeling exposed, you look to either side, beholding the ridged landscape of Louise's fingertip.

"That's not an insect at all..." the man gasps. "It's... a little man? Oh, we're going to be rich..."

"I found him," Louise insists, "and you're not getting him without me being along for the ride."

Okay, so you've been spotted - but is this how you want it to be? Neither of these people wants to help you get back to normal, and you're almost glued to the tip of this finger... Should you go to the effort of trying to escape?
13221221112111221112212121212211.title: A Star Is Born

choices: Right hand for yes
Left hand for no
Frown and fold your arms
132212211121112211122121212122111.content:
No, you settle down where you are, the pulsing rhythm of blood in the fingertip below you almost normal in comparison to the dialogue between gods above you. Louise talks with the director, and seems to win the argument as he walks away, and she lowers herself into a sitting position on some unseen chair.

Then her eyes return to you, curiosity all too obvious in such massive optics. Her mouth opens, and she addresses you personally, a whispered voice like thunder:

"Are you the same guy I saw in my room this morning?"

Are you? Has it only been a day? Before you, incalculably huge, is the same woman that carried you home from the bar between her toes, whose body you explored while she slept, whose eye you opened. She, in turn, ground your bones between her fingers, threw you across a room and prompted her friend to kill you. It's been a crazy time, and you hope that finally having someone take a calm notice in you will mean this comes to an end.

You also know that there's no way she can her your pitiful voice.

"Just raise your right hand for yes, and the left for no, okay?"
132212211121112211122121212122111.title: The Path to This Point

choices: tell Louise that yes, she is more beautiful as a goddess
No, the imagination under-represents the danger
Pass on answering
1322122111211122111221212121221111.content:
"Really?" Louise gasps. "Oh my gosh. You're shrinking even smaller? I'm so sorry for everything! I could have swallowed you just now!"

She takes a breath - a billion of your breaths - before continuing.

"I'm just doing this for a bit of extra cash, honest. It's not so bad, pretending to smash up toy cars and buildings. But some of these creeps? They try to get me working with insects, crushing 'em, eating 'em, the whole deal. And I hate insects, I guess you realise first hand? But I couldn't bring myself to kill a living creature still, not personally. It just seems so wrong to me. How could someone find that a turn-on?"

Her face hoves in closer, as if she hopes to get a better impression of your expression, not that there's any chance of your facial features being discernible at your current size of a dot. "Do you? It's a personal question, feel free to tell me to go to Hell -" Oh sure, you'll anger this massive giantess! "- but with your actual experience being so small, I think you're better qualified than any of the guys around here, huh?"

Her hand moves back again, almost to a full arm's distance, and you can take in a greater measure of the bikini-clad landscape of Louise's body, from crossed legs across midriff and chest, to face of wonder and expectation.

Well? How has it been, you ask yourself? Your first act upon finding yourself shrunk - albeit to a now giant-seeming one inch - was to throw yourself at some random woman's foot, and for her to throw you away with a mere flex of her toe! Has this life been all that your fantasy's cracked it up to be?
1322122111211122111221212121221111.title: I Was That Insect

choices: Gesture wildly that you're too hurt to take part right now
Remain calm, let her decide
Run away!
13221221112111221112212121212211111.content:
Of course, at the moment there's very little you can do to communicate with the regular people who are so far above you. Yet as you stand atop a finger tip at arm's length from the coy, curious expression on Louise's face, there's one universal gesture that you're sure she'll understand.

You stand for a moment, flexing your damaged body, then drop to your knees, simultaneously raising both your arms above your head. With an elaborate flourish you bend at the waist, pressing your hands and head flat against the warm skin, to rise again and bow again, showing the goddess that you are not worthy, that she is a being worthy of worship.

Louise laughs at that, and even at so removed a distance the explosive sound rocks you in place. Oh, to have brought joy to such a beautiful, powerful creature! You bask in the sound for as long as it lasts, before the looming male shadow of the director interrupts.

"It'll take a while to get equipment suitable for making the most of this opportunity," he says, "but while you're both here, we could try a proof of concept. The camera's good enough to capture a look at the little guy, so what say we have him stand at your foot and then climb up you, so's we can get a good idea of what he's capable of, and how well we can film it?"

Louise, still smiling, rolls her eyes in thought before glancing back your way. You have no say in her decision, but you are still hurting from your recent adventure inside her mouth, so maybe you should make it clear to her that you're not up to mountain(ous woman)-climbing?
13221221112111221112212121212211111.title: Worship

choices: Go around the nail
Go over the nail
132212211121112211122121212122111112.content:
"Well," Louise sighs, rolling the word over in her mouth as her eyes continue to examine you, "this little guys been through a lot. He deserves a reward."

Oh good; she's not going to make you climb her feet.

"Don't keep me waiting, little guy," Louise purrs, finishing with a kiss blown through pursed lips. Then she stoops, forcing you to stumble and grasp to the thick ridges of her fingertip for support.

Oh no; she's going to make you climb her feet.

You roll neatly to the ground once it is close enough, then watch the entrancing sight of such an impossibly massive form standing once again. It is a good, long while before you can bring yourself to lower your gaze enough to make out the still towering toes, shoes discarded off to one side.

A step forward, then two. These appendages loom over a dozen storeys tall. How do they expect you to scale even the smallest of those, let alone the leg and beyond? Still, with the feeling of that immense camera-eye on you constantly, you'd better try to show them the worth of not crushing you like a bug.

As you reach the base of the toe, where the flesh mass curves upward, the ridges are almost equal to you in height, a rising strata of platforms. Peering closer, the building blocks of this living cliff-face become apparent: the individual skin cells making up Louise's surface are visible, and strong enough to provide hand holds!

Heaving your bodyweight up as you climb grits your teeth, brings your breath gasping out. So long as Louise can resist the urge to wriggle these massive monsters this is totally possible! Of course, you'll need to rest for a week to get these burning muscles back under control...

You're nearing the top, but as your left hand reaches up, it slaps against something hard, smooth and cold. It retracts instinctively, and for a moment you dangle from one arm, almost losing your fight with gravity. An effort of will, and you wench your fingers back into the skin, saving yourself a fall to the ground.

What the Hell was that? Are they messing with you, is there no way to pass their test? Why would they - No. Wait. Relax. It's just her toenail! Nothing to worry about. Its solid surface will present an obstacle, but forewarned you can bypass it. Just... how?

Still dangling, you weigh up the choices before you. One way would be pushing yourself along the side of the toe, into the stinking canyon of flesh separating it from the next, shimmying across until you reach a nail-less surface to pull yourself up.

But with the dank stench, why would you put yourself through that? An alternative would be to bring yourself to the very edge of the nail, the fresher skin peeling from underneath it, and heave yourself over in one effort, onto the smooth surface.
132212211121112211122121212122111112.title: Foot of the Mountain

choices: Give up on climbing
Give climbing all you've  got
1322122111211122111221212121221111121.content:
When you were between these toes yesterday, during your ride home from the bar, the smell hadn't been terribly bad. Tolerable enough that you'd been able to get to sleep, even! That was when you were a mighty half-inch tall; now you're far, far smaller, and as you edge along to the space between two toes - a mighty gulf indeed! - it's almost unnoticeable. In fact, besides the strain on your arms as you pull yourself along the ridges in Louise's skin, there's no real hardship. This climb will just take time, that's all.

The silence you live in - save for your own grunts and heavy breathing - is shattered by a voice from on high, the mouths of the gods. "Little bastard's crawling out of sight! Hey, Louise, could you maybe raise your toe or something? We need him on camera!"

"No problem, chief!" You cease your climbing as the skin surface before you rumbles, followed by the sound of a tremendous impact behind you, tonnes of flesh and bone slapping down hard. Risking a glance over your shoulder, You see that the tremendous form of Louise's big toe, the one form her other foot, is pressing down on the toes behind you. Even as you watch, it nudges closer and bends, its gleaming nail working its way underneath the toe you cling to, pushing you upwards along with your climbing surface!

"Ah, there he is!" laughs the cameraman.

"No problem!" Louise giggles. "Now hurry up, little dude - I can't stand like this all day!"

Shuddering, you turn from the behemoth behind you to focus on the relatively tiny toe you cling to. Its such a short distance to get atop it, and you pause to raise your arms in triumph. With a laugh, Louise retracts her big toe, and the surface you stand on drops precipitously. As you lurch, your arms grab out for support, clinging tight to the first thing they find.

When things finally subside and you open your eyes, you see that you have grabbed onto a dark, curled hair that sprouts from the toe - something normally invisible on such a beautiful woman! There a only a few of them, that you duck under as you start on your trek toward the ankle. Her skin is firm beneath you, save when you pass by the under-surface veins. There, the constant surging blood makes it shift ever so slightly - and you make it your business to step around.

Ahead, Louise's ankle stretches upwards, past shin to a knee impossibly high... Doubt increases with every step closer you take. It took so much effort just to mantle one of her toes! Her leg itself is a sheer column, smooth and hairless as you discovered last night, lacking the climbing ridges her toeprint sported. With no plateaus to rest on, your arms will be constantly supporting your weight. Surely they can't seriously be expecting you to scramble all the way up there? They must have been joking!

Well, they've had their laugh, got their test footage - perhaps now is the time to turn and face the gods commanding your fate and tell them you're going no further today? But if they're not joking, things could get bad!

Maybe you should climb up as far as you can - maybe they're waiting for you to tire and fall before they cut off this trial, and are ready to step in and save you. If they're not, of course, that holds its own dangers...
1322122111211122111221212121221111121.title: Give the Audience What It Wants

choices: You remain with Louise, a spectator of her part in the giantess movie
You endeavour to escape from your perch, and get away from these people
13221221112111221112212121212211111211.content:
Nope, that's it, you're out, there's no way you can climb any further. You don't care that a giant camera is fixated on you right now, your body is done.

Collapsing back onto the soft skin of Louise's foot, you hear a disgruntled groan from the film-maker behind you, but a light giggle from the heights of the goddess you stand upon.

"Looks like the show's over for now, boys," Louise says, and from your position you can see her knees bending, as she brings herself lower. The towering mass of her shins block the rest of her from view, but her hand makes a move on you from the right.

With one finger extended, you see how this will end. For your lack of dedication, she is going to rub you from existence with but the tip of her finger, a feat well within her mighty capabilities. To run from your fate would be futile, as there's no way you can outdistance a creature as vast as this giantess.

The digit flies closer, and as you stare your death in the face you detect a familiar scent. Is that... Louise's saliva? Then the hulking mass presses against you, not from above but head-on, and as soon as the liquid of the woman's spit touches you you adhere to it, stuck fast and helpless.

She brings her hand back up again, at a speed that would fling you away, were your pathetic body not so easily held captive by her spit. She slows near the end, and the indomitable, sexy mountain of her face comes into focus, a smile slowly carving its way upward as her lips part. Of course, crushing you would have been too simple, she's clearly going to finish what she started and devour you, a speck swallowed down into her gut's abyss...

"You did good, boy," she whispers, "but you should rest for now. Mama has work to do."

She's... sparing you? The finger lifts you up, past a wink from her eye, and zooms closer to a mass of dark, tangled cables. One buffets you as it comes in close, and you reach out with your arms to fend it off, taking hold and clinging to it as the throbbing heat and weight of Louise's finger is finally released from you, leaving you held a countless distance from the ground by this tight network of hairs.

Climbing about to orient yourself, you can see the film crew ahead of you, shrugging at the giantess' actions, and if you dare to peer down, past her nose, her torso, down her legs to her feet, you can see the toy city spread out before her. Here, sitting on her eyebrow, you'll get a god's eye view of the devastation.

"We can get back to the new guy later, okay?" Louise placates the creatives, her voice vibrating the very surfaces around you, but prevented from being deafening. "Let's just finish what we came to do today. I have a life outside being a space goddess, y'know?"

They grumble, but they return to their positions, checking lighting and cameras as Louise brings her hands up past you, brushing her hair back and readying for her close-up.
13221221112111221112212121212211111211.title: Finger-Licking God

choices: The director shrinks before Louise's gaze, surprising everyone
Nah, nothing happens
Louise begins to grow to a real-life giantess
132212211121112211122121212122111112111.content:
Yeah, no need to risk climbing down from here, down an immense woman currently absorbed in destroying a city! You cling tight to Louise's eyebrow hairs and get ready for the show.

Immediately the world shakes as she lowers her brow in anger, and then you're looking downward as she casts her giantess' eyes over the fragile world below. Words spill from her mouth, promises of revenge and destruction, and then it begins.

For such a vast creature she moves with inhuman speed, those feet at the end of those lengthy legs smashing through the walls of buildings, kicking aside cars with each step. Then the streets get closer as the woman crouches, her hand reaching for one of the gigantic miniature figures. She brings it close to her face, just below you and ahead of her mouth: there she goes over more elaborate and intimate threats, ones that strike all too close to your tiny heart.

"CUT!" yells the director. "We'll get the clean model for the mouth work, okay?"

"Sure," sighs Louise, rising to stand and again putting you into the sky.

"In the meantime, how about you hand over that tiny guy, huh? We should put him somewhere safe."

"He's safe enough."

"Guy's worth a fortune, girl. Just hand him over."

"I already told you that he's staying with me. I'm never getting him back if you get him. Now stop treating me like a kid and respect what I'm saying. You're lucky I don't have the abilities of this character I'm playing. I'd shrink you so fast, your head would spin."

From the flicker of fear that passes across the immense face of the director, you can see that, for just a brief moment, he contemplates the possible reality of the fantasy he's peddling, a fantasy that has already become a nightmare for you.

It passes as he smirks again, muttering "stupid bitch," but you begin to wonder yourself. Barring your initial incident in the exam, both times you've shrunk further have been in the presence of Louise. Sure, a tiny man in a black suit did it, but is she somehow a factor..?
132212211121112211122121212122111112111.title: Best Seat in the House

choices: She extends her hand for you to climb onto
She leans down to your level
1322122111211122111221212121221111121112.content:
...Seconds pass. No supernatural shifts take place, but your huge hostess stands her ground. The director's smirk fades into a dissatisfied scowl.
"If you kill that guy, or keep him for yourself, you're through." The words come through almost gritted teeth.
"I know," Louise responds.
"Don't misuse him, Lou. He's not a toy," the director spits.
"He's not a prop, either." With that, the titanic model swivels around and marches off.
The winds lashing against your saliva-soaked form are enough to freeze you numb, and the endless bobbing gives you vertigo. You close your eyes just to lessen the sensory barrage. As suddenly as it started, the movement stops. Two massive shapes - fingers, you realize - feel you out and tear you from the liquid that so impenatrably ensnared you.
You open your eyes to find a vast expanse of mirror, stretching 50 feet high. This must be the change room, you decide. In the mirror, Louise is staring herself in the face, her still and blank expression betraying a state of deep reflection.
As you pick yourself off the counter, the model turns to look straight at you.
"Did you hear what that creep said?" You open your mouth, but- "He was worried I'd use you as a toy. Like that was any problem for him before. Sometimes I wish I could shrink him to your size, and squish him. With my knee, or my chin, or something that won't give him a hard-on."
You try to banish the thought of Louise's gorgeous knee, as she continues.
"You know, I'm here to study broadcasting. Do you know how many broadcasting jobs there are? Like, five in the whole state.
"But my parents tell me to just stay positive, and it'll all work out. So I do what I have to. Get a job at the bar, share a room, send a few photos to friends, smile cutely at the customers, accept a few photo requests, convince some guy to pay for my dinner I can't afford, take my first fetish video, wake up in somebody else's bed.
"Then one day you wake up and realize nobody can see you."
"You're not a person anymore. You're a thing. You're disgusting, fascinating, alluring. But you're not you."
As shock and sorrow fills your eyes, hers well up in tears. "Don't ever let yourself feel that, little guy. 'Cause it hurts like a bitch."
1322122111211122111221212121221111121112.title: Unpleasantly Unsurprised

choices: Stand quietly and wait for her to finish
Approach closer to offer comfort through human touch
Hide yourself on her to get free transport without her notice
Run away to get by on your own
Try to write a message on the ground
1322122111211122111221212121221111121112.content:
Louise squats. Simple, everyday movement. To you, under a millimetre tall, a being more massive than any human construction descends rapidly, and the mere breeze kicked up by her muscled mass pushes you onto your back. There, you can gaze up at her eyes, pupils depthless black masses as they focus on you right before them. They blink, even that smoothness slamming loudly in your ears. Tears are thrown loose, and great globdules detonate before you with impacts powerful enough to crush you.

She whispers even more quietly now, clearly aware that her voice could annihilate you if not properly moderated. "Listen to me. Feeling sorry for myself when you're like that. Hashtag first world problems, huh?"

A sniff of her nose rattles you as you stand up, and Louise sits back a little to wipe at her eyes with the heel of a palm, apocalyptic pressure used to sweep aside a little liquid.

"Shit; my make-up's ruined, just in time for the close-up. That asshole is gonna be furious."

A moment passes, then she smiles brightly, skin pulled up across her face wider than you can behold on the horizon. "Fuck him though, yeah? There are other ways I can make money. Something less humiliating than this. What if my parents saw me doing this? What - what would they say?"

Her smile falls, and the storm of tears intensifies. As a shadow falls over you, you back-pedal quickly, and are thrown clear as Louise's forearms crash down, cushioning her head as she sobs softly, only slightly rocking the entire world as you know it.

What should you do here? Go comfort her, take advantage of this chance to get away? What?
1322122111211122111221212121221111121112.title: A Common Feeling

choices: As if reading your mind, a door opens
Don't be silly; you continue unmolested
Someone comes running down the hall
1322122111211122111222.content:
It seems like hours you've been trudging along - passing in pitch darkness past solidly closed fire doors that deny you access - by the time the hint of light and noise becomes apparant some distance ahead.

You would break into a run towards this nirvana if you weren't so tired, so instead you carry on loping, the noise eventually resolving itself into loudly playing rock music. Sounds like someone brought the party home with them.

But since this is a student dorm, there's every chance that someone a door or two down is trying to study, and may take exception to the racket. Will anyone protest before you get into the light?
1322122111211122111222.title: The Fun Never Sleeps

choices: Stay and watch the giant-sized fun
Get into a room while you have the chance
13221221112111221112221.content:
Just then, one of the doorways of the gods (as you've come to think of them) opens just to your right, swinging with enough of a breeze to pitch you off your feet.

As you are getting up, a flipflop-clad foot topples from the sky to land in front of you, shaking the floorboards with such violence as to knock you down again. Its noise is as nothing compared to the angry shout of the woman to whom it belongs however, raining down upon you like thunder.

"Could you guys keep it down in there? I have a big exam tomorrow and I need my sleep!"

A distant shudder alerts you to some of the party-goers putting their act together about coming out to talk with the woman. Do you want to stay and listen to the argument between these giants, or would you rather run in through the open door of tomorrow's exam-goer while you have the chance? After all, since she's so conscientious, she should be a good person to approach for help.
13221221112111221112221.title: Oh Yeah, the Exams...

choices: The drunk giant spills beer on the killjoy
The drunk giantess drags the killjoy to the party
The killjoy picks a fight
132212211121112211122211.content:
This should be good. Observing a god-scale argument will be an experience to tell the grand-kids about, that's for sure. Much better than your own grandfather's dated tales of WWII.

Approaching party-goers are already shouting out reproaches for the studier to 'get a life', and this - combined with the cacophony of their music and footsteps - means that you have a hard time making out any details.

The tremendous feet belong to a man and a woman - one of each, both come to talk with the killjoy - and both pairs sway unsteadily as their inebriated controller attempts to maintain their equilibrium. The sober giantess stands steady as a rock, and it is close to her heel that you stay, in order to avoid being crushed by the unpredictable movements of the other two.

Actually, this isn't turning out to be as exciting as you'd thought. It's noisy, sure, but that's hardly a unique draw in this giant world. Maybe you should move on and leave them to it. As you come to this decision, however -
132212211121112211122211.title: Killjoy Rebuffed

choices: The drunk almost squashes you
The killjoy almost squashes you
1322122111211122111222111.content:
Maybe it’s intentional, perhaps it’s just an unfortunate accident caused by over-inebriation. Either way, as the drunken giant sways in close to offer the same argument for the fifth consecutive time, the can of cheap beer in his hand comes loose. Liquid splashes over the giantess above you, and the metal itself comes thundering down at your position.

Even before it hits, the woman is stepping backwards, her heel clipping you on its way past and throwing you clear of almost certain death. Still, even as you land a good couple of feet away from the beer can, you are readily aware of the bruising you’ve sustained from minor contact with the giantess.

Her own foot comes smashing down ahead of you, but you’re too hurt to feel fear or even contemplate running. You stopped here to watch an argument, and now it’s getting good.

“Jerk!” she shouts, shoving at the giant. His balance already shot, he joins you in lying on the ground, although his impact rocks the world around you.

The party-going woman steps up to defend him (boyfriend/girlfriend, perhaps?), and you brace yourself for the catfight of the gods.
1322122111211122111222111.title: Epic Throwdown

choices: Bed - sleep
Desk - study
Fridge - food
132212211121112211122212.content:
You run past the feet of the giantess into her welcoming room, noting at once how different it is from Laura and Louise's. For one thing, it's a single room. For another, it's scrupulously tidy.

If she's going to be having an exam tomorrow, then clearly the best place to be would be with her papers and pencils, so that you could accompany her there. Thus resolved, you set out on your long journey to the bag neatly set against one wall to your right.

Your journey is so long in fact that the woman enters again - door slammed shut behind her - long before you arrive. She strides across to her destination, completely ignorant to your presence.

But where is she headed?
132212211121112211122212.title: Back So Soon?

choices: Beer...
Voyeurism
13221221112111221112222.content:
Closer and closer you get, the noise increasing exponentially with every tiny step. Eventually you emerge into the glowing aura that blasts forth from within the dorm room, and its truly like you have stepped before the gates of Heaven.

You shield your eyes for a moment and blink as you become accustomed to light again, and then you marvel at the spectacle that opens up before you.

Several gaints and giantesses laze about on the floor, while a couple gyrate to the music in the centre of their crude ring. You move closer, hiding behind a discarded beer bottle, and observe the mountains for a while, unable to make out the details of their conversations.

Do you want to get more intimitely involved with the party-goers, or would you prefer to watch from a distance, waiting until they sober up before making contact?
13221221112111221112222.title: Olympian Fun For All

choices: Try to get their attention in the morning
Plan to write out a message
1322122111211122112.content:
You drive your feet repeatedly into the unyielding fabric of the bed beneath you as you dash away from Louise's towering form. You imagine that you're speeding away from her very fast, but her point of view,looking down at a pathetic half-inch bug crawling away from her, you're still well within reach.

Her arm brushes into you, impacting with unparalleled force to throw you off her bed and into empty space. You hit the ground almost as quickly,no time wasted in a slow-motion descent. Dazed, you can only struggle to raise yourself from the floor, and fail at every opportunity. If Louise were to take advantage of this moment to crush you, there'd be nothing you could do to defend yourself.

Presumably - as you continue to live, un-flattened by object or body part - Louise has taken your cessation of movement to mean that you're already dead. You are left to see out the night in pain and darkness.

At least you have time to think. Come morning, will you approach these women again, or wait until you're truly alone to try and create some form of message for them to read?
1322122111211122112.title: Run away!

choices: ...Laura about to sit on you
...Louise about to stand up, springing you off the bed
...the eyes of the two falling upon you
132212211121112212.content:
You see an arm laid on Louise's shoulder. Your head still craned waaay back, you follow it across to see that Laura is comforting her room mate. She's dressed in shorts and a men's t-shirt, but still looks damn fine. Unspoken, your lesbian fantasies about the pair rear in your head again.

You can't make out what they're saying to each other, but you play out an idealised version in your head. 'Listening' to them talk dirty to each other distracts you, meaning that you don't notice...
132212211121112212.title: The Two of Them, Together...  You Wish.

choices: Run off and hide, to buy time to think
Plan B, Laura
No no, stick with Louise
1322122111211122122.content:
Louise stands up. The sudden loss of her immense weight on the bed's surface rumbles across to where you are standing, and is enough to catapult you up into the air.

Your half-inch tall form seems to take forever to sail through the air, and in this world of slow motion you watch the two giantesses. Louise places her head on Laura's shoulder while the latter hugs her, stroking her hair in a comforting manner. Her gentle shushes are - to your ears - drowned out by the tempestuous sobbing of Louise. She took the loss of an eyelash rather harshly, you think to yourself, unless there's some other explanation. Perhaps the night's heavy drinking was done for some reason, and Laura is consoling her room-mate over some heartbreak or other.

The skyscraping forms of the two women begin to dwindle as your ultimate destination of the floor rushes to meet you faster. Soon it is just their perfect legs that you can see, forming a wall that you rebound off briefly on your descent.

You land, and immediately begin worrying. The fall wasn't hard enough to hurt you much - and your brief scrape with Laura's shin slowed you a little - but now you are down on the floor again, the feet of those women may be a worry. Louise is barely applying her weight to hers, since she's leaning on Laura so heavily, but still the imposing appendages move slightly from moment to moment, stomping down scarily close to your position. Laura's are more steady, keeping her in place, but you can sense the pent-up power within them as you look, and have no desire to get underneath them.

Looks like your plan to contact one of these women tonight is a bust; they're too caught up in their own issues to worry about yours. Or to even notice you. Perhaps you should run away now, find somewhere to hide and rest, and try again in the morning?

Alternatively, you could put your failure down solely to the fact that you chose Louise to contact. You were a fool! Laura is the more sensible one, and it is to she that you should go now. Since her feet are standing so still right now, you could try your strategy all over again with her.
1322122111211122122.title: The Floor Again.  Great.

choices: Your hunger cannot wait
More sleep
13221221112111221221.content:
You leave the giantesses to their business and rush underneath Louise's bed, hoping to have time to think and plot anew. The solid construction does at least muffle their voices, so that their asinine conversation dosn't disturb you. Looking over your shoulder, the only sign that they're there at all is the two pairs of humungous feet that stand steadfast like sentinels.

What to do, what to do? Clearly making contact with the larger outside world will be a lot more difficult than you had originally imagined, but now you're practically back to square one. Well, half of square one since that bastard shrank you again.

Well, almost. At least you should be able to get something to eat here, if either of the women leaves some crumbs from her meals on the floor. You can't be thinking on an empty stomach.

But should you venture outside to get a snack now, while they're active, or get a nap now and go to get food when the danger of stompy death isn't so great?
13221221112111221221.title: Rest and Play

choices: Laura walks to the desk to do some late-night revision for her last exam
Louise walks to the mirror to see what difference the missing eyelash makes
132212211121112212211.content:
While Louise is busy being consoled by Laura, the two of them should be stationary for quite some time: more than long enough for you to carry out a reccee of the area and find some crumbs of food.

You take the long path out from under the bed, avoiding the feet entirely. Here there is just a great quantity of dust, none of which looks especially appetising. Once back out in the open, you keep your head down, afraid of looking up toward the distant ceiling and acknowledging just how tiny you are.

You pick around for a while, wandering around several pairs of discarded footwear and several other pieces of clothing, underwear included. You resist your baser instincts, keeping away from the building-sized bras and panties, other than to subject them to a cursory examination that confirms the lack of any crumbs near them.

You come at last to the shadow of one of the girls' desks, and your luck takes an upturn. They must eat while sitting here much of the time, and so the carpet around it is scattered with great lumps of unidentifiable foodstuff, some of which isn't entirely stale. You did in hungrily, completely forgetting about the two giantesses in the room with you.

Then a rumbling of the floor, and a cascade of monstrous footfalls reminds you of their presence.
132212211121112212211.title: Slim Pickings

choices: You're not a quitter!  Get back in there!
You're beaten up enough!  Flee from the giantess!
1322122111211122122112.content:
No matter how absorbed you are in your meal, and filling your empty stomach, there's no way you could miss the tremors and noise that herald one of the giantesses approaching your position.

Turning, you see that it's nightdress-wearing Louise. She stops a considerable distance away (to you, at least) and proceeds to stand still there for long enough to wonder if you should make another attempt at contact...

No, it would be madness, especially after last time! You should keep well away, perhaps even going further into hiding.

Although...
1322122111211122122112.title: You Have No Idea

choices: ...Laura using a dustbuster
...Louise stepping out of bed
...a raging argument between the two women
132212211121112212212.content:
Even though you did have that nap aboard Louise's foot, there's good reason to get more sleep now; if you can match the women's sleeping patterns, you can contact them when both you and they are in an awake state of mind.

It takes a while when the shuddering steps of the women moving back to their beds - not to mention the worrying creaking of the ceiling as Louise applies her weight to the mattress - keep disturbing you, but once the three people in the room have all settled down, you manage to drift off, content at last.

You are woken by:
132212211121112212212.title: Try Counting Sheep

choices: Run towards and past it
Hope to outrun it, or at least get out of Laura's reach under the bed
1322122111211122122121.content:
The rustling, roaring noise that drags you from your nightmares is like nothing else you've heard before, at any scale of your life.

Looking blearily in the direction it originates from, you see the wide open mouth of a dustbuster, clenched tightly in Laura's massive hand, being played back and forth across the carpet. And getting nearer to the bed under which you hide.

You could run, but you wouldn't get very far, you're sure; those giantesses can cover much more ground than little old you. Perhaps you should charge towards it, and hope to get past before it gets turned in your direction?
1322122111211122122121.title: Busted

choices: Pace upon the foot - the exercise will keep you in readiness
Slap yourself - the pain will wake your mind
13221221112111221222.content:
Yeah, Laura! She won't be one to freak out at the loss of an eyelash! She'd immediately realise what was going on and make contact with you, and together you'd find a solution to your problem in no time!

Of course, to get to one of those beautiful eyelashes you're going to have to scale that foot...

Looking across at it, you can't help but be terrified by its scale and power. You edge closer, determined to use this moment of unusual stillness to catch a lift. No toe-clinging this time, though; you're going straight for the ankle.

You set your hands on the rough skin on the side of the foot, readying to pull yourself up after you get your own feet in there. The flesh beneath is warm to the touch, and the musky odour is almost erotic...

Still, you've got to concentrate! You heave yourself aboard the dizzying heights of the foot, feeling the blood rushing through the veins beneath you with all the force of a pneumatic drill. Leaning back against the ankle, you breathe a sigh of relief. Now just to wait for Laura to leave the crybaby alone and return to her bed...

While here, you take the time to look across at Louise's feet as they stand opposite. Wasn't that long ago that you were on them, enjoying the warmth and comfort of those toes, falling asleep among them...

No! You're not going to let that happen again! If you sleep, you could fall off and be crushed like a bug! No, you've got to remain awake, no matter what!

But it seems like those two could be talking for a while, so how best to stave off snoozing?
13221221112111221222.title: Concentration

132212211121112212221.content:
Yes, if you keep yourself exerted, then your brain won't have time to get tired and shut you down in sleep! You promptly begin marching back and forward across Laura's foot, little aware of the irritation you are causing the giantess in the process.

Her other foot moves across to hover above you, before dropping down to scratch at the irritation with toe-nails. Her biggest toe falls directly atop you, keeping you from falling asleep forever as it vigorously moves back and forth, simultaneously managing to smear your corpse across the top of Laura's foot and put a stop to the itch that was most distressing her.

Perhaps your gooey remains will give her small cause for concern, but it's nothing a shower can't solve.
132212211121112212221.title: Between Two Feet

choices: Get to your feet and wave
Run to her in relief
Panic and flee
132212211121112212222.content:
You spend a few seconds psyching yourself up; it feels odd to be threatening violence to your own face.

The first slap shakes you, but then this proceeds to the rest of your body as the foot you are standing on takes to the air, at precisely the worst time imaginable. Completely unprepared and off balance, you fall from Laura and roll towards Louise as the former moves back towards her own bed.

Louise makes a small gasp. Lying on your back, you look up to see what has disturbed her. Having been so upset, her gaze has been downset, and so it shouldn't be any surprise to know that she has spotted you; even now her massive eyes - still huge at such a removed distance - are widening as they alight on your tiny form, and you wonder what form of action you should take now that a giantess is finally aware of you.
132212211121112212222.title: Awareness

choices: Louise pushes Laura away from you
Laura kicks you into a waste bin
Louise and Laura kneel down to look at you
1322122111211122122221.content:
The giantess steps swiftly away, rumbling the floorboards, and shrieking far above you: "Eek! A bug!"

You can hear Laura pausing in her regular tread to turn and venture back in your direction. Is this how it is then, betrayed even as you reach out to touch someone you thought a possible ally?

Then Louise's distant visage, to which you are still waving, changes its expression from disgust to confusion. "Wait - I think that he's waving at me..."

Yes! Now if only Laura cottons on to this before she steps on you. Speaking of which...

You turn to see how near she is, just to behold the scant light of the bedroom being snuffed out by her hovering foot. Looks like this is it...
1322122111211122122221.title: So Near.  So Far.

1322122111211122122222.content:
You begin running for the immense foot of Louise, but in the time it takes you to get up a good head of speed it's already been withdrawn, moving back an incalculable distance with a single, crushing step. The floor vibrates, and the heavens are pierced by a cacophonous screech.

"Laura! There's a bug on the floor!"

You briefly consider piping up to refute that statement, but instead continue your all-out sprint, even though you know that there will be no sanctuary at its end; you just don't know what else to do.

Louise jumps away this time, both feet holding in the air for an impossible time before she slams down again, nearly deafening you and certainly halting your progress with the ensuing earthquake.

Then she's joined by the approaching footsteps of Laura, somewhere out of your field of vision. "Honestly, if it disturbs you that much Louise, just step on it."

"Ew, I don't think so!"

This is bad. You've got to get out of here before -

No more thoughts. Only the impact of the ball of Laura's foot, pressing down upon you with irresistable force and smooshing you to paste. You don't know it, but she proceeds to grind backwards and forwards for moments after your death, enjoying the feeling of your pulped self beneath her.

Then she finally walks off to wash herself clean, leaving Louise to calm herself down.
1322122111211122122222.title: Clever Girl..

choices: Bellow to get her awake
Quietly goad her into consciousness
Crawl deep inside her ear
13221221112111222.content:
In the folds of her hair, you begin scaling. The thick strands are thicker than your fingers, so there's not that much risk of them breaking under your weight. What little weight you have.

It's quite a rush, being at this height, looking down the trails of hair to the rest of her body, covered by the sheets. You just hope that she isn't restless. If she should so much as roll over, you would be killed for certain.

You approach her ear, and begin the laborious task of clearing aside the hairs that lie on top of it. Considering their length, you're lucky to get it done as quickly as you do.

Once it's exposed to the faint light, you take some time to regard it. It protrudes a distance near enough to your own height from the head, and the bowl-like depression over its walls is deeper than you can see. You stand on one of the many curving shelves within it and run your hands over another. Amazing. You'd never so much as glanced at a woman's ears before, but now...

Anyway. Now that you're ready to try and talk to this sleeping woman, how will you go about it? You could shout at the top of your lungs to jolt her awake, but that could result in her waking with a start and sending you flying across the room. Or you could whisper things to her subtly, hoping to influence her sleeping mind subliminaly. Course, with that method there's always the chance that she'll wake up and think it was all a dream.

Still, you're a resourceful chap; you'll think of something...
13221221112111222.title: Bedtime Story

choices: Oh, you mean - Yes, detour to her underwear...  :)
Oh!  Don't be disgusting!  Press onwards to her face!
13221221112112.content:
Rumbling footsteps indicate that both women have now come out of their respective bathrooms (one each! In your day you had to put up with - but no, you're not going to get distracted now. And you're certainly not going to start talking like your father...), and at your size you can feel every tremor in the floor.

Laura is wearing a large t-shirt and pair of shorts, but form your angle you can't see what decoration is on them. It hurts your neck to look up any further than her titanic knees. You do, however, notice that her toenails have been painted red. Just like her, you smile to yourself, to do that when she was wearing trainers and no one could see them anyway.

Then you are running, in a hurry to get to her before she climbs the hundred and fifty odd feet into her bed.

With a leap you manage to clamber aboard the little toe of her left foot, and hold on across the one next to it. she wriggles her toes in response, probably a reflex action, and you find ypour grip tested. Thankfully, you weather the storm, just in time for the next one, when her foot is lifted onto the bed.

The leg swings over onto the bed, and you are thrown loose. You land on soft white surface without injury, but then the rest of Laura's body comes crashing down upon the bed.

You are buffeted around, and lucky not to be totally flattened under her bulk. Then everything goes dark. Looking up, you see that Laura has pulled her quilt over herself, nothing out of the ordinary, nothing to worry about.

You seem to have ended up pretty much where you began, next to her foot. Judging from its position, bearing in mind that it's dark, you judge that she is lying on her side. As you could never hope to lift the incredible weight of the sheet, you are forced to stick close to where she lies in order to keep under the tent-like space that spreads about an inch (her scale) from her.

You walk up her, rubbing one hand along her leg as you go. Its warmth and smoothness is a pleasure, and you start to think of one of the advantages to being this scale...
13221221112112.title: Elevated by Laura

choices: Her hand moves to pick you up
She sleepily starts a conversation, half-thinking she's dreaming
Laura blows you away with a puff of breath
132212211121122.content:
Avoiding the whole moral problem posed by your situation, you keep outside of her clothes for now. You progress, hemmed in on all sides by rough cloth, to light at the end of the cavern.

When you get 'outside', you see that it is a desktop lamp, shining light so that Laura may read her billboard-sized book. Her face is totally absorbed in it, and while you are thinking of what you could say to her, you examine it in a level of detail you never have before.

Her mouth is pursed in the manner when she is thinking hard, or at least that is what you had always assumed. You are distracted for a moment by a sudden thought of how you would like to snuggle up against her lips for the night.

Her nose always looked a little pointy, but from this perspective you can see nothing wrong with it. It is perfection. Even the gentle breezes issuing forth from the tunnels of her nostrils is nice.

Then the eyes, above the plain of her cheeks. The irises are as wide as you are tall, and you could easily imagine yourself lost in them. Only when you notice yourself reflected in them do you realise that she is looking directly at you - she has seen you!

Okay, you've got her attention. The ball's in her court now...
132212211121122.title: What Will Laura Do With You?

choices: Tell her the whole truth
Tell her how beautiful she looks - this is your only chance
Tell her to wake Louise
1322122111211222.content:
Laura, propped up on her elbows as she looks down at you, smiles her lips-no-teeth smile at you before closing her book, the breeze knocking you to the ground (ie the bed).

"What are you?" she asks, her unbelievably loud voice carrying even more force.

When you get back up, you shout your reply as loud as you can manage, but she just can't hear your puny voice.

She smiles again, her mighty eyes glittering down at you. "Don't worry," she whispers, keeping the volume of her voice down after seeing the effect that talking normally had upon you, "I'm just going to pick you up."

Her right forearm descends, the car-sized digits of the hand coming to rest either side of you. As the thumb and forefinger close on you, their whorled surfaces getting even clearer, you take a deep breath. Laura is clearly trying to be gentle, but the pressure is still immense, the walls of flesh, blood and bone effortlessly lifting you to her ear. You look doubtfully into the dark cavern, hoping that from here she will be able to hear you, and that you won't have to climb in there.

But what will you say?
1322122111211222.title: A Chance to Explain

choices: You decide to move on out on your own
You approach the giantess mother and daughter
1322122111212.content:
You can't take this. Not now. You'd barely gotten over the whole inch-tall experience, and the adjusting to being half that size is overwhelming at the moment.

When next the foot crunches to the ground, you take your opportunity to roll away and free, thudding to the pavement and allowing the bar-maid and her friend to pass on their way with all the haste their impossibly long legs allow.

It's night, you hurt and almost everything in this world is a danger. At the moment though, the most pressing concern is the need to rest and sleep. In the morning, perhaps all of this will seem better. It couldn't really get any worse.

There are probably better - safer, certainly - shelters out there, but given that you don't want to waste a whole bunch of time looking for them, you settle for the first discarded cola can that you can find. Slurping up a little of the sugary liquid clinging to the rim for sustenance, you crawl into the darkened interior for some shut-eye.

Just have to hope nobody kicks this can idly, and that you wake up before street cleaners carry it away, and...

Unsurprisingly, your dreams that night are filled with terror.

***

The morning finds you sticky and scared, but refreshed at least. The cacophony disturbing you can only be the regular folk of the world outside going about their business, and since daylight is trickling through the ringpull opening you decide to venture outside.

The louder, constant drone is what really piques your interest, and when you finally emerge, blinking, you get an explanation; the rushing blurs ahead of you appear to be the source.

Cars.

You'd just gotten over the size of PEOPLE in this crazy giant world, but compared to cars they're nothing. You find it hard to comprehend how something so vast could move so fast, smashing past and leaving sound and fury in their wake.

So mesmerised are you by this spectacle that you fail to notice the approach of two people. You only spot them when they are practically upon you, the nearest foot crunching only a couple of your feet away from you. The impact gets your attention.

The bar-maid was the only person you'd really been acquainted with at your newer, smaller size, and so you are awed all over again by the five-toed structure that looms over you.

It (and its paired colleague) is wearing a sandal the height of you, which isn't surprising given the hot summer's day. The titanic toes wriggle a little, each movement enough to crush you several times over. You follow the shapely, tanned leg upwards with your eyes, where it becomes covered by a red dress. A 'short' red dress. Any more than that you cannot see.

Smiling despite yourself, you turn the other pair of feet. They too wear sandals, but the white dress is much longer, ankle length by your judgement. That's not what bothers you though. It takes you several seconds before you realise what's different.

These feet are even bigger. Half again the size of the original feet, you struggle to come up with new words that mean big.

This is a woman, and the smaller feet belong to a girl (her daughter?). To think that you had thought of her legs as shapely...

Never mind. No one need ever think that you had such thoughts. The thoughts you should be having now are whether or not you should approach these people. Sure, the ride on the bar-maid's foot was sickening, but you're feeling a lot more content in your tiny physique now. And it is true that you will need to contact someone if you're to have any hope of getting back to normal.

But they're so big and scary! Perhaps you'd be forgiven seeking a LITTLE more time to cower?
1322122111212.title: Cola Can to Confusion

choices: You are presented proudly to the mother
You are pocketed for taking to school
You are thrown across the street
13221221112121.content:
Yeah, at present that little girl is the same size to you as regular grown-ups were the first time you shrank. That's going to take a bit of getting used to. Time to move on you think, putting the giantesses to your back.

There's another impact behind you, though you're experienced enough by now to know that it's something a lot smaller than even the girl's foot. You turn slowly.

It is light brown in colour, in form a cone that starts out as thick as your leg but soon widens until it is some four times your height. When you see white liquid leaking out from the large end, you recognise the alien object. An ice-cream cone.

The last you ate was that rancid cola, so right now you're not picky. You rush over to the food, breaking several small chunks off with your hands. It tastes as you know cones taste, but at your size the consistency is harder - you really have to work your teeth to get it down your throat. But it's worth it; it feels good in your stomach.

Then a shadow falls over you and you freeze, your mouth locking mid chew. Looking over your shoulder, you can see the smaller pair of feet turned to face you, and the legs to which they are attached bending, as an arm reaches over you to pick up the ice cream. The girl wants it back.

"No! Leave it where it is, it's covered in germs!" shouts her mother, audible even over the tirade of the traffic.

The hand halts, and retracts from the spoiled food. But the damage has been done. You have no time to react before a thumb and a finger grasp you roughly and tear you from your place, hoisting you with dreadful power into the air. You almost choke, and that's without the rush of movement and the pressure exerted on your fragile form by the digits.

Looking up into the face of the girl, you have no doubt now as to her youth. Her age in years surely can't be counted in double figures yet. Her smooth face breaks into her grin, and you prepare yourself for the end.
13221221112121.title: Creamed

choices: The woman doesn't like what she sees
The woman recognises a human form...
132212211121211.content:
Proud of her capture, the girl shakes you up and down in the air to get the attention of her mother. Thus far, you have to say that this is your worst experience of your new size. The rushing gusts, the rollercoaster-beating velocities, the awful pressure of the finger and thumb -

But what will Mommy say? She wasn't too keen on her daughter picking up a discarded ice cream cone, will she think that you too are riddled with germs? Or will she want a closer inspection herself? Once the shaking stops, your eyes finally focus on the face that is the sky. It's young, certainly no more than thirty, and framed by short dark hair. The eyes squint at you curiously, and then you notice an intake of breath as the unlipsticked lips prepare to form themselves around the words that could be either your salvation or your death.
132212211121211.title: Parental Approval?

1322122111212111.content: Your view of the woman's face is suddenly obscured by her hand, moving in a blur too fast for you to clearly see. The further rocking of the world around you is the last thing that you are aware of - things go too fast. The last thing to go through your mind - after the floor when you hit it - is the back of your skull as the woman grinds your fallen form beneath her heel.
1322122111212111.title: Disapproved Of

choices: She closes her hand around you
She puts you in her Handbag.
She talks to you
1322122111212112.content:
"GIVE IT TO ME." The mother instructs her daughter. The terrible rollercoaster is finally over as the two digits release you and you plummet right into the mother's waiting palm. Swiftly she lifts you up to her eye-level, her hazel eyes are practically all that you can see.

"CAN I KEEP HIM, MOMMY." The young girl's voice roars in the background. You freeze with uncertainty and fear as your tiny eyes lock on to the nearest of the mother's; before you know her fingers curl round and trap you inside a chamber of flesh and yet, somehow she does not press so hard as to cause harm to you.

"Now, now, darling." She thunders in response, you're grateful for her fist softening the undoubtedly explosive voice that she must have. "He may be tiny but he's still a person. You can help me take care of him as long as you promise not to do anything with him without asking first." There was a pause. "You don't want him to get squished, do you?"

"No, mum." Her daughter responds with clear understanding in her voice. You are grateful that this lady understands your predicament to some extent but she certainly isn't above making sure that you return to an ordinary man. The fist uncoils and once again blue sky comes from above and all you can see before you is the woman's enormous brown eyes.

"DON'T WORRY," She whispers though it's still a grand commanding sort of voice to you, "I'M GONNA LOOK AFTER YOU."
1322122111212112.title: Salvation

choices: ...in her home
...on the table of a local cafe
...on the desk of a local newspaper
13221221112121121.content:
"NOW, I WOULD PUT YOU IN MY POCKET," the woman confides, "ONLY THIS DRESS DOESN'T APPEAR TO HAVE ANY. I HOPE YOU DON'T MIND TOO MUCH IF I JUST HOLD YOU GENTLY FOR NOW..?"

The immense movement of her face - after a few moments of you swinging your head side to side to take in the panoramic view - appears to be a speculative grin, with eyebrows raised. She's actually waiting for your permission. This woman, this giantess, big enough to hold you in the palm of her hand and fully capable of killing you in any one of dozens of different ways with little to no effort, is waiting on your answer.

That's quite something.

You nod your head vigorously, since you're pretty sure she won't be able to hear your feeble voice. Still, you do speak anyway.

"Just don't squeeze."

Once more the fingers arch overhead to block out the sunlight, and you are confined within the firm grasp of this woman. The thrumming of her pulse is all that you can feel or hear around you, the warm softness of her skin a mild comfort in stark contrast.

As an experiment, you try pushing with all your might against the flesh. It gives but a little, like a solid steel surface wrapped in the flimsiest amount of cloth. Unyielding, powerful. Or rather, she's just normal, and you're utterly, utterly pathetic, no stronger than a bug.

So cushioned are you within that structure that you don't feel the motions of the woman walking, dropping her daughter off at school and proceeding on her way. Only when she opens her hand up again are you aware that she's moved at all, finding yourself...
13221221112121121.title: She WOULD Put You In Her Pocket, But...

choices: A Piece of Shortbread
A Scone
A towering sandwich
132212211121211212.content:
You find yourself set upon a giant checkered tablecloth, or to be more precise, on one of the squares. You look up at your humongous hostess and she looks down at you; her face looms high above you like a distant mountain. You're not sure if she can discern you upon the tabletop. Looking to your right you see a vast cylindrical cliff with great clouds of steam pouring out of it.

"I HOPE YOU'RE OKAY WITH COFFEE." The giantess comments as she leans a bit closer to you. Only a few seconds later she lifts an enormous spoon and plunges it into what is now clearly a mug of coffee. The sound of her stirring is like being at the base of a bell tower during a mass, the spoon clanging against the ceramic with what you would consider to be the force of a 60mm mortar.

Once the ringing subsided you watch your hostess remove the mighty metal teaspoon from the mug and profer it to you. A small puddle of coffee remains in the spoon. She tilts the dark liquid towards you and, inspite of feeling humiliated by being spoonfed, you put your lips on the end as best you can and gulp down as much coffee as you can manage.

Once your thirst is quenched the giantess then takes a sip from the massive mug, a sip being enough for you to bath in, and then a waitress approaches with a tea plate. Your small size makes you inconspicuous as she sets it down between you and your hostess. Once she departs your giant hostess gives you a sweet smile and, peering over the rim of the plate, you see that she ordered...
132212211121211212.title: Morning Coffee

choices: Conversation naturally turns to the cause of your predicament
Another cafe patron notices you
There's an explosion down the street
1322122111212112122.content:
You find that your gigantic hostess has ordered a buttered scone, looking at the two halves you figure that one whole scone would be the size of a house to you now.

"HERE." She booms, proferring her immense index finger to you. Understanding what she wished you to do you grab onto it with both hands and coil your legs round the digit just as she carefully and effortlessly lifts you into the air and, with astonishing precision, sets you down on the edge of one of the halves.

You are nervous as you step onto the bready plateau, concerned that any kind of accident could happen. But you look up at your hostess and her platonic loving smile reassures you of the safety that her might provides.

You start grabbing loose crumbs from the scone and nosh with gratitude while you witness her taking the other half in her hand and taking one bite that must be enough to keep you going for a month.

Once you're through you wave to her and she responds, lowering her finger again and waiting until you're aboard before putting you down back on the tablecloth before she finishes off your gigantic half of the scone.
1322122111212112122.title: Super-Sized Scone

choices: "Yes, he most certainly is!"
"Um... I'm not married."
"He would be, if he were still alive..."
13221221112121121221.content:
It didnt take your humongous friend very long to finish off that half of the scone. While it might've been impossible for you to finish the entire thing before it passes its expiration date, it was actually pretty small for someone like her. A couple of thorough biting, chewing, and swallowing and it was gone. At that very last bite, you couldnt help but stare at the little lump in her neck quickly go down as she swallowed. Kinda scary to know that youre even smaller than that little lump...

Nonetheless, after wiping her mouth with a napkin, the woman leaned her head down toward you, giving you her undivided attention. Probably not nearly as much as she has YOURS! That beautiful serene face of hers has aged rather gracefully for a woman her age. Although personally, you wouldnt say she'd be too old for you... either she's probably just a couple of years older than you, takes pretty good care of her body, or might LITTERALLY be a goddess... whatever the reason, you're REALLY starting to wish you were big again!

"SO HOW DID-"

"Wwwaah!" The moment she spoke, a strong gust of wind blew out of that abyss of a mouth and knocked you over! Your reaction caused her to flinch! Apparently, she doesnt know her own strength!

'Sorry!' she mouthed her apology and whispered, "I mean... how did you get so small?"

The million dollar (or maybe like 20 Euro!) question that you still dont have an answer to! ANYTHING could've happened! Is it some sort of rare disease going around? Were you drugged? Did those mystery men do this to you? Or maybe it's sort of magical sorcery caused by someone who's toying with you and at this very moment is hunting you like an animal?

"I... I honestly dont know," you reply, "it just suddenly happened while I was in the middle of... work." You lied, trying to pretend you're much older than you really are!

"That's awful," the sympathetic frown on her face warmed your heart, "it must've been terrifying traveling so far when you're barely even the size of a bug. How long were you like this?"

"A whole day so far," you regretfully answered. One day of this and you pretty much conclude you wont be growing back anytime soon. Speaking of which, she looks just as distressed as you are. The way she constantly taps her fingers against the table in that rhythmic pattern emphasized uneasiness.

You're not sure why, but you notice a little silver ring on her index finger. Now you can't help but ask yourself... is that some kind of family ring or a wedding ring?

"I....I....." she seems to stutter a little, "I'm... sorry if my daughter scared you earlier. She's still pretty young so..."

"No no no! It's alright! I'm fine!" you interrupt her, assuring her youre A-OK, "she was actually very gentle to me while she was holding me." However, knowing that this kind-hearted and caring woman in front of you is a mother, you can't help but wonder if she's married, too. Maybe it's the ring and the fact that you've grown VERY accustomed to your motherly goddess. So many possibilities could open up if she isn't married... although some might be a little difficult in your size, but you can worry about THAT later!

But you can't just flat out ask 'Are you married?'. Instead, you get a little creative.

"Your daughter seems pretty kind and caring to those smaller than her," you comment, "I bet your husband must be proud to have such a kind-hearted little girl!" And you await her response...
13221221112121121221.title: Your tiny foot in the ginormous door

choices: A waitress comes over to clear up
The little man reappears - HE is Gerald!
Someone knocks the table over
132212211121211212211.content:
"We're both very proud of little Sophie," she adds. "If only Gerald's work didn't take him away from us for so long at a time..."

The woman looks wistfully into the middle distance, and you wonder again how far you should take this matter. This Gerald,whoever he is, is big enough to squash you like a bug should he discover your interest in his wife, but if he's hardly ever around her...

Your patron slides her chair back, with an avalancheous cacophony that brings your hands to your ears.

"I hope you won't mind if I just visit the restroom a moment," she smiles down at you, not waiting for a reply before striding off into the immeasurable distance.

Your feelings are ever so slightly hurt by the fact that she left you alone, but on second thought you do realise that it would be slightly weird to take you with her where she's going. You should be plenty fine alone on a coffee shop table. What could happen?
132212211121211212211.title: "Yes, he most certainly is!"

choices: You desperately look for an exit.
Just then, your patron comes back.
1322122111212112122111.content:
As you are contemplating whether it's wise to put the moves on Gerald's wife -- not to mention how you'd go about doing that, or whether such a thing is even possible -- you are not paying much attention to the world around you.
