Even if I might be able to squish you?!" she says a little amazed about your courage, even though it was her mother that made you feel safe.

To that question you respond, "As long as you don't squish me I'll not only protect you two, but I'll love you with all my might." In your head though you think: even if I can't push a button on a clicker.

Sasha though smiles and says, "Then I'm fine with him being my daddy."

Maria then says, "Then it looks like..."

Only to be cut off by Charlotte saying, "Hold on! Jeez, you still don't know the guy too well and think, what is going to happen to him if he lives in your apartment. Now, think he can't always be on the both of you, and how is he going to move around if he gets lost? These are some of the things you need to think of Maria. So before you say he's going to be your husband can you at least see how, uhhhh, a month goes by. You shouldn't rush things and he still needs to get used to living at his size right now. Think it's going to be a lot for the both of you."

Maria and you nod to this sadly because it's true. But you look up at Maria and say, smiling, "Hey I've been through worse."

Maria smiles back at you, "Well I guess it's time to go." Charlotte has made lots of points but hopefully you three, including Sasha, can make the best of this.
132212211121211212212111121221111211212.title: You almost passed

choices: You agree to tell a story
You suggest Maria tells a story, while you act it out
You tell Maria that kids don't need bedtime stories
1322122111212112122121111212211112112122.content:
"Well, don't forget anything I've said," Charlotte says. "And for the love of God, don't try anything intimate tonight; I'd hate to-"

"Mommy, wha's int'mit?" asks a high-pitched male voice. You'd totally forgotten about Charlotte's son! Luckily, he doesn't question what's happening, and merely walks over to take his mother's hand.

"I'll explain later," she says, pausing to kiss Maria on both cheeks before heading to the door. "Catch you later."

Once she's gone, Maria takes you back from Sasha, and you guess what she's about to say before the words can work their way from her gigantic mouth. "Mommy, wha's int'mit?"

"No time for that!" Maria says. "It's half nine, and way past your bedtime! Get upstairs and brush your teeth, and I'll be up with a bedtime story in five minutes."

The girl hurries to the stairs, and Maria's eyes descend to you, nestled in the palm of her left hand. "Do you want to try anything intimate?" she smiles.

"How forward!" you reply. "I'm not the sort of boy to put out on the first date, you know!"

She just smirks in reply. "Well then, I think it's time for Daddy to read little Sasha a bedtime story."
1322122111212112122121111212211112112122.title: It's 21:30

choices: How about some roleplaying? He's the knight, and she's the giant princess!
Hmm... now would be a good time for Maria's V.I.P. tour...
Just sleep!
1322122111212112122121111212211112112122.content:

That leaves two cyclopean exits, and as you move closer to them,you can discern sounds from each. The first,at the end of the hallway, leads into a smoothly tiled area that can only be the kitchen. Sasha's raised voice echoes through, though you cannot see her. Another voice is laughing, but the girl doesn't share that enjoyment.

At right angles to that, the other doorway gives way to another carpeted room, where you can make out Maria's sexy tones talking with another woman. You presume that that would be Charlotte. Should you eavesdrop on your beloved's private conversations, or see what is so bothering her daughter?
132212211121211212212111121221112.title: Olympus

choices: You turn and run from this cruel kid
You stay,hoping to distract him long enough for Maria to come and save Sasha
You try to make him see you as human
1322122111212112122121111212211121.content:
Into the kitchen it is, then. You walk cautiously, well aware that anything capable of scaring a five hundred foot tall girl is surely capable of ending a little guy like you with a minimal amount of effort.

Never having been to the Grand Canyon, you're unsure how effective a comparison you're making when you can't help but think of the immense edifices of fridge and sideboard loom over you on either side, while you scamper over a luxurious plain that isn't as clean as Maria would like to believe. There are discarded crumbs and other debris that only a keen (and tiny) eye such as yours can spot. But no sign of Sasha...

Cue her stomping steps around the corner before you,swaying wildly as she cries out again. On her heels comes an equally titanic young boy, of her age. The godlike youth is still laughing, his voice booming from the heavens as he stops still for a moment, merely watching Sasha as she stumbles, slipping to the ground in an undiginified heap, and a loud thump into the bargain.

Of course, given that their mothers are only in a room a few steps away, this may have alerted them, so the boy turns his head toward the doorway to see if one of them is coming to spoil his fun. That's a negatory, but as his eyes sweep the area they alight upon you for a moment, and judging by the way his smile twists into an outright grin, you can tell that he's spotted you.

Okay, how to play this one, shrunken guy?
1322122111212112122121111212211121.title: Like a Fly to a Wanton Boy

choices: Just then, Maria enters, so the boy hides you in his pocket
The boy drops you into Sasha's hair
You are pressed into Sasha's mouth
13221221112121121221211112122111211.content:
You turn and run, but a mere two pounding footfalls of the young giant brings one of his sneakers down before your face to block off your escape route. You just about avoid careening into the dirty surface, but then his fingers are around you, effortlessly lifting you into the air and before his face.

He pinches stronger than Sasha did, and his breath is fouler by far as he breathes over you hungrily. His eyes are narrowed as they inspect your fragile form, and you can see nothing but malice in them. Juvenile malice perhaps, but to a half-inch man the difference is slight.

This kid could kill you.

"Sash!" he shouts, seemingly unconcerned by the ear-bleeding his bellow causes you. "Are you scared of bugs?"

You can already see where this is going. The boy turns on the girl that he was tormenting, reaching the hand holding you forward, until the giantess fills your view. You could probably trust Sasha to be careful of you, but at the moment, convinced that you're a bug, she may quite easily squash you in an effort to brush you from her hair!

Only a miracle can save you now!
13221221112121121221211112122111211.title: Plaything

choices: Stay put
Dig to freedom
132212211121211212212111121221112111.content:
"What's all this commotion?"

Recognising Maria's voice, you take a breath to shout for help, but it is swiftly stifled as the grubby fingers around you thrust you downward, into a tight opening of cloth. You fall for a moment before coming to rest in a lint-filled cavern with the barest crack of light above you, one wall pulsing with a disturbing warmth.

The kid put you in his pocket. Ain't that just grand.

You can make out most of the conversation above you, although the thunderous pulse of the boy's hip does drown some of it out. He persuades Sasha to tell her mother that they were 'only playing', and Maria takes them at their word. You bellow for all your worth, banging your fists against the cloth wall of your prison, but your girlfriend cannot possibly hear you.

That's it, then. Should you just sit here and await the return of the boy's hand, or will you attempt to unpick the stitching of the pocket and make a break for freedom?
132212211121211212212111121221112111.title: Maria's Distraction

choices: Pretend to be a dumb bug
Reveal yourself to be human
1322122111212112122121111212211121111.content:
Far safer here than tumbling into the unknown down this boy's leg. You make yourself comfortable, keeping your distance from the wall that seethes with the kid's heat. The fewer reminders of what a dire situation you're in, the better.

Shortly, the powerful muscles beyond that wall surge into action, the child giant beginning to walk. Each step judders your fragile hammock-cell, and you slip back and forth continuously. The process repeats for so long that you lose track of time, and when the sweaty, scruffy hand of the boy delves into the pocket once more you shriek with terror at the powerful digits reaching for you.

In vain you struggle, finger and thumb effortlessly restraining your half-inch form, pressing your arms to your sides and your legs together. You are lifted out in considerable pain, the boy clearly not realising how strong he is in comparison to the average insect. Question is, does he actually realise that you're not a bug? And would it be a good idea to convince him of that truth? Being seen as human could get you help, or could earn you more torment than a common insect would at the hands of this bully.

As you are brought before his triumphant, beaming face, you have to decide whether or not you want to fight for recognition.
1322122111212112122121111212211121111.title: Possession

choices: "Sure, what game do you have in mind, kid?"
"No, I need your help here!"
"Maybe later, young man.  Take me to your mother!"
13221221112121121221211112122111211112.content:
Sasha saw you were human. Then she gave you to her mother. If this kid realises you're a person, surely he'll show Charlotte in a similar way! Genius!

Holding off the pain of his grasp with strength of will alone, you shout as loudly as you can manage when your lungs are close to being burst. "Hey! Kid! Not so tight, huh? I'm a human being, not a bug!"

Eyebrows rise on that cliff-face, and the boy's mouth drops open. "Wow!" he breathes, the force and volume of his voice crushing yours. If anything, his grip on you tightens as his excitement is evident. "This is so cool! Wanna play a game?"

Okay, this wasn't the response you were hoping for. And any game this creature wants to play with you will be really dangerous to your half-inch tall form. But if you speak out against the idea, what's to stop him from crushing you..?
13221221112121121221211112122111211112.title: Like That Even Matters

choices: Fight his giant strength
Go with the flow
1322122111212112122121111212211121112.content:
The threads of the stitching are thick, almost as broad as your arm. However, the gaps between each stitch are large enough to someone of your stature for you to get your arm in there at all. Your fingers strain in amongst the fibres in an effort to pry them apart, a task made all the more difficult by the boy's walking, the powerful muscles of his leg thundering you back and forth in your pocket prison.

It's no good. You're almost ready to give up when the journey ends, stillness returning just as you make a breakthrough, the mighty rope unravelling sufficiently for you to squeeze half your body through a hole just as probing fingers squeeze tight around your upper torso. The pain is immense, and to fight the giant's pull may tear you in half, but if the choice is between that and certain torture at his hands, you'd rather make a bid for freedom.
1322122111212112122121111212211121112.title: Dig

13221221112121121221211112122111211121.content:
No! You're not giving up so easily! Even as the boy's fingers tighten their hold, you wrap your hands up in the threads, defying the kid to yank you free. He'll give up before you do!

You're right and wrong. Your grip does not relent, but your arms snap from their sockets at the boy's first tug, and you watch them shrink from your view as you are yanked backwards out of the pocket. A trail of your blood flies before your eyes, and you mercifully pass out before you get to see the boy's reaction to having killed you...
13221221112121121221211112122111211121.title: All Torn Up About It

choices: Stay still
Try to get to her ear to talk
Scratch her scalp in a way that proves you're human
132212211121211212212111121221112112.content:
You look down on Sasha, kicking your legs feebly against inevitable fate. The boy releases his death-like grip, and you scream as you drop into the unruly mass of the girl's hair.

She may scratch for you, but perhaps that'll only be if you give her reason to. If you stay absolutely still, maybe you can survive this. Assuming the watching boy doesn't interfere, of course...
132212211121211212212111121221112112.title: The boy drops you into Sasha's hair

choices: Start moving
Wait to jump off
1322122111212112122121111212211121121.content:
"I don't feel anything," Sasha mumbles below you, the vibration of her voice somewhat dulled by her skull.

"It's there," the boy asserts wildly, his voice all around you, "and it's such a disgusting crawler!"

"You're lying," the girl returns.

"What did you call me?" Looks like this could return to violence soon enough. But then a mature giantess strides in through the open kitchen doorway, demanding to know what's going on. Sasha turns to face her, throwing you about amongst the wretched strands of her hair, and you can't quite see who it is. Should you dash around now, to try and attract the attention of the woman, who may be Maria? Or will you continue to wait on Sasha's head until an opportunity arises for you to jump off onto some other surface?
1322122111212112122121111212211121121.title: So Far, So Swell

choices: You awaken with Maria crying over your dying body
Maria takes you to a doctor
the boy snatches you again
1322122111212112122121111212211121122.content:
"Ah!" Sasha screams from below you, not even the skull between you dulling the pain. "I can feel it crawling around! Get it off, get it off, get it off!"

The boy merely stands back and laughs, and your perilous descent from strand to strand of limb-thick hair is now made even more difficult as the head of the giant girl begins to whip back and forth, her monstrous fingers combing through the path you've taken, the sound of nails against scalp dredging terror into your soul. One good hit from her and you're dead.

"What's all the commotion?" asks Maria, having entered at the scream. You sigh with relief at her intervention, but as you do you you pause in your progress, allowing Sasha's finger to mash into you, a single press pulping half your body, from the feel of things. You're still half-conscious as another finger gets its nail under you, peeling you free from the hair to be held aloft. Darkness comes for you as you hear Sasha's plaintive wail, upon recognising you. "Mummy..!"
1322122111212112122121111212211121122.title: Mash Up

13221221112121121221211112122111211221.content:
Sound returns before vision. Sasha's voice, close to tears.

"I squished the tiny man."

That'd be you, mashed beyond your ability to live by a girl as you crawled in her hair.

"I'm sorry, Mommy. Can you fix him?"

It would be nice to think that Maria could help you, but as you blink your eyes open, the mess that remains of your body below your waist, you don;t hold out much hope. No, there's just pulp, spreading out across the warm, ridged surface of the woman's hand. There's no pain anymore, but the sight of your own body so tattered is more than you can bear, so you look directly upward to see Maria's godlike visage, rivers streaming from her eyes. Were this a fairytale, those tears would heal you, regrow you, and there'd be a happy ending for all involved. Yet despite the unbelievable condition you find yourself in, this is real life, not a children's story.

Thinking of children, you look around to see where Sasha is. You can't die with her feeling guilty over you. Not at her age. But your limited field of vision does not display the gigantic little girl; Maria's curled fingers, protecting your shattered form from the outside, are the extent of your world. Not so long ago did this palm serve as a prison, where this woman carried you to the cafe for your introduction to each other. Then, how mixed were your emotions?

Relief at not being immediately crushed, thrown together with trepidation at what possible fate could await you once the fingers uncurled. That was just hours ago, and now Maria is the gentle goddess upon whose mercy you've relied. A mature woman, not at all like those careless university girls that you'd been around earlier.

How differently would things have turned out if you'd stuck with the ass-girl. You're ashamed to not even know her name, only the gigantic posterior that served as your transport from the exam hall. She'd been drinking with her buddies, and would have no doubt gone on to a club or something... You wouldn't have survived. No, that would have been foolish. You wouldn't have lived very long, and certainly wouldn't have met someone as caring as Maria.

Taller, though. You'd have died at an inch height, unknown to the man in black. Unless he'd have followed you there? Would he have found you wherever you went, a relentless tracker from whom there is no escape? Will he find you even here?

It'd be a shame to die without knowing why you were shrunk. And only that man could tell you. Why hasn't he come for you? You must be important, for him to have gone to such lengths. He can't let you die now! Maybe this is just a test, and he'll pop up any second now for another offer to follow him. For a man that can grow and shrink matter, restoring a crushed body should be nothing!

No. No, he's not coming.

Instead, you're going to die here slowly. Not the instant end of being crushed. Which is more merciful?

"Don't die..."

Maria's voice, Maria's breath, both washing over you in a heavenly gust... Raising an arm is just possible, and that brings the sky closer, the fleshy ceiling of Maria's face eclipsing all else.

"Oh God, you're still alive! Hang in there, it's going to be okay..."

"No," you croak, "I know I'm done for. Don't cry. I'm just some insect that wandered into your life, and you shouldn't cry over a crushed bug..."

Did she hear that? Her eyes are still watery, and tears fall around you now that her eyes are so much closer to you. Their saltiness stings where they touch your exposed body, and your numbness is wrenched away as pain reawakens, your lack of a lower half lancing through what remains of you.

Maria's concern reawakens, and she nuzzles close, her nose an inverted mountain, a stalactite the size of a house. "I'm sorry," she whispers.

"I should never have left you alone, let Sasha get inside my handbag at you! I'm a terrible mother, and now it's actually gotten someone killed! You died because of me!"

She shouts that at the end, and that blast takes your hearing. She can't hear you anyway, and there's no way for you to apologise, to make her feel better. She blames her daughter as well, when it was your choice to escape, your lack of trust that brought this all about. Even the boy, that unthinking brute that sprinkled you into Sasha's hair, isn't really to blame. To him, you were just a bug, no harm no foul if harm befell you. You don't even know his name...

Fingers from Maria's free hand descend, closing on you like express trains, only to pause and veer away, the colossal consciousness controlling their motion wanting to touch you, to stroke you and soothe your ills, but all too aware that her merest touch could further push your body toward obliteration. Already, the simple scratch of her daughter took half of you, wiping you away like ink on a whiteboard. So little do you matter...

These thoughts, what are they worth? You don't matter. Once you've passed, your remains will be almost nothing. What, will Maria bury you? Six millimetres deep? There's not enough of you to be cremated, unless someone decides to stub their cigarette out on you. It might almost be preferable if Maria chose to devour you, to lick up your pathetic self and take you into herself. It would be a useless amount of nutrition, but even the smallest amount you could give to this generous goddess would be an offering. You would be absorbed into her, become one in a way no-one else ever has...

Her mouth opens to take a breath, and you gaze overly long into that abyss. What an adventure that would be, to descend deep into the woman in the last moments of life, the light of your being fading into the endless darkness of her immensity... You'd offer the idea up to her in a prayer, but for the fact that your voice doesn't carry to her.

The mouth closes, the face falls up and away, a new sky shown where once it was, passing along. She's walking somewhere, but where can she possibly take you? Nothing can save you now. Why would she waste time and effort with you, when you are nothing but dirt now, to be swept away and forgotten? She hardly knew you. How can you have been more than a momentary distraction to her?

There are others who will miss you more, and they'll never know where you went. Your parents, other family, friends, acquaintances... The university might launch an investigation, but there is no evidence of what happened to you. Some people might have seen you shrink, disappear, or whatever in the exam hall. Will this just be chalked up to alien abduction? Are you going to be one of the great unsolved mysteries of all time? Posthumous fame, a Fortean celebrity for conspiracy theorists to mull over for decades to come?

There's some small comfort in that. Yet you'll be forgotten as soon as that man in black strikes again. Why would he shrink just one person, after all? Were you a test run for some larger, more nefarious plot? Is your death here just tidying up a loose end, a little girl squishing you inadvertently dooming the world? Man, that would suck. But you won't live long enough to see what is to come, and shouldn't concern yourself with it. Just as Maria shouldn't worry for the tiny man, so the tiny man shouldn't worry for the fate of the giant world. A speck should not concern himself with his betters, with creatures that are infinitely more powerful, and capable of handling themselves...

Maria's journey has ended, and her face reappears, absorbing your thoughts, scattering your ramblings to the wind. "Hold in there," she says, the world of sound returning.

"Why should I bother?" you reply, knowing that no-one can hear. "Death, or life as an insect. We had some sweet times honey, but what future is there for us? Your daughter maimed me without knowing, and I doubt that you can be in full control of yourself twenty-four-seven. This would have happened eventually, baby. Best get it out of the way soon, before you get too attached. Too attached to the cute bug that you let crawl over yourself for a laugh. Maybe there would have been more to it, but you're going to have to find some other sexual release, my dear. Meet someone your own size, someone you don't have to worry every second of every day about crushing. You have your place in the world raising your daughter, not acting as some surrogate mother to a crippled university student. Mine's a unique disability, but it would have held you back just as much as any other.

"Perhaps some small measure of fame - no pun intended, honest - could have resulted. Think what might have happened if you came out to the public with me... The attention would have been on me, but your story could have sold for millions. It still can. Wherever you're going now, stop. Head to the nearest news station, call the emergency services, hail a taxi - anything! Oh God, make my death mean something! The life that you and Sasha can have... I can provide for you, if only you don't let me go to waste!"

No, Maria didn't suddenly tune in to your voice. Her eyes are red raw, her nostrils shiny with recent dribble. Your death is really getting to her that much? Oh God, what effect has this had upon Sasha..?

Where your speech went unnoticed, your innermost thought gets attention immediately, as the girl's face nuzzles in close to her mother. She's not as distraught, but that's definite worry. Enough worry that she doesn't hold back, and her bawled requests for you to be okay overwhelm your senses again, deafness shielding you from meaning.

She moves closer, her own ever-so-slightly less gargantuan fingers claw at the edges of Maria's own. The older woman reacts instinctively, moving back to prevent her daughter from finishing what she started, even if it would once again be an accident. Even that slight jostle slides your ruined carcass across her palm, so much of yourself being left behind, tearing into you with pain that no-one has known before.
13221221112121121221211112122111211221.title: Ode to a Shrunken Corpse

choices: Charlotte comes and takes her son's side
Maria wonders what's going on here
The woman is impassive, allowing the boy to grab for you
13221221112121121221211112122111212.content:
He's just a kid. No matter how massive, how much extra weight and power he has over you now, you are the elder, you are smarter and you are his superior.

You repeat that mantra to yourself over and over as he stomps closer to you across the kitchen, lifting and smashing down barn-sized sneakers with minimal effort. In no time at all his shadow has fallen over you, and you can't crane your neck back far enough to see his face as he booms out: "hello there, little bug person."

He's recognised your form! Your heart starts in that moment, but then a cacophonous collision shakes the world as - with a scream of "LEAVE HIM ALONE!" - Sasha careens across the room, tumbling the boy to the floor.

For all the good it'll do, you curl into a ball, hands over your head. Should one of these two titans strike you in their thrashing frenzy you'll be obliterated in an instant, and as the conflict rages all sense is lost in the noise of screaming and blows stronger than armies of men your size.

One louder noise silences the tumult, and you presume one of the giantess mothers must have come to see what the disturbance is. Blubbering from the boy is a quiet backdrop as one of his tears actually splashes onto you, pinning you to the ground under its weight. Looks like Sasha may be in trouble, depending upon who's come to check on the children.
13221221112121121221211112122111212.title: Conflict of the Gods

choices: Charlotte moves to kill you
Charlotte moves to collect you for her son
Charlotte ignores you, so pathetic and beneath her notice
132212211121211212212111121221112121.content:
"What's going on in here?" demands the massive woman. She stomps in barefoot, and while you haven't been around them too much those toes aren't Maria's. So, it's Charlotte, you can presume. There's not much about her that you can determine, beyond the lengthy expanse of bare flesh that lead from her feet, up pass plateaus of knees and into denim shorts. Not only is she too tall for you to see much more, but you don't want to take your eyes off those feet for too long; they could crush you quite easily.

Charlotte paces closer, steps slow but still intimidating, rising and falling with immense weight and power. You try to rise, but the salty tear has you pinned under itself. You would be embarrassed, were you not in mortal terror.

"S-sasha hit me!" the boy bawls. "G-get her away from me!"

"Maria, get your girl under control," Charlotte says, emotion trembling beneath the surface.

"No!" Sasha shouts, rising to her knees and throwing you into her shadow. "He tried to hurt the little man!"

Charlotte is clearly incredulous, but you can imagine her gaze following Sasha's eyes to find you, so tiny and helpless at her feet. When Maria gets here, she'll clear things up. But then she does enter, and immediately cries out for her daughter, passing over you with a brief burst of speed and awe.

Charlotte is unsupervised as she looks down on the bug that caused her son to get injured. In a moment, Maria will speak up for you, but that moment is all that a giant woman would require to end you...
132212211121211212212111121221112121.title: Bad Mom

choices: Investigate Charlotte
Check on the kitchen situation
Head elsewhere in the house
1322122111212112122121111212211122.content:
The living room that you enter is familiar - it's the one where Maria lay while you explored her body. Of course, back then you were seeing it from an elevated position, and your view from the floor is much more restricted. You can just about perceive the bottle of wine standing on the table, and make out the bobbing head of Maria over the couch's armrest. No sign of her feet though, so they must be up there with her.

You approach that titanic piece of furniture, listening keenly to the women's voices above. The armchair in the room is unoccupied, so this mysterious Charlotte must be sitting up there with Maria. As you near the front of the couch, all becomes clear.

"You have a glow about you," says Charlotte, nudging Maria's toes with her own. You duck down behind one of Maria's discarded sandals to pay closer attention.

"Really?" Maria laughs, coyly.

"A new man in your life?" the other prys, raising her wineglass to her lips.

"Mayyyybe."

"I knew it! Spill. Tall, dark and handsome?"

Charlotte seems puzzled at Maria's spluttering laughter in response to her question. While waiting for her to quiet down, she allows one of her massive hands to run through her long, dark hair.

"Sorry," Maria eventually responds. "Ahem. But he makes me feel... I don't know. I barely know him, and already..."

You grin, hiding your own discomfort at learning that the woman felt this deeply about you. Doesn't mean you're averse to learning more, though.

Then there's a scream and a crash from the kitchen. The kids!

"I'll go," Maria assures Charlotte, reaching across to return her glass to the table. Then she stands.

Her bare feet smash down nearby, and you cringe in naked terror. Sure, you've been near her feet before, when you first 'met', but then they were still, no threat. And yes, you did come close to being trodden on several times in the bar, but that was when you were twice your current size. And most of all... You can't explain it, in much the same way that the woman can't articulate her feelings toward you. Maria, were she to step on you now, would crush you barefoot. Without a shoe or sandal between you, bare flesh to flesh, the death would seem more personal somehow, and an even greater reminder of how much of an insect you have become, to be disposed of unaided.

She strides over you,leaving the room in seconds and spinning your light body in the breeze of her wake. Charlotte slides her feet back to the carpet from the couch much more slowly, cradling her glass in both her hands,and you have time to consider her.

Of course, the forced perspective bestowed from a half-inch high viewpoint doesn't allow you the luxury of the best description, but you take as much in as you are able. She's of similar age to Maria (understandably), but is slimmer, a woman you would describe (were you at regular height and not in fact the size of her thumbnail) as thin. It's hard to tell, but you may place her as being taller than Maria, and her hair is certainly longer. Facial features are hard to distinguish, and clothing-wise her tanned legs lead up to denim cut-offs and a purple blouse of some sort.

You're alone with her right now, and perhaps this would be an excellent chance to inspect the sort of company that Maria keeps. If you're going to get to the know the woman, you should also get to know her friends, right?

On the other hand, who knows what Maria, Sasha and Charlotte's kid are up to in the kitchen? Perhaps you should check up on them, make sure that everything's all right. The sensible part of your brain reminds you that that could be incredibly dangerous, however.
1322122111212112122121111212211122.title: Spy on Maria

choices: Charlotte felt you and wants to investigate.
Maria returns, and distracts Charlotte.
Charlotte stands up
13221221112121121221211112122111221.content:
Pushing your fears aside for the moment, you'll let Maria handle the kids for now. To be brutally truthful there was really nothing you could do for them at this point, not to mention how long it would take you to cross the room, never mind get to where they were. Also, like a mouse that was afraid to leave its small hole in the wall, you're a bit apprehensive of the outside. Huddled under the couch at Charlotte's feet you lay in wait. But after a few minutes you realize that Maria's not exactly coming back as soon as you had figured, and decide that maybe there something you can do while you wait. But again, logic was key here, you didn't want to go around doing anything that would get you killed.

Then there was also the variable, Charlotte. Although you trusted Maria, for now anyway, there are always other options, aren't there? This woman seems trustworthy enough, and hadn't she asked to meet who Maria's new love interest was? Suddenly these thoughts strike you as nonsense, and you realize that they really were. But then again, what really makes sense now, ever since you were a half inch tall? Your mind is clouded with confusion and apathy, and you're not even sure what made you walk forward to Charlotte's big toe and kick it. Maybe you never would understand. A shudder runs through the giantess's foot that was have been imperceptible to the average human's naked eye, but standing right in front of it, with the foot as large as two buses together changes your perspective.
13221221112121121221211112122111221.title: Investigate Charlotte

choices: Charlotte's foot stomps you into oblivion.
Maria enters the room and interrupts Charlotte's bug-killing.
Charlotte upends her wineglass to catch the bug
132212211121211212212111121221112211.content:
As regret begins to seep into your thought process, you begin to back away. To use an appropriate metaphor, you were fearing the "sleeping" monster you had awakened. This of course referred to the giantess above you named Charlotte, to whom the feet you stood at belonged. Until now she had been dormant to your presence, but as she rocks forward you know that she had to have felt your sharp kick. It had dealt a blow to her toe knuckle that must have felt slightly stronger than a tickle, but it had been enough to get her attention, since she had just been sitting there alone, waiting for Maria's eventual return. But there really was no time to run, you think to yourself.

As you look up at the beauty all light is cut out by her shadow. The girl was leaning forward in her seat, looking down. Her eyes were like immense, quivering lenses that studied the environment around you. You stuck out like a sore thumb, that much was clear. The expected outcome; shock and awe, then followed. Now would be a better time to try your hand at escape, but what good would it do to start a game of cat and mouse. Sure, half of you now wanted to split, but couldn't Charlotte most likely be trusted? The giantess suddenly stops her look of surprise and adopts one of grim realization. You don't have to guess what she now thinks you are, as you can spot her sandaled foot rising out of your peripheral vision.

Now you better get your miniscule hide out of there.
132212211121211212212111121221112211.title: A Bigger Mistake

1322122111212112122121111212211122111.content: There's no way that half-inch tall you is evading the casually redeployed foot of Charlotte. You barely manage to leave the starting blocks before she levers her ankle up and then down, bringing the sandal crashing upon your pathetic form, smearing it into the carpet. To her, extinguishing your life won't even be worth noting to Maria when she gets back, even as she prys for more information about you, and your relationship with her.
1322122111212112122121111212211122111.title: Charlotte Stomp

choices: Hide before Maria spots you
Say 'hi' by climbing onto her toes
Stay where you are and wait for Maria to see you for what you are
1322122111212112122121111212211122112.content:
The familiar stomping of Maria's feet - how pleasant that you're starting to recognise it, and tell it apart from that of other giants! - disrupts Charlotte, and rather than coming down upon you her own foot smashes back down where it lay. "How are the kids?" she asks.

"Getting a little rough, but nothing beyond hair pulling," Maria replies, approaching your position once again. "If I didn't know any better, I'd say your Jack is quite smitten with Sasha."

Her gigantic bare feet are almost upon you again, but then Charlotte pipes up with a comment of her own. "Careful, Maria! I saw a bug on the floor around here, and you don't want to step on it!"

The foot does indeed pause, sinking into the soft carpet a short distance from you, those divine toes crushing the strands effortlessly. "A bug?" Maria gasps. Presumably, she's thought of you immediately. She may be somewhat annoyed at you having disobeyed her wishes to stay away and spied on her to boot, but then again she may be pleased at this opportunity to show you to her friend. If you fear the former, maybe you should run and hide again - she can always assume this was a real bug, right? If you suspect the latter, her toes are right there, so you could run up to her and confirm your humanity immediately, and get these introductions over with.
1322122111212112122121111212211122112.title: And Maria's Back, Folks!

choices: You walk out to meet Charlotte on your own terms
You refuse to leave your dark corner
You play the part of creepy ghost
13221221112121121221211112122111221121.content:
You dash away as soon as you think to, as it'll take Maria but a moment to glance down at her feet and spot you. Speed is key. Even as you reach the comforting, protecting shade beneath her couch, the ground vibrates beneath her titanic weight and you hear a deep sigh.

Still, she can't come after you with Charlotte around. That would reveal your secret, right? And if she truly loves you, she wouldn't want to expose you to and unnecessary danger? Right?

"I know you're under there," Maria intones. Looking around, you can see her mammoth toes facing you, Charlotte's heels turned away as she sits down, causing the alarming inversion of the ceiling above.

"Who are you talking to?" the second woman asks, and it seems as if the jig is up.
13221221112121121221211112122111221121.title: Under the Sofa

choices: Kids come running in and take you
Charlotte ask you what happened to you
Maria is upset that she can't trust you
132212211121211212212111121221112211212.content:
Without pausing you run to the back of the couch, where you hoped neither woman's arm could reach you. As you ran, you noticed two things: First was the fact that a hand was coming at you faster then you wanted. Secondly, Maria's voice started to boom over your ears.

"Uh, I guess I should tell you. Today my daughter found a tiny guy and I TOLD him to stay in my purse. But it looks like he didn't listen."

You keep running, now feeling something grab the collar of your shirt and pull you back. You think 'She has me. I'm dead!' but hear a rip and see your shirt tear off your body. Looking back you see that it can't be repaired by any miracle.

Maria says, "There he... Oh come on, you took off your shirt?"

"You ripped it off!" you yell back in your own defense. As soon as you finish you hit the wall at the end of the couch. You feel the floor shake and you are in the middle of the air as you now see two pair of eyes aim right at you.

"You better just come out now before we have to move the couch to get you," Maria warns.

"You can try to fool me, but I know there is no little man under the couch. I'm not going to help you move the couch just for you to fool me," Charlotte says, now looking under the couch still not sure if Maria was telling the truth. You think for a moment and start to walk toward Maria's hand.

Now as you climb her hand she waits until you are in the center of her hand before closing it shut and bringing you back to her face. "Now was that so hard?" Maria asks. Her face changes from victory to curiosity. "How much of our conversation did you hear?" Maria asks as she opens up her hand.

"Oh my god he is a tiny man." Charlotte said in awe looking at you.

"I heard from Charlotte said 'there a glow about you'." you answer her hoping she will take it well.
132212211121211212212111121221112211212.title: You refuse to leave your dark corner

choices: She continues
Kids come in and are amazed by you.
Charlotte grills you
1322122111212112122121111212211122112122.content:
Maria asks "What else did you hear?" she now sat down looking straight at you.

"He can answer that when he tells me how he got so small." Charlotte said as she snatched you from Maria's hand.
You look at her in fear as she then takes her left hand and block Maria from trying to save you. She raises you way from Maria but close enough to hear you. "And if you want him back you better tell the story when you found him."

Charlotte told Maria even though she didn't keep a straight face at all.

"Fine." Maria said. "From your side of the story," Charlotte said as she lowered you back to Maria. "Fine but he has to tell what he heard of our private talk," Maria warns you.

"Okay, I have nothing to hide," you tell her.

"With what you were thinking as well. And don't try and ly this time because I can tell now." she said as you were placed back into her hand.

"Fine,"you say hoping she was bluffing.

So now you tell the giantesses your story to where you met Maria.

She then takes over but before she does you tell her " Don't leave out what you were thinking."

" I don't have to if I don't want to." she states.

"Yes you do," Charlotte states," or else I tell him about..."

"Don't you dare!" Maria says as she punches Charlotte on her arm.

"Yes I will unless you tell what you were thinking," Charlotte says with a smile. Your are now wondering what it is. Though you're not dumb enough to ask when Maria is still here. Maybe later.

"Any way from where ...." She stops and wonders about something. "This may sound weird but I never got your name." she tells you. You then realized she was right.

"I guess you're right," you laugh to them,"It's Jake."
1322122111212112122121111212211122112122.title: Time to talk

choices: Struggle for all you're worth
Try to ease yourself free
132212211121211212212111121221112212.content:
The familiar stomping of Maria's feet - how pleasant that you're starting to recognise it, and tell it apart from that of other giants! - returns, and you'll never know whether or not Charlotte felt you, as now she talks to her friend again. "How are the kids?"

"Getting a little rough, but nothing beyond hair pulling," Maria replies, approaching your position once again. "If I didn't know any better, I'd say your Jack is quite smitten with Sasha."

Her gigantic bare feet are almost upon you again, and you dodge instinctively aside, little realising until too late that you've climbed atop Charlotte's sandal! You think to move back down again as Maria returns to her seat, but the giantess' toe flexes slightly, pinning you gently beneath its weight as she stands.

"If they're getting a little rowdy, maybe we should go now," your captor says. "But that doesn't mean I won't be calling you this evening to hear all about this special little man of yours!"

Maria laughs, rising herself to hug her friend goodbye. The kids are shouted to, and you're about to be in for a nightmare of walking, under the foot of your girlfriend's girl friend. She may have felt you before - to attack the underside of her toe now may get her attention and save you! Then again, it may just serve to bring her attention to the bug on her sandal. Perhaps it would be better to try and slowly ease yourself out from under the oppressive mass of the toe, the better to live to see another day? Less risky, but by the time you're out the woman could be well away from Maria!
132212211121211212212111121221112212.title: Quite Smitten

1322122111212112122121111212211122121.content:
You bring all of your miniscule power to bear on the underside of Charlotte's toe, kicking and punching and screaming and hoping that the heavy, burning hot mass above you will relent and allow you to see the light just once more time.

Impossibly, the rock-hard surface rushes into the air, leaving you gasping as you watch the immaculate and intricate patterns whorled into its underside. Just as quickly, it crashes back down, the woman determined to rub away the irritation.

Your frame can't withstand the power that the giantess carries in this single digit, and as your bones shatter and your organs liquefy, you struggle even harder than you had before. Mercifully, the weight and pain relents, and the whole foot withdraws away from your sight, such as it is. Things don't seem so clear now, and a haze is descending upon your vision. You can make out Charlotte's face, hear her words:

"...stone or something, what do you think..."

She offers her sandal - you upon it - in Maria's direction, and you look one last time up at her humungous face, coughing your final breath. A flicker of recognition, and one whisper before the light goes out forever:

"I love you."
1322122111212112122121111212211122121.title: Doomed

choices: Try to climb up Charlotte's seat
Try to climb up the car door
Head for the gear stick
1322122111212112122121111212211122122.content:
Easy does it. That's the way, you tell yourself. With each step, Charlotte raises her toes above you, a brief window of opportunity to roll yourself a little before they come crashing down again. Compared to this, your journey with the barmaid last night was bliss!

You really should count your blessings that you haven't been squashed already. Charlotte's rapid strides mean that the devastating weight of her biggest piggy is on you for only a fraction of a second. That's more than enough time for every fibre of your being to feel the titanic pressure, and for your senses to be overwhelmed by the rough texture, slick, rank sweat and oppressive heat. Only the fact that you can distinguish between left and right foot smashing to the ground tells you that you haven't gone deaf from the impacts around you.

Time is uncertain. Movements stop, and your world rights itself, no longer sliding alarmingly through the three hundred degrees of a footstep. You consider your tormentor for a moment, reaching up to pat gently at its whorled surface, and then it withdraws, sliding neatly from the sandal strap and leaving you on your back in a low pool of Charlotte's sweat.

Looking upwards, you can make out the curve of her bare leg leading up to her denim cut-offs, but most of her torso is blocked by a large column jutting toward her stomach, seemingly supporting a large, hollow satellite dish. What could that be?

Standing on the sandal, you see its partner sitting a short distance away. The freed feet stretch in the air for a moment, and while you resent their imprisonment of you, you can't stay mad at colossal beauties for long.

Then they come down, over your head and behind you. You turn, just making out raised platforms in the darkness, onto which the feet daintily slide. One pushes down somewhat experimentally.

Finally you twig where you are. Those are the pedals of a car, the column above a steering wheel! You look upward, to the light, only to see Charlotte's mighty arm already in the process of pulling the door closed. The deed is done instantly, plunging you, at foot level, into black. Looking up, you can see the goddess fastening her seatbelt, hear her telling her son to do the same. Around, you can both taste and smell the rankness of this area. In your soul, you know that you're being taken from Maria. There's nothing you can do, and it eats you up.

The vehicle launches into motion, and your brain whirls with plans for getting out of this. Charlotte is Maria's friend, so it's not as hopeless as it could be; contact her, and you get right back to your giant girlfriend. You don't really want to distract her while she has her eyes on the road however. And if at all possible, you'd like to travel out of here at somewhere higher than ankle level.

Waiting here until she steps out would be a no-no - she'd be gone too fast. No, you're going to have to take a few more risks...
1322122111212112122121111212211122122.title: Easy Rider

choices: Climb up Charlotte
Shelter in Charlotte's pocket
Climb the back of the car seat itself
13221221112121121221211112122111221221.content:
Like most car seats, there's a space underneath it, to your half-inch self a vast and mysterious cave. Your choice of routes for ascent are limited to the plastic sides, and they're not the most textured of surfaces. The motion of the car doesn't affect you too much at your size, so the only impediment is that surface, smooth with only the slightest hints of indentation.

Your own weight is close to negligible, though; hauling yourself upward with your upper body. Like an insect, you scramble upward, the roar of the car engine the only thing in the world besides the climb.

It's an achievement to get to the top, and despite yourself you pause to celebrate like Rocky. That was such a thrill, the greatest feat of strength you've ever performed! Nothing can stand in your way!

Then you notice Charlotte's ass right ahead of you, and crane your neck looking up at her sheer massiveness, an unrelenting surface of macro-sized power. The denim she's wearing sure looks even easier to climb, with thick strands for you to use, so getting higher should be easy. The aternative would be taking shelter in one of her pockets for the moment, and let her do her thing.
13221221112121121221211112122111221221.title: Scaling the Car Seat

choices: You tumble toward the other mother
You tumble toward the running girl
You tumble to the ground, abandoned and alone
13221221112121121221211112122112.content:
You just have to relieve the tediousness. It doesn't prove too difficult to ascend toward the light above by clambering over the tissues. It is only just in reach though, so unless you want to dangle from your hands all the while, you're going to have to pull yourself out to listen in on the conversation of giants.

Your upper body strength is nothing to write home about, but it's equal to the task of dragging yourself painfully across the jagged zipline at the mouth of the handbag. You lie in the sunlight for a short while, panting at the exertion and acclimatising your eyes to their new surroundings.

Above you, Maria's elbow and arm mark the most that you can see of your benefactor, and there's no way you intend to look down from this great height just to glimpse more of her. Instead, you look across to the secondary mountainous woman with whom she's sharing her cacophonous conversation.

Of course, Maria does not stand perfectly still throughout this, shifting her stance from time to time, but despite the unstable footing you are able to take in most of the woman. Granted,your view is from slightly above the waist, but you like to think that your eyes have captured all the important details.

She's big. Now, given that you're only half an inch high that should be a given, but even if you were regular size you'd find this person to be large. Maria is more or less perfectly proportioned, but this woman's tanned skin - white lines on her shoulders showing where her sunbathing was covered by bikini straps - covers an overweight mass of fat and muscle. She's probably not obese, but your unique perspective accentuates the difference in stature, making her seem monstrously bloated. Her form seems barely contained by the strappy top that she wears on this hot summer's day, and the tremendous size of her breasts puts you in awe, utterly lost for a suitable comparison.

A near-floor length blue skirt covers her from the waist down, and you can barely make out her face past her prodigious chest. Long strands of (dyed?) red hair hang down though, and you think that you can place the accent with which she speaks as Australian.

The subject matter on which she speaks with Maria isn't terribly interesting. They're only mild acquaintance, it seems, since they both have daughters attending this school, and they're making small talk while they wait for their kids to leave. They talk in that way that near-strangers do, revealing nothing too deep about themselves as they string out hopeful offers of topics to bring them closer.

Then a girl runs in from the distance, and you jump up as you fear that Sasha will see you and grasp you again. But the rapidly approaching colossus is too pale, tall and blonde to be her, and as she veers toward Maria's friend you realise that it must be her daughter. The mothers exchange farewells and turn to part, but as this happens Maria re-settles the bag on her shoulder.

You fall off it.
13221221112121121221211112122112.title: Parted

choices: Maria's face is in a sad, submissive state
Maria's hand is descending to crush the evil stranger
Maria is running from the room
132212211121211212212111121222.content:
Maria flings the door open with her free hand, only to be met with her daughter on the other side. The sudden opening of the partition shocks Sasha, her right hand in knocking motion, her left grasped into a ball. You look up at Maria's face, and find a stern look there.

"Young lady", Maria scolds, "What have I told you about walking home by yourself".

"But, mom", Sasha tries to defend her actions.

Maria ushers her daughter into the apartment, not allowing Sasha to explain herself. Sasha strolls, head down, past the couch and into the kitchen, sitting at a table in its center. Maria closes the door and carries you into the kitchen. As she sits across from her daughter, she carefully sets you onto the tabletop. She turns her attention from you, glaring at Sasha.

"Now why did you come home alone?", Maria asks more calmly.

"I didn't", Sasha responds, "and I was so careful, just like you said. I didn't want to smush him".

Maria now looks confused, "Smush who, honey?".

"The other little man, silly", Sasha says with the innocence only a child could possess, "He said he was looking for his friend, so I brought him here".

Sasha reaches across the table, not to far from you, with her clenched fist. Her fingers uncoil, and another half-inch tall man drops onto the oak surface. As he brushes himself off, you immediately recognize him. That run down black zoot suit, those out of style sunglasses, that sinister smirk; you could never forget that jerk from the bar.

"You!", you cry with a pointing finger.

The man's mouth reveals a wide grin, "Me".

Maria grasps the severity of the situation, "Sasha, dear, why don't you go to your room and play awhile".

Sasha nods, seeming to forget about the tiny people standing on the table, and runs to her room. You glance over your shoulder at Maria. She looks angry, to say the least. Unlike you, the mysterious stranger doesn't seem the least bit intimidated.

"I must say, you have a very lovely daughter, Ms.Givens", the man addresses the fuming giantess, "Such a sweet little girl".

"Why were you hanging around my daughter?!", Maria pounds a wrecking ball of flesh into the table hard, causing a great quake.

"Careful now", the stranger taunts, looking at you instead of Maria, "You're scaring our little friend".

It's true. Maria's sudden spout of rage has you shaken. Maria seems to take notice, toning down her voice as she speaks again.

"Why do you want him?", Maria refers to you, "Why can't you just fix him and leave us alone?"

"Let's get one thing straight", the mystery man corrects, "I don't want anybody, I'm only doing what I have to", he then turns his attention to you, "You certainly have complicated things, haven't you? I told you no one could help you, but you had to go and find help anyway, didn't you? Well, now your new friend is going to need to come with us, too".

"And if we don't?", Maria questions.

"I suppose you could turn me down", the man says casually, "After all, it would probably be a lot easier to parent a child that stands less than a half-inch tall".

"You got me", you work your way into the conversation, "I'll go with you, alright?"

The stranger shakes his head, "As I said, that's not enough, anymore. The two of you need to come with me right away. Otherwise, the kid is going to shrink. Well, what's it gonna be?".

You look up once again, and the answer reveals itself to you.
132212211121211212212111121222.title: Sasha's new friend

choices: The stranger's splattered remains are where they should be
There is no mess, but a tiny letter instead!
He's dead, yes, but a dozen other tiny men with guns stand on the table
1322122111212112122121111212222.content:
As Maria's flat palm comes down upon him, the dark-willed stranger gives you his last words.

"She's really going to regret this, you know".

You blink, and the man is replaced by the side of Maria's index finger. The tremor of the collision throws you onto the inside edge of Maria's thumb. In thoughtless fear, you climb onto the thick digit, the instinctual logic that something can't crush you if you're on top of it taking precedent over all else. Regaining your senses, you walk to the center of the back of Maria's hand, her distraught face dominating your attention.

"What did I do?", Maria asks you in a state of shock, "I killed him, didn't I?".

"Yeah", your response is emotionless.

Maria lowers her head, "I'm sorry. He might have been your best chance to..."

"No", you cut Maria off solemnly, "He had it coming. You can't threaten somebody's kid and expect...".

You stop as the realization sinks in. Your gaze meets Maria's as she thinks the same thought. Sasha. You cling to the nearest knuckle as Maria jumps from her seat. You somehow manage to hang on through her hurried pace. Maria opens the door to Sasha's room, but she (Sasha) is no where to be found.

"Sasha", Maria calls out with a soft desperation.

Maria begins to take a step into the room, but you think better of it, "Wait!".

The sandaled foot retracts to its original position as Maria seems to have figured out why you stopped her. The two of you scan the floor. Maria's large eyes struggle to differentiate her daughter from the light blue, tight-laced carpet, but you make out the crying little child sitting in the middle of the room. You point Sasha out to Maria, and she (Maria) gets on her hands and knees, you still atop her right hand. Maria crawls to her tiny child, reaching cautiously to her. Sasha responds the way any little kid (or anyone else, for that matter) would in such a predicament, she turns and runs away in absolute terror.

"Sasha!", Maria screams with tears rolling down her face, "Come back, honey. Mommy only wants to help!".

"Uh, this whole thing takes some getting used to", you educate Maria, "Better let me take care of this".

Yeah, right! Ignoring the fact that you haven't even gotten a handle on your own situation yet, you're notoriously bad with children. Yeah, you're just the man for the job!

You leap from Maria's hand, and sprint after the scared little girl. You call her name, and Sasha stops. Upon seeing you chasing after you, she runs to meet you. Her arms wrap around your legs as her head buries itself in your thigh. A minute of tears later, and Sasha looks up at you.

"You're not big", Sasha states the obvious.

You puff your chest your chest out, acting playfully offended, "Bigger than you".

Your comment gets a badly needed rise out of the poor girl. You begin to lead her back to her ridiculously large mother's waiting hand, but she backtracks at the sight of Maria's immense smiling face.

"You're not scared, are ya?", you taunt.

Sasha's face turns angry, "No!".

You are able to guide Sasha to her mother with little resistance. Picking Sasha up, you set her on Maria's clean palm. Sasha looks frightened, but calms down a bit when you climb on as well. The two of you are elevated to Maria's weakly smiling visage. Sasha hides behind you, peeking at the intimidating vision from the side of your leg. You can tell it's killing Maria to have her daughter be so frightened of her, but she at least seems a little consoled that Sasha has taken a liking to you.

"What do we do now?", Maria begs for an answer.

You scrape for ideas, "Maybe we should check out that guy's...remains. There might be a clue or something".

Maria nods in agreement, carrying Sasha and you through the apartment and back into the kitchen. Maria shields the two of you from what you expect is a bloody sight. Maria gasps as she brings you around to see the shocking sight for yourself. You cover Sasha's eyes in anticipation of the gory scene.
1322122111212112122121111212222.title: Maria's little girl

choices: To the schoolyard!
Stay and relax
Maria turns on you
13221221112121121221211112122221.content:
You look up at Maria's disgusted, crinkling face, and decide to distract Sasha for a little while longer as her mother clears up the mess.

Strange how you console the tiny girl now, when only this morning she almost crushed you underfoot, and picked you up between finger and thumb. Then, she was a terrifying force of primal power, and now she's just an ordinary, very scared child.

"So," you ask, "how did you meet that second tiny little guy, huh?"

"I... I was in the schoolyard, playing with Julie and Beth, but not Laura, because she wouldn't give me any of her candy yesterday, and we don't like her much anyway. And when I went to the corner to count, I looked at my feet because I don't like closing my eyes when it's daytime in case I see something scary in the dark. And I saw him there, waving up at me."

Sasha babbles on for a bit, and you conclude that you've heard the most important part of her tale. The creepy agent guy was at the school. He may have left some clues behind there, and now that the place is closed,it would be a perfect time to check it out, before another busy day of kids running around ruins any evidence that may be present.

Should you ask Maria to take you there for an investigation,or instead spend tonight merely helping Sasha come to terms with her condition?
13221221112121121221211112122221.title: Blather

choices: Maria interjected, desperate to console her daughter
Maria let you handle the situation
Maria laughs, losing her mind
132212211121211212212111121222212.content: You knew the schoolyard was a good bet, but you also knew it wasn't the best idea right now. Sasha finished her story and slowly started snivelling. When you saw this you knew you weren't going anywhere tonight. All of this must have been killing Maria inside, and neither of them were fit to do anything right now, of course you weren't in the best of conditions either. "...we should probably try to help Sasha adjust for right now." You said finally as you sat down and drew Sasha into your lap. "Don't worry Sasha, you'll be okay." You said as you noticed a weak smile on Maria's face.
132212211121211212212111121222212.title: Stay and relax

choices: Maria plucks her daughter off her nose.
Maria lets her daughter hold on as she transports you two to the living room.
Maria sneezes
1322122111212112122121111212222121.content:
"Now, Now." Maria's voice vibrated gently around the both of you. "Calm down, Sasha. Please, mommy will keep you safe." The poor kid continued sobbing.

"I want my mom." She cried. You feel both bothered and pitiful about her.

"And mommy would like you to stop making a fuss. Right, Maria?" Your choice of words are tactfully chosen. Maria looks confused for a moment before smiling gently as she understands.

"That's right. Come now, Sash." Her visage dominates the view over her palm; she carefully chose to hold the two of you so everything from the nose up is visible. Sasha dries her eyes and gazes up at her gigantic mother with awe rather than fear or sadness.

"M...Mommy?" She squeaks. "Is that really you?" Maria gives her a slow nod and answers.

"It's okay, Sasha. Our little friend here's helped me learn how to handle tiny people." Sasha looks around her, staring at the size of her mother's digits, before her look of amazement gives way to joy. She throws her arms up and, to your horror and that of your new giantess girlfriend, runs towards her face.

"Mommy's big!" Sasha cried out in glee. "I got a real big mommy!" Before you can run after her and cry out 'be careful' she practically leaps off the end of Maria's hand. You sigh with relief as you see her embracing the giantess's nose, with relief written on the landscape all around her.
1322122111212112122121111212222121.title: My Giant Mommy

choices: Maria picks both of you up.
Maria talks with the both of you some more.
Maria leaves the room to answer a knock at the front door
13221221112121121221211112122221211.content:
Maria lowers you down onto the tabletop, now devoid of all trace of the troublemaker. Stepping off you look up in wonder and compassion as giant mother and tiny daughter get some more-personal time. Maria focuses her eyes on the end of her nose to locate little Sasha and carefully brings her finger and thumb up, plucking her off as easily as taking a grain of rice off a worktop. The young lass squirms in her mother's grip as she's held in front of her mother's eye.

"Now, Sasha," Maria addresses her, "You really must take extra care. It's a long way down from my face and little girls can be very hard to spot when they're lying on the floor." The child's too far away for you to hear her, adding to the amazement that only that morning it was a thunderous force even at the distance that now separates the two of you. "You're gonna have to sort out your sense of distance all over again." The giantess sighed. "We must all try to adjust to these circumstances." Once again there's relative quiet as Maria listens to her daughter's tiny squeaking voice. "I'm not actually bigger now, dear. Truth is, somehow, you shrunk." Once again there's a pause as Sasha calls up to her mother; you just make out words like 'Me' and 'How' and 'What'. You watch as Maria now lowers her daughter down to you, releasing the little girl a few yards (your perspective) away from you. Sasha lies back and hold her sides.

"Mommy!" She complains. "That hurt!"

"I'm sorry, deary." She replies. "But you're only a quarter of an inch high or so right now, and I'm more used to holding little people either in the palm of my hand or riding on one of my fingers. You're flying leap at my nose meant I had to hold you in a pinch, especially since you seem rather keen to go scampering about like an ant." Sasha now looks around herself before she does a double-take at you.

"You're the little man I found this morning?" She checked, prompting you to give her a nod. She thinks back to how she held you. Maria's face dominates the skyline.

"You see." She whispers. "That's how it felt for him when you just snatched him up like that." The poor girl now looked ready to burst into tears again.

"Relax." You tell the child. "After some time in your mom's fist the aches were soothed away." Sasha gasped and looked up at Maria and began to do a twirl on the tabletop.

"I. Am. Tiny!" She cried in an unusually cheerful manner. "I'm like a fairy!" Both of you smile at the sight of the bug-size girl dancing with glee.
13221221112121121221211112122221211.title: A Giant's Words of Wisdom

choices: She decides to work on how to live with a shrunken family.
She decides to go to the school grounds.
She decides that she needs to consult with someone
132212211121211212212111121222212111.content:
As Sasha continues to dance across the tabletop you hear Maria sigh resignedly and the next thing you know her hand blocks the little girl's path, prompting her to land on her backside with an 'umph'. Before the child has a chance to get to her feet Maria scoops her up in her palm and then offer her hand to you; getting the idea you climb aboard and sit with Sasha in her gigantic palm. The giantess lifts you up to her eye level and stands up, swings round and begins to head back to the living room.

"This is real, Sasha." Maria tells her. "You can't just scurry about willy-nilly like in a Tom & Jerry cartoon. You need supervision when there's an edge you can fall off, even a tiny grown-up can help but if you run off like that he might not be able to stop your fall."

"Sorry, mommy." She replies, sitting in the middle of her mother's hand looking like you'd expect a chastised child to look when they know they were wrong. "It's just so cool."

"You didn't seem to think so when mommy wanted to hold you the first time." You comment.

"Being tiny's scary when you're not with mommy." Sasha quips. "Big mommy's wonderful."

"And who was it cowering behind me when mommy wanted to see your face." Sasha pouted but seemed to feel guilty.

"At any rate," Maria interjects as she sits back down on the sofa, "We all know where the land lies now. We'll have to get around this size difference thing and see how we can still have as normal a family life as possible."

"However," You point out, "That guy was at Sasha's school, so maybe we could find something there to help us resolve this before anyone can disrupt the evidence." Maria bit her lip as she looked down at you two, worried about the contradictory necessities.

"Mommy," Sasha calls up, "Don't do that! Your teeth are huge."

"Sorry, honey." She apologises, putting the forefinger of her free hand against her chin as she tried to decide what to do about this.
132212211121211212212111121222212111.title: Important Decisions

choices: Three days later...
Someone bursts in immediately
Three years later!
13221221112121121221211112122222.content:
"Wait, what? There's no body!" You exclaim.

Maria picked up a tiny envelope. "All that's left of him is this note."

You open the envelope and read it.

To Ms. Bristin:

We have gathered almost all of the anonymous and randomized shrinking test subjects. The test seems to be a success. Only one test subject is left to be accounted for, and he doesn't seem to want to cooperate. Subject is a 21-year old man in his final year of college. However, I have another target of interest that may get him to work with us. Once we retrieve all the test subjects and commence our research, then testing on an antidote may commence.

Sincerely, The Phantom

Sasha tried to read from your shoulder. "What does it say?"

You shake your head in disbelief. "It says something about research, and an antidote." Maybe this could be your ticket back to your original size?

Maria asked, "See if there's some kind of return address or name or something."

"Well, it's referring to a Phantom and Ms. Bristin, oh, and there's a watermark on the envelope that says Reduction Research and Development Corp. Maybe we should look that up."

Maria holds her hand out again, and both you and Sasha climb on top of Maria's hand. You both search the company's name and find that their main offices are about a three day drive away.

"Mom, what are we going to do now?"

Maria furiously turns off the computer and grabs her purse. "What am I going to do? I'm going to go down there and give them a piece of my mind!"
13221221112121121221211112122222.title: A note?

choices: Patience is a virtue,
but it's a BORING one!
Maria looks up from the magazine into the barrel of a gun
132212211121211212212111121222221.content:
Maria's mini-van comes to a stop. "Okay, we're here!"

You and Sasha wake up from the cup holder and climb out onto Maria's waiting hand. "Finally. I wasn't fond of sleeping in the cupholder." Sasha was still hiding behind you.

"Don't worry honey, Mommy will get this all taken care of." Maria walked in the front door and walked up to the front desk.

"May I help you?"

"Where's Ms. Bristin's office?"

"She's not seeing anyone right now, she's in a meeting."

"This is important, I need to see her right now!"

"I'm sorry, Ms. Bristin is a very busy woman and..."

Maria is furious. "No, you listen, I didn't travel for three days just to be told by some bimbo in a dead-end job that I have to turn around and go home!"

The secretary was unfazed. "Mam, you can wait in the lobby, but I can't say how long it may be."

Defeated, Maria sits down on the seats and picks up a magazine. She put you and Sasha in a sewed on shirt pocket your size. She occasionally peers at the secretary through the corner of her eye.
132212211121211212212111121222221.title: The Lobby

choices: ...in a meeting.
...in a "meeting."
...dead on the floor.
1322122111212112122121111212222212.content: The secretary turns around and Maria tells the two of you to hang on tight. Maria placed the magazine back on the table and darted off toward the elevator. You glance at a nearby directory and see that the CEO's office is on the 14th floor. The elevator slowly ascended and opened on the 14th floor. Maria walked out when another elevator opened to reveal a couple of burly security officers and the secretary from the front desk yelling, "There she is! Get her!" Maria started running blindly with you instructing her which way to go. You finally reached the CEO's office and you find her...
1322122111212112122121111212222212.title: The getaway!

choices: Choose Sasha. Do the noble thing.
Choose yourself. You didn't go through all that for nothing!
Maria chooses a third option, grabbing Bristin
13221221112121121221211112122222122.content:
You were shocked at what you saw. Behind the desk was the sexiest woman you've ever saw, next to Maria of course. The shades were pulled over the wall of windows and there were two scented candles on the corners of her desk, the woman herself lying on her side in her chair in a form-fitting orange dress. When she noticed you bursting in, she nearly fell out of her chair. When she sat up, the secretary had caught up to Maria.

"Miranda," she said in barely contained anger, "What is she doing here?"

Speaking at a mile a minute, she replied, "I'm sorry Ms. Bristin, she wanted to see you after I told her you were in a meeting and..."

"You know what," Ms. Bristin blew out her candles and she put on a business jacket over her dress. "let's hear it, since you were so eager to interrupt me."

"Well, one of your goons came and shrunk my daughter!"

Ms. Bristin looked distraught as Miranda raised an eyebrow. "Miranda, hold all my calls and reschedule my appointments." Miranda nodded and left the room. "So let me get this straight. Some guy came over and shrunk your daughter and you want to change her back. Well, I'll have to check your records and..."

"She's telling the truth!" You yell from your pocket.

"Wait, is that...?" You and Sasha crawled out of the pocket to Maria's open hand. The woman leaned forward to get a closer look at you. "It is you! You wouldn't believe the trouble we've had to go through to find you!"

"Wait, so this Phantom person,"

"Oh, his name is Ben. He loves being overly dramatic, making up code-names and stuff... although he really wanted to be called The Nameless. It seemed pretty awkward to call him by so he just stuck with Phantom."

"Wait, you know him?"

"Well, he is my husband."

You were stunned! That jerk was this babe's husband? "Wait,"

"You should really stop saying that. It's getting pretty annoying."

"That guy was your husband?"

"You better believe it!" a new voice cried out as the doors opened. You could barely make out the creeper at the door. He nimbly ran between Maria's feet and jumped/climbed up her desk.

"You made it! You're late!"

"I'm sorry Daisy. I just wanted to make sure my EVERYTHING was fully healed before I came." he said, clearly upset at Maria.

Maria was in disbelief. "That's impossible, I squashed you like a bug! How'd you survive?"

Ben sneers, "Please, it would take more than that to actually kill me. Although, you did cause a... fair amount of discomfort. As soon as you left to check your daughter, I simply teleported back here."

"You teleported? That's not very believable." Maria retorted.

"You're talking to a miniature man while your daughter and boyfriend are the size of a quarter. I think 'believable' has left the building."

Daisy added, "It's true, we specialize in a bunch of sciences that were supposedly taboo. Teleporting, shrinking, microwave pizzas..."

"You wouldn't believe how many test subjects we needed before we could perfect this technology. You have to get the sciences just right or else you get some nasty results. See, one's size doesn't change evenly. We had to do a whole bunch of work, and admittidly a bit of magic to keep you from freezing to death and so you can comprehend something more than breathing."

"Magic..." You would be inclined to not believe him, if it weren't for the fact that he was right, and that he demonstrated it back at the bar where you first met Maria.

Maria interrupted, "That's great and all..."

"Just call me Daisy.'

"I'm sorry Daisy, but I just came to see if you could unshrink my daughter and my boyfriend.'

"well, under normal circumstances, I would be inclined to help you. After all, I'm not heartless!"

"I told you, it was a side effect of the shrinking!" Ben said.

"Sure, blame the side effects! Anyways, I would love to help you, but there's a couple problems. Our data is still incomplete and we need just one more test subject to complete our data. If we just let you go, we'd need some other guy to shrink and that takes too much paperwork."

"And the other problem?"

"Well, you see..." Daisy leaned to the front of her desk. "You tried to kill my husband."

"Your husband threatened and shrunk my daughter!"

"Bad judgment aside..." Daisy said looking teasingly at Ben, "You still tried to kill my husband. In fact, if he weren't so smart, he would have died. So, I'm giving you a choice. You can only have one of them unshrunk. The other one has to stay with us until we finish."

"Wha... what kind of choice is that? You can't force me to chose between my loved ones!" Maria said baffled.

"I'm sorry, but I wasn't the one who nearly turned Ben here into a pancake! Besides, it's obvious that we hold all the cards here, so you might as well choose, because we don't just make fancy trinkets..."

Maria is looking at the two of you. Sasha is nearly breaking out into tears. You've got to convince Maria to do something.
13221221112121121221211112122222122.title: Meeting Daisy...

choices: Sasha acts fast
Daisy captures you both
Ben puts his arm around both of you
132212211121211212212111121222221221.content:
"It's okay," you tell Maria, "I'm more or less used to this right now, but it's not right to inflict this fate on a poor little girl."

Tears are welling in her eyes as she sets you both down by her feet, and you address her daughter next. "So kiddo, time to grow up, huh?"

Sasha doesn't quite get the joke, but laughs anyway. "You're funny."

"I try, I try."

You back away, not wanting to be inadvertantly crushed when the child expands to her true size. When it does happen, it's sudden, and you find yourself with no recollection of the process that transpired; you'd imagined there'd be stretching, or the bulging and expansion of one body part at a time. Instead,one moment a humungous foot is just there, once again big enough to flatten you without noticing.

There is a scream. Maybe the process hurt Sasha? If it did, you swear you'll find a way to get back at these jerks! But no, it wasn't as loud as the voice of a giantess should be; it was more like that of an ordinary-sized, adult human female...

Turning, you see Maria behind you, your scale, fallen to her hands and knees amongst the carpet fibres. The tears in her eyes are flowing free now, her head moving from side to side in an effort to take in the whole of the now-monstrous world around her.
